column1: line_number,speaker,text,label,file_name
1,TODD,"Good evening, and welcome to the MSNBC Democratic candidates debate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
2,MADDOW,We are super excited to be here at the University of New Hampshire.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
3,MADDOW,"Tonight, this is the first time that Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders have squared off exactly like this.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
4,MADDOW,"Face-to-face, just one-on-one, just the two of them.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
5,TODD,And neither party has seen this yet.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

6,TODD,"These candidates are both running for the Democratic nomination, but they are very different from each other when it comes to what matters most and how they would go about the job of being president.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
7,TODD,"Our job tonight is to draw out those differences so you, the voters, can understand them and be fully informed.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
8,MADDOW,And we do hope that the candidates will take this opportunity to show us the distinctions -- show us the differences between them.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
9,MADDOW,That's the whole reason that we're here tonight.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
10,MADDOW,We're not here for talking points.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
11,MADDOW,We're to learn about the difference between the candidates.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
12,MADDOW,"And with that, let's get going.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
13,MADDOW,Please join us in welcoming Secretary Hillary Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
14,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

15,TODD,"First, I want to say a special thanks to the New Hampshire union leader for helping make this debate possible, and the readers, who helped provide some of the questions and topics that we'll be addressing tonight.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
16,TODD,"The rules tonight, by the way, are simple",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
17,TODD,"90 seconds for answers, 30 seconds for follow-ups and rebuttals.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
18,MADDOW,"And with that, that's it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
19,MADDOW,We're going to begin with 60- second opening statements from each of the candidates.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
20,MADDOW,"And as agreed to in advance by the two campaigns, we're going to begin tonight with Senator Sanders.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
21,SANDERS,"Rachel, thank you very much.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
22,SANDERS,Millions of Americans are giving up on the political process.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
23,SANDERS,And they're giving up on the political process because they understand the economy is rigged.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
24,SANDERS,They are working longer hours for low wages.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
25,SANDERS,"They're worried about the future of their kids, and yet almost all new income and wealth is going to the top 1 percent.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
26,SANDERS,Not what America is supposed to be about.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
27,SANDERS,Not the fairness that we grew up believing that America was about.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

28,SANDERS,"And then sustaining that rigged economy is a corrupt campaign finance system undermining American democracy, where billionaire, Wall Street, corporate America can contribute unlimited sums of money into super PACs and into candidates.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
29,SANDERS,"Our job, together, is to end a rigged economy, create an economy that works for all, and absolutely overturn Citizens United.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
30,SANDERS,"One person, one vote.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
31,SANDERS,That's what American democracy is about.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
32,TODD,"Thank you, Senator.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
33,TODD,Secretary Clinton.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
34,CLINTON,"Well, I'm happy to be here in New Hampshire for this debate, as we move toward the primary on Tuesday.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

35,CLINTON,"I believe that America has the opportunity to once again live by our values, live up to our values in the 21st century, but I think that America can only do that if Americans can succeed.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
36,CLINTON,And there are lots of reasons why Americans today are feeling left out and left behind.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
37,CLINTON,"Yes, of course, the economy has not been working for most Americans.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
38,CLINTON,"Yes, of course, we have special interests that are unfortunately doing too much to rig the game.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

39,CLINTON,"But there's also the continuing challenges of racism, of sexism, of discrimination against the LGBT community, of the way that we treat people as opposed to how we want to be treated.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
40,CLINTON,I believe that we can get back on the right track.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

41,CLINTON,"I want to imagine a country where people's wages reflect their hard work, where we have healthcare for everyone, and where every child gets to live up to his or her potential.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
42,CLINTON,"I'm fighting for people who cannot wait for those changes, and I'm not making promises that I cannot keep.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
43,TODD,All right.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
44,TODD,Let's get started.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

45,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, last night you cited the Concord Monitor when you said of Senator Sanders that, quote, ""It's very hard to see how any of his proposals could ever be achievable.""",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

46,TODD,"So please tell us why you think if he's elected president on a platform of promising things like free public college and universal healthcare, that he cannot achieve those things.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
47,CLINTON,"Well, let me start by saying that Senator Sanders and I share some very big progressive goals.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
48,CLINTON,"I've been fighting for universal healthcare for many years, and we're now on the path to achieving it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
49,CLINTON,I don't want us to start over again.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

50,CLINTON,"I think that would be a great mistake, to once again plunge our country into a contentious debate about whether we should have and what kind of system we should have for healthcare.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
51,CLINTON,I want to build on the progress we've made; got from 90 percent coverage to 100 percent coverage.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
52,CLINTON,And I don't want to rip away the security that people finally have; 18 million people now have healthcare; preexisting conditions are no longer a bar.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
53,CLINTON,So we have a difference.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

54,CLINTON,"I also believe in affordable college, but I don't believe in free college, because every expert that I have talked to says, look, how will you ever control the costs.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
55,CLINTON,"What I want to do is make sure middle class kids, not Donald Trump's kids, get to be able to afford college.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
56,CLINTON,I want to get the economy going again.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
57,CLINTON,"It's not just enough about what we're against, as important as that is.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
58,CLINTON,"I have a plan to create new jobs, manufacturing, infrastructure, clean energy jobs that will make us the 21st century clean energy super power.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
59,CLINTON,I also want to make sure small businesses can start and grow again.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
60,CLINTON,"And of course, I believe in raising the minimum wage and equal pay for work.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
61,CLINTON,"But the numbers just don't add up, from what Senator Sanders has been proposing.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
62,CLINTON,"That's why all of the independent experts, all of the editorial boards that have vetted both of us have concluded that it is just not achievable.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
63,CLINTON,Let's go down a path where we can actually tell people what we will do.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
64,CLINTON,A progressive is someone who makes progress.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
65,CLINTON,That's what I intend to do.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
66,TODD,"Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
67,TODD,"Senator Sanders, so just explain how you spent nearly two decades in Congress and haven't gotten any of these things passed.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
68,TODD,"Why do you think as president you'll be able to achieve big, big new programs like this?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
69,SANDERS,"Well, I haven't quite run for president before.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
70,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
71,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
72,SANDERS,Let's deal with some of the comments that Secretary Clinton made.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
73,SANDERS,"And by the way, you know, sometimes there's a lot of drama here.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
74,SANDERS,I have known Secretary Clinton for 25 years and respect her very much.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
75,SANDERS,Here is the issue.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

76,SANDERS,"Every major country on earth, whether it's the U.K., whether it's France, whether it's Canada, has managed to provide healthcare to all people as a right and they are spending significantly less per capita on health care than we are.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
77,SANDERS,So I do not accept the belief that the United States of America can't do that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

78,SANDERS,I do not accept the belief that the United States of America and our government can't stand up to the ripoffs of the pharmaceutical industry which charge us by far the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
79,SANDERS,"Number two, in the economy today, everybody understands that we need a well educated workforce.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
80,SANDERS,This is 2016.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
81,SANDERS,"When we talk about public education, it can no longer be K through 12th grade.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
82,SANDERS,I do believe that public colleges and universities should be tuition free.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
83,SANDERS,"Well, how do we pay for that?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
84,SANDERS,It's an expensive proposition.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
85,SANDERS,"I do believe that we should substantially lower student debt in this country, which is crushing millions of people.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
86,SANDERS,"We pay for it, in my view, by a tax on Wall Street speculation.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
87,SANDERS,The middle class bailed out Wall Street in their time of need.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
88,SANDERS,"Now, it is Wall Street's time to help the middle class.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
89,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
90,CLINTON,If I could just follow up on that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
91,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
92,CLINTON,"There is no disagreement between us on universal coverage for health care, the disagreement is where do we start from and where do we end up.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
93,CLINTON,"The Republicans want to repeal the Affordable Care Act, I want to improve it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
94,CLINTON,"I want to build on it, get the costs down, get prescription drug costs down.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
95,CLINTON,Senator Sanders wants us to start all over again.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
96,CLINTON,"This was a major achievement of President Obama, of our country.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
97,CLINTON,It is helping people right now.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
98,CLINTON,I am not going to wait and have us plunge back into a contentious national debate that has very little chance of succeeding.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
99,CLINTON,Let's make the Affordable Care Act work for everybody.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
100,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
101,SANDERS,Let me...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
102,TODD,Go.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
103,SANDERS,... this is a good discussion here.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
104,TODD,"Yes, go ahead.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
105,SANDERS,And let me just say this.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
106,SANDERS,"As Secretary Clinton may know, I am on the Health Education Labor Committee.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
107,SANDERS,That committee wrote the Affordable Care Act.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
108,SANDERS,The idea I would dismantle health care in America while we're waiting to pass a Medicare for all is just not accurate.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

109,SANDERS,"The Affordable Care Act has clearly, as Secretary Clinton made the point, done a lot of good things, but, what it has not done is dealt with the fact we have 29 million people today who have zero health insurance, we have even more who are underinsured with large deductibles and copayments and prescription drug prices are off the wall.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

110,SANDERS,"So I do believe that in the future, not by dismantling what we have here -- I helped write that bill -- but by moving forward, rallying the American people, I do believe we should have health care for all.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
111,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
112,TODD,"All right, thank you both.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
113,TODD,Rachel.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

114,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, Senator Sanders is campaigning against you now, at this point in the campaign, basically arguing that you are not progressive enough to be the Democratic nominee.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

115,MADDOW,"He has said that if you voted for the Iraq war, if you are in favor of the death penalty, if you wobbled on things like the Keystone Pipeline or TPP, if you said single payer health care could never happen, then you're too far to the right of the Democratic Party to be the party's standard bearer.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
116,MADDOW,"Given those policy positions, why should liberal Democrats support you and not Senator Sanders?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
117,CLINTON,Well because I am a progressive who gets things done.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
118,CLINTON,"And the root of that word, progressive, is progress.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
119,CLINTON,"But I've heard Senator Sanders comments, and it's really caused me to wonder who's left in the progressive wing of the Democratic Party.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

120,CLINTON,"Under his definition, President Obama is not progressive because he took donations from Wall Street; Vice President Biden is not progressive because she supported Keystone; Senator Shaheen is not progressive because she supports the trade pact.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
121,CLINTON,"Even the late, great Senator Paul Wellstone would not fit this definition because he voted for DOMA.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
122,CLINTON,"You know, we have differences and, honestly, I think we should be talk about what we want to do for the country.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
123,CLINTON,"But if we're going to get into labels, I don't think it was particularly progressive to vote against the Brady Bill five times.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
124,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
125,CLINTON,I don't think it was progressive to vote to give gun makers and sellers immunity.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
126,CLINTON,I don't think it was progressive to vote against Ted Kennedy's immigration reform.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
127,CLINTON,"So we could go back and forth like this, but the fact is most people watching tonight want to know what we've done and what we will do.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

128,CLINTON,"That's why I am laying out a specific agenda that will make more progress, get more jobs with rising incomes, get us to universal health care coverage, get us to universal pre-k, paid family leave and the other elements of what I think will build a strong economy, that will ensure Americans keep making progress.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
129,CLINTON,That's what I'm offering and that's what I will do as president.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
130,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
131,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, have you established a list of what it means to be a progressive that is unrealistic?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
132,SANDERS,"No, not at all.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
133,SANDERS,Here's the reality of American economic life today.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
134,SANDERS,The reality is that we have one of lowest voter turnouts of any major country on earth because so many people have given up on the political process.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
135,SANDERS,The reality is that there has been trillions of dollars of wealth going from the middle class in the last 30 years to the top 1/10th of 1 percent.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
136,SANDERS,The reality is we that have a corrupt campaign finance system which separates the American people's needs and desires from what Congress is doing.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

137,SANDERS,"So to my mind, what we have got to do is wage a political revolution where millions of people have given up on the political process, stand up and fight back, demand the government that represents us and not just a handful of campaign contribution -- contributors.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
138,SANDERS,"Now all of the ideas that I'm talking about, they are not radical ideas.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
139,SANDERS,"Making public colleges and universities tuition free, that exists in countries all over the world, used to exist in the United States.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

140,SANDERS,"Rebuilding our crumbling infrastructure, and creating 13 million jobs by doing away with tax loopholes that large corporations now enjoy by putting their money into the Cayman Islands and other tax havens.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
141,SANDERS,That is not a radical idea.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
142,SANDERS,"What we need to do is to stand up to the big money interests, and the campaign contributors.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
143,SANDERS,"When we do that, we can, in fact, transform America.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
144,MADDOW,Thank you Senator.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
145,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
146,TODD,"I'd like to follow up on a comment that Secretary Clinton said, Senator.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
147,TODD,President Obama has not called for abolishing the death penalty.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
148,TODD,"President Obama is for the big Asian trade deal known as TPP, and just yesterday you said you can't be both a moderate or a progressive, but you can't be both.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
149,TODD,"Is President Obama, in your judgment, based on these policies positions, a progressive?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
150,SANDERS,Let me just pick up on this point.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
151,SANDERS,"This whole discussion began because I commented, not making overall evaluation about the Secretary.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

152,SANDERS,"She was in Ohio, I think, in September or November and she got up and said something like, I have been -- I'm paraphrasing, I have been criticized because people think I'm a moderate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
153,SANDERS,"Well, I am a moderate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
154,SANDERS,That's where this came from.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
155,SANDERS,It wasn't me paraphrasing her.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
156,SANDERS,"It is what she said, and all that I said was there's nothing wrong with being a moderate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
157,SANDERS,"But, you can't be a moderate, you can't a progressive.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
158,SANDERS,"In terms of President Obama, I think if we remember where this country was seven years ago, 800,000 jobs being lost every month, $1.4 trillion dollar deficit.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
159,SANDERS,The world's financial system on the verge of collapse.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
160,SANDERS,"I think that President Obama, Vice President Biden, and the Democratic leadership in the House and the Senate have done a fantastic job.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
161,SANDERS,"We are in much better shape than we were seven years ago, although my Republican colleagues seem to have forgotten where we were seven years ago.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
162,SANDERS,"That's the fact, but, we still have a very long way to go.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
163,SANDERS,Do I think President Obama is a progressive?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
164,SANDERS,"Yes, I do.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
165,SANDERS,I disagree with him on a number of issues including the trade agreement.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
166,SANDERS,"But, yes, I think he has done an excellent job.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
167,CLINTON,"Well, Chuck...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
168,TODD,"... (inaudible) Clinton, go ahead...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
169,CLINTON,"If I could, you know, in the very first debate I was asked am I a moderate or a progressive and I said I'm a progressive who likes to get things done.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

170,CLINTON,"Cherry picking a quote here or there doesn't change my record of having fought for racial justice, having fought for kids rights, having fought the kind of inequities that fueled my interest in service in the first place going back to my days in the Children's Defense Fund.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
171,CLINTON,It certainly didn't stop me from taking on the drug companies and the insurance companies.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

172,CLINTON,"Before it was called Hillarycare -- I mean, before it was called ObamaCare it was called Hillarycare because we took them on, and we weren't successful, but we kept fighting and we got the children's health insurance program.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
173,CLINTON,"Every step along the way I have stood up, and fought, and have the scars to prove it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
174,CLINTON,"So, again...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
175,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
176,CLINTON,"I think it's important that, look, I understand Senator Sanders really trying to distinguish himself.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

177,CLINTON,"I understand that, that's what you do in campaigns, but at the same time let's not be -- in, I think an unfair way, making an accusation, or making an attack about where I stand and about where I've always stood.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

178,CLINTON,"It is fair to say, Senator, that in your definition, as you being the self-proclaimed gatekeeper for progressivism, I don't know anyone else who fits that definition, but I know a lot of really hard fighting progressives in the Democratic party who have stood up time, and time again against special interests, against the powerful on behalf of those who are left behind and left out.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
179,CLINTON,"And, that's what we ought to be celebrating.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
180,CLINTON,"Let's talk about what we would do as President, and Commander in Chief to make sure the progress continues into the future.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
181,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
182,TODD,"(inaudible) 30 seconds, and then we'll move.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
183,SANDERS,"That's right, I mean, instead of arguing about definitions, let's talk about...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
184,CLINTON,"... Well, you began it yesterday with your comments...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
185,SANDERS,"... What we should do, and one of the things we should do is not only talk the talk, but walk the walk.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
186,SANDERS,"I am very proud to be the only candidate up here who does not have a Super PAC, who's not raising huge sums of money from Wall Street...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
187,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
188,SANDERS,... And special interests.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
189,SANDERS,I am enormously proud.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
190,SANDERS,"Never believed it would happen that we have raised 3.5 million individual contributions, averaging $27 dollars a piece.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
191,SANDERS,That is what the political revolution means.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
192,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
193,TODD,Thank you.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
194,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, as a Vermonter, you have almost a home state advantage here in New Hampshire.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
195,MADDOW,"But back home across the border, you also have a long history of running against Democrats as a third-party candidate, for governor, Senate, for Congress.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
196,MADDOW,In 1988 your candidacy as a third-party candidate arguably cost the Democrats a congressional seat and sent a Republican instead.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
197,MADDOW,How can you lead the Democratic Party nationally when you have not been a member of the Democratic Party until very recently?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
198,SANDERS,"Well, Rachel, actually, that wasn't accurate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
199,SANDERS,"In 1988 the Republican did win, I believe, by 3 points.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
200,SANDERS,I came in second.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
201,SANDERS,"It was 34-31, I think, 19 for the Democrat.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
202,SANDERS,"In that race the Democrat was the spoiler, not me.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
203,SANDERS,And it is true...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

205,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
206,SANDERS,"It is true, it's not to be denied, I am the longest- serving independent in the history of the United States Congress.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

208,SANDERS,That is true.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
209,SANDERS,"But on the other hand, I have -- when I was in the House for 16 years, I caucused with the Democrats.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

212,SANDERS,"And now am the rankings member on the Budget Committee, leader of the Democrats in opposition to the majority Republicans.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
213,SANDERS,I am running for president as a Democrat.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

214,SANDERS,"And if elected, not only do I hope to bring forth a major change in national priorities, but let me be frank, I do want to see major changes in the Democratic Party.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

245,CLINTON,"Well, look, I've got to just jump in here because, honestly, Senator Sanders is the only person who I think would characterize me, a woman running to be the first woman president, as exemplifying the establishment.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
246,CLINTON,And I've got to tell you that it is...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

257,CLINTON,"I'm not going to tell people that I will raise your incomes and not your taxes, and not mean it, because I don't want to see the kind of struggle that the middle class is going through exemplified by these promises that would raise taxes and make it much more difficult for many, many Americans to get ahead and stay ahead.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

262,SANDERS,"To my mind, if we do not get a handle on money in politics and the degree to which big money controls the political process in this country, nobody is going to bring about the changes that is needed in this country for the middle class and working families.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

265,CLINTON,"I've tried to keep my disagreements over issues, as it should be.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

266,CLINTON,"But time and time again, by innuendo, by insinuation, there is this attack that he is putting forth, which really comes down to -- you know, anybody who ever took donations or speaking fees from any interest group has to be bought.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
267,CLINTON,"And I just absolutely reject that, Senator.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
268,CLINTON,And I really don't think these kinds of attacks by insinuation are worthy of you.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
269,CLINTON,And enough is enough.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
270,CLINTON,"If you've got something to say, say it directly.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
271,CLINTON,But you will not find that I ever changed a view or a vote because of any donation that I ever received.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
272,SANDERS,What...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

298,SANDERS,"Let's ask why it is that we pay, by far, the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs, and your medicine can be doubled tomorrow, and there's nothing that the government can do to stop it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

308,SANDERS,"And in my view, it is undermining American democracy and it is allowing Congress to represent wealthy campaign contributors and not the working families of this country.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

347,TODD,"Senator Sanders, you were talking about all of your campaign contributions and campaign finance reform.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
348,TODD,You rail against big money in politics.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
349,TODD,"But do you realize there is one public financing system that we do have in place, and it is -- it is in place to run for president.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
350,TODD,Why aren't you walking the walk on that?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
351,TODD,Why aren't you participating in the presidential public financing system which is designed to essentially keep big money out of presidential politics?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
352,SANDERS,"Chuck, actually we looked at it, but it turns out to be a disaster.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
353,SANDERS,"The way it is structured right now, if you make it all the way to California, you could do pretty well.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
354,SANDERS,"But in terms of the early states -- Iowa, New Hampshire, the other states -- it just doesn't work.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
355,SANDERS,Your point is well taken.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
356,SANDERS,"I believe in public funding of elections, absolutely.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
357,SANDERS,But this system is -- I don't know if the secretary would agree -- is currently very antiquated and no longer applies to modern day politics.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
358,TODD,"Well, going on that then, why criticize her on Super PACs, and you got -- and all this when it is -- you know, that's the system?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
359,TODD,"I mean, you could be participating in a publicly-financing -- public financing system...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
360,SANDERS,But if the...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
361,TODD,... and being able to set -- being able to set an example.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
362,SANDERS,"-- but Chuck, it is a public financing system that everybody knows is antiquated.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
363,SANDERS,It no longer works.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
364,SANDERS,Nobody can become president based on that system.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
365,SANDERS,So what's the alternative?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
366,SANDERS,There are two alternatives.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
367,SANDERS,"And, you know, we looked at it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
368,SANDERS,"Well, should we do a Super PAC, but I concluded, honestly, I don't represent Corporate America or billionaires, I didn't want it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
369,SANDERS,So the other alternative was to ask working families and the middle class to help out in a transformational campaign.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
370,SANDERS,And you know what?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
371,SANDERS,"We got 3.5 million individual contributions, $27 a piece.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
372,SANDERS,I think that's pretty good.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
373,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
374,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, on the issue of Wall Street...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
375,CLINTON,On the issue of Wall Street.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

376,MADDOW,"... on the issue of Wall Street, when our reporters go out and talk to people on the ground in the early states, what they tell us over and over again when they find voters who are leaning toward Senator Sanders rather than yourself is that the most frequent area of concern that they hear from those voters is the issue of Wall Street and whether or not you are too close to Wall Street.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
377,MADDOW,"Last night, when you were asked about speaking fees and the amount of speaking fees you got from Goldman Sachs speeches, you said that's what they offered.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
378,MADDOW,Have you been too dismissive of voters' concerns about this issue in your own campaign and your own career?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
379,CLINTON,"Well you know, Rachel, I think I may not have done the job I should in explaining my record.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

380,CLINTON,"You know, I did -- when I left the secretary of State's office, like so many former officials, military leaders, journalists, others, I did go on the speaking circuit.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
381,CLINTON,"I spoke to heart doctors, I spoke to the American Camping Association, I spoke to auto dealers, and yes, I spoke to firms on Wall Street.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
382,CLINTON,"They wanted me to talk about the world, what my experience had been as secretary of State.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
383,CLINTON,But what I want people to know is I went to Wall Street before the crash.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
384,CLINTON,I was the one saying you're going to wreck the economy because of these shenanigans with mortgages.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
385,CLINTON,I called to end the carried interest loophole that hedge fund managers enjoy.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
386,CLINTON,I proposed changes in CEO compensation.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
387,CLINTON,I called for a consumer protection financial bureau before it was created.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

388,CLINTON,And I think the best evidence that the Wall Street people at least know where I stand and where I have always stood is because they are trying to beat me in this primary.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
389,CLINTON,They have collected and spent as much as $6 million on these ads.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
390,CLINTON,"Hedge fund billionaires, Karl Rove, another billionaire, jumped in.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
391,CLINTON,And why are they doing that?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
392,CLINTON,These are guys who try to make smart investments.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
393,CLINTON,"They know my record, they know me, they know that I say what I believe and I will do it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

395,CLINTON,"So I do want people to know that, and I think it's important for everybody to understand I have a record, I have stood firm and I will be the person who prevents them from ever wrecking the economy again.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
