397,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, you have been a critic of Secretary Clinton taking those speaking fees and having donations from Wall Street.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
398,MADDOW,What about her defense of her record?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
399,SANDERS,Let me just say this.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
400,SANDERS,Wall Street is perhaps the most powerful economic and political force in this country.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
401,SANDERS,"You have companies like Goldman Sachs, who just recently paid a settlement fine with the federal government for $5 billion for defrauding investors.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
402,SANDERS,Goldman Sachs was one of those companies whose illegal activity helped destroy our economy and ruin the lives of millions of Americans.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
403,SANDERS,But this is what a rigged economy and a corrupt campaign finance system and a broken criminal justice is about.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

404,SANDERS,"These guys are so powerful that not one of the executives on Wall Street has been charged with anything after paying, in this case of Goldman Sachs, a $5 billion fine.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
405,SANDERS,"Kid gets caught with marijuana, that kid has a police record.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
406,SANDERS,"A Wall Street executive destroys the economy, $5 billion settlement with the government, no criminal record.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
407,SANDERS,That is what power is about.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
408,SANDERS,That is what corruption is about.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
409,SANDERS,And that is what has to change in the United States of America.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
410,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
411,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
412,CLINTON,"If I could, let me just say that of course it has to change.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
413,CLINTON,It has to change.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
414,CLINTON,And that's why I have put forward a plan to do just that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
415,CLINTON,"And it's been judged to be the toughest, most effective and comprehensive one.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
416,CLINTON,I have great respect for Senator Sanders's commitment to try to restore Glass-Steagall.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
417,CLINTON,But I do not believe that that is enough.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
418,CLINTON,"And in fact, I don't believe it really addresses a lot of the biggest issues we have.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
419,CLINTON,"You know, we now have power under the Dodd-Frank legislation to break up banks.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
420,CLINTON,And I've said I will use that power if they pose a systemic risk.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
421,CLINTON,"But I want to go further, because it was investment banks, it was insurance companies, it was mortgage companies, all of which contributed.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
422,CLINTON,So let's not just be narrowly focused on one part of the problem.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
423,CLINTON,We have a lot of issues with corporate power that have to be addressed.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
424,CLINTON,My plan takes us further and it would do the job.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
425,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
426,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

427,SANDERS,"I would say that -- that folks who have looked at this issue for a long time, whether it's Elizabeth Warren or many other economists, will tell you that right now, yes, we do need a 21st century Glass-Steagall legislation.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

428,SANDERS,"And I would tell you also that when you have three out of the four largest banks in America today, bigger than they were -- significantly bigger than when we bailed them out because they were too big to fail, I think if Teddy Roosevelt were alive today, a good Republican by the way, what he would say is: Break them up; they are too powerful economically; they are too powerful politically.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
429,SANDERS,And that is what I believe and many economists believe.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
430,SANDERS,Time to break them up.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
431,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
432,CLINTON,"Look we have a law -- look, you know, I -- I appreciate the senator's advocacy.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
433,CLINTON,We have a law.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
434,CLINTON,It was passed.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
435,CLINTON,It was signed by President Obama.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
436,CLINTON,It lays out a process that you go through to determine whether a systemic risk is posed.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
437,CLINTON,"And by the way, President Obama signed that, pushed it through, even though he took donations from Wall Street, because he's a responsible president.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
438,CLINTON,So we have a law in place.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
439,CLINTON,"If the circumstances warrant it, I will certainly use it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
440,CLINTON,"And from what you say, I know you will as well.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
441,CLINTON,But that is not enough.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

442,CLINTON,"And I keep going back to this because part of the reason the Wall Street guys are trying so hard to stop me -- the hedge fund guys, the shadow banking guys -- is because I've got their number on all of that.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
443,CLINTON,And my plan goes so much further to try to prevent the problems of the future.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
444,CLINTON,"You know, we can't just fight the last war.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
445,CLINTON,"We've got to be prepared to stop these guys if they ever try to use their economic power once again, to hurt the economy, and to hurt so many Americans.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

446,CLINTON,"And my plan, Paul Krugman, Barney Frank, a lot of experts who understand what the new challenges might be, have said I am exactly on point, and the Wall Street guys actually know that.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
447,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
448,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
449,TODD,... she has had more people praise her plan than yours.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
450,SANDERS,"Well, we've had a number of economists supporting our legislation.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
451,SANDERS,And here's where we are.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
452,SANDERS,The American people can judge.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
453,SANDERS,Six largest financial institutions in America today have assets of roughly $10 trillion; equivalent to 58 percent of the GDP of the United States of America.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
454,SANDERS,That is a lot of money.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

455,SANDERS,"They issue two thirds of the credit cards, and by the way they're ripping off a whole lot of people with high interest rates on the credit cards, and they write about one third of the mortgages.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
456,SANDERS,That is a lot of power for six financial institutions.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
457,SANDERS,That's it.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
458,SANDERS,I think it is too much power.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
459,SANDERS,"Too much economic power, too much political power, and the economists that I talk to say we should break them up.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
460,TODD,Thank you both.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
461,TODD,"Let me move on to our next question here, and in fact it comes to us through New England Cable News.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
462,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, it's addressed to you, and it's about this issue of the speeches, particularly to Goldman Sachs.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
463,TODD,This is what the questioner wrote verbatim.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

464,TODD,"I am concerned with the abuses of Wall Street has taken with the American taxpayers money, and then she asks whether you would release the transcripts of your Goldman Sachs speeches, and then added, ""Don't you think the voting public has a right to know what was said?""",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
465,TODD,"But, let's make that bigger.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
466,TODD,Are you willing to release the transcripts of all your paid speeches?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
467,TODD,We do know through reporting that there were transcription services for all of those paid speeches.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
468,TODD,"In full disclosure, would you release all of them?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
469,CLINTON,I will look into it.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
470,CLINTON,"I don't know the status, but I will certainly look into it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

471,CLINTON,"But, I can only repeat what is the fact that I spoke to a lot of different groups with a lot of different constituents, a lot of different kinds of members about issues that had to do with world affairs.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
472,CLINTON,I probably described more times than I can remember how stressful it was advising the President about going after Bin Laden.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
473,CLINTON,My view on this is look at my record.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
474,CLINTON,"Look at what I am proposing, and -- we have a vigorous agreement here.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
475,CLINTON,We both want to reign in the excesses of Wall Street.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

476,CLINTON,"I also want to reign in the excesses of Johnson Controls that we bailed out when they were an autoparts company, and we saved the auto industry, and now they want to avoid paying taxes.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
477,CLINTON,"I want to go after the pharmaceutical companies like Valeant, and Turns that are increasing prices without any regard to the impact on people's health.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
478,CLINTON,"Now, if all we're going to talk about is one part of our economy, and indeed one streak in our economy, we're missing the big oil companies.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
479,CLINTON,We're missing other big energy companies.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
480,CLINTON,"We're missing the big picture, and I have a record of trying to go at the problems that actually exist, and I will continue to do that.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
481,TODD,"Senator, you sound like you want to respond.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
482,TODD,Go ahead.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
483,SANDERS,"Yeah, I do.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
484,SANDERS,"I agree with much of what the Secretary said, but, madam Secretary, it is not one streak.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
485,SANDERS,Wall Street is an entity of unbelievable economic and political power.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
486,SANDERS,That's a fact.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
487,SANDERS,"And, I want to say something, and it may sound harsh, not to you, but to the American people.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
488,SANDERS,"In a sense, in my view, the business model of Wall Street is fraud.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
489,SANDERS,It's fraud.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

490,SANDERS,"I believe that corruption is rampant, and the fact that major bank after major bank has reached multi billion dollar settlements with the United States government when we have a weak regulator system tells me that not only did we have to bail them out once, if we don't start breaking them up, we're going to have to bail them out again, and I do not want to see that happen...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
491,CLINTON,"... Well, Senator, no one wants to see that happen.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

492,CLINTON,"I mean, look, I care deeply about this because just like you I have met so many people who had their life savings wiped out, who lost their homes, who are barely back with their heads above water.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
493,CLINTON,"This was a disaster for our country, and we can never let that happen again.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
494,CLINTON,We have no disagreement about this.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

495,CLINTON,"But, I think it's a broader target list than just Wall Street, and I believe that we have to be very focused on how we try to take back the power and increase the empowerment of the American people.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

496,CLINTON,"And, I think I have that kind of experience, maybe because they've beat me up for so many years, and I know exactly how to handle them because I've been in the arena with them time and time again.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
497,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, let me turn to, I think, where this direction is heading anyway, which is the broader issue of big business and power in our political system.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
498,MADDOW,"You on the campaign trail have railed against big name American corporations like Boeing, and General Electric, and Wal Mart.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

499,MADDOW,"But, some big businesses in this country have also been part of advancing progressive goals like that nationwide initiative to expand employment opportunities for veterans.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
500,MADDOW,That was all about cooperation between the Obama administration and some very big business.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
501,MADDOW,"The Affordable Care Act, some of the thorniest problems in that bill were worked out in cooperation with big business in order to accomplish progressive goals.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
502,MADDOW,"Could you work with them, or have you made enemies of big business in this country with the way you've approached them in this campaign?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
503,SANDERS,"Of course I can work with them, but let's be clear.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
504,SANDERS,"When I talked about Boeing and I talked about General Electric, what I was referring to is an outrage.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
505,SANDERS,I suspect the secretary agrees request me.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

506,SANDERS,"Right now you have a loophole such that these guys are putting their profits, multi-billion dollar profitable corporations putting billions of dollars into the Cayman Islands, Bermuda, and other tax havens.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

507,SANDERS,"And in a given year, Rachel, after making billions of dollars in profit, do you know how much they're paying in taxes to the United States government in a given year?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
508,SANDERS,Zero.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
509,SANDERS,Now explain to me how that makes any sense at all.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
510,SANDERS,"So what I have said with regard to Boeing and GE and other multinationals that pay zero taxes, you know what we're going to do?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
511,SANDERS,We're going to end that loophole.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
512,SANDERS,They are going to pay their fair share of taxes.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
513,SANDERS,We're going to use that money to rebuild our infrastructure and create up to 13 million jobs.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
514,SANDERS,Can I work with corporations?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
515,SANDERS,Are there good corporations doing incredible cutting edge research and development?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
516,SANDERS,Absolutely they are.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
517,SANDERS,And we should be proud of them.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

518,SANDERS,"But on the other hand, there are many corporations who have turned their backs on the American worker, who have said, if I can make another nickel in profit by going to China and shutting down in the United States of America, that's what I will do.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

519,SANDERS,I will do my best to transform our trade policy and take on these corporations who want to invest in low-income countries around the world rather than in the United States of America.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
520,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
521,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, thank you.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
522,MADDOW,"And with that, we're going to take a break.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
523,TODD,We'll be right back.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
524,TODD,And we're going to get to trade and a lot of other issues.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
525,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
526,SYSTEM,(COMMERCIAL BREAK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
527,MADDOW,Welcome back -- welcome back to the Democratic candidates' debate.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
528,MADDOW,"We're going to be talking about America in the world, both in terms of some trade issues, but also national security.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
529,MADDOW,"And Secretary Clinton, we're going to start with you.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
530,MADDOW,"There are more than 4,000 American troops back in Iraq right now as part of the fight against ISIS.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
531,MADDOW,"It has been 15 straight years of wars and multiple deployments for America's military families, who have borne such a disproportionate burden.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
532,MADDOW,Is President Obama right to keep escalating the number of U.S. troops that's fighting ISIS right now?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

533,CLINTON,"Well, I think what the president understands, and what he's trying to do, is that we have to support the Arab and Kurdish fighters on the ground who are actually doing the fighting.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
534,CLINTON,I agree with the president.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
535,CLINTON,"I've said myself, we will not send American combat troops back to either Syria or Iraq -- that is off the table.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

536,CLINTON,"But we do have special forces, we do have trainers, we do have the military personnel who are helping with the airstrikes that the United States is leading so that we can try to take out ISIS infrastructure, take out their leadership.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

537,CLINTON,"And I think that, given the threat that ISIS poses to the region and beyond, as we have sadly seen in our own country, it is important to keep the Iraqi army on a path where they can actually take back territory, to work with the Sunni tribes in Anbar province and elsewhere so that their fighters can be also deployed, to work with the Kurds to provide them the support, but they're doing the fighting.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
538,CLINTON,We're doing the support and enabling.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

539,CLINTON,"And I also think we've got to do more to stop foreign fighters, foreign funding and take ISIS on online, as well as doing everything necessary to keep us safe at home.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

540,"So as I look at what the president it doing, it adds up to me. We just have to keep -- try to get more support for those people on the ground in Syria and Iraq who have to actually physically take the territory back. MADDOW","To be clear, to the specific question, if that strategic goal that you're describing requires considerably more of Americans -- an ever-increasing number of Americans in Iraq and maybe in Syria, are you OK with the numbers increasing?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
541,CLINTON,No.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
542,CLINTON,"I mean, of course that's a theoretical question, and we don't know what it would be for, and we don't know how many numbers there are.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
543,CLINTON,I am against American combat troops being in Syria and Iraq.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
544,CLINTON,I support special forces.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
545,CLINTON,I support trainers.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
546,CLINTON,I support the air campaign.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
547,CLINTON,And I think we're making some progress.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
548,CLINTON,"I want to continue to intensify that, and that's exactly what the president is doing.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
549,MADDOW,"Thank you, Madam Secretary.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
550,TODD,"Go ahead, Senator Sanders -- 30 seconds, your response.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

551,SANDERS,"OK. Let me agree with much of what the secretary said, but where we have a different background on this issue is we differ on the war in Iraq, which created barbaric organizations like ISIS.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

552,SANDERS,"Not only did I vote against that war, I helped lead the opposition, and if you go to my website, berniesanders.com, you will see the statement that I made in 2002.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
553,SANDERS,"And it gives me no pleasure to tell you that much of what I feared would happen the day after Saddam Hussein was overthrown, in fact, did happen.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
554,TODD,All right.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
555,TODD,"Senator, I want to stay, though...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
556,CLINTON,If I could -- if I could...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
557,TODD,Go ahead.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
558,TODD,30 seconds.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
559,CLINTON,"... respectfully add -- look, we did differ.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
560,CLINTON,A vote in 2002 is not a plan to defeat ISIS.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
561,CLINTON,We have to look at the threats that we face right now...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
562,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
563,CLINTON,... and we have to be prepared to take them on and defeat them.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
564,TODD,Let me -- let -- we're gonna -- we're staying -- we're staying basically on this topic.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

565,TODD,"Obviously you've been emphasizing this difference on the Iraq war, but one place where you do agree, and one place where you voted to authorize the use of force, was in favor of the war in Afghanistan.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
566,TODD,"Right now, it is possible President Obama is going to be leaving the next president, perhaps President Sanders, at least 10,000 troops in Afghanistan.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
567,TODD,How long will those troops be in Afghanistan under President Sanders?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

568,SANDERS,"Well, I think our great task is to make certain that our young men and women in the military do not get sucked into never- ending, perpetual warfare within the quagmire of Syria and Iraq.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
569,SANDERS,And I will do my very best to make sure that that doesn't happen.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
570,SANDERS,I agree with the secretary that I think what has to happen -- and let me just mention what King Abdullah of Jordan said.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
571,SANDERS,I think he hit the nail on the head.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
572,SANDERS,And what he said is essentially the war against ISIS is a war for the soul of Islam.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
573,SANDERS,"And it must be Muslim troops on the ground that will destroy ISIS, with the support of a coalition of major powers -- U.S., U.K., France, Germany and Russia.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
574,SANDERS,So our job is to provide them the military equipment that they need; the air support they need; special forces when appropriate.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

575,SANDERS,"But at the end of the day for a dozen different reasons, not the least of which is that ISIS would like American combat troops on the ground so they could reach out to the Muslim world and say, ""Look, we're taking on those terrible Americans.""",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
576,SANDERS,The combat on the ground must be done by Muslim troops with our support.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
577,SANDERS,We must not get involved in perpetual warfare in the Middle East.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
578,TODD,Can you address a question on Afghanistan?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
579,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
580,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
581,TODD,How long are these troops going to be there?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
582,TODD,"If President Obama leaves you 10,000 troops, how long do you think they're going to be there?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
583,SANDERS,"Well, you can't simply withdraw tomorrow.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
584,SANDERS,"Wish we could, and allow, you know, the Taliban or anybody else to reclaim that country.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

585,SANDERS,"But what we must do, and what we have seen in recent months, is some progress in Iraq, where finally the Iraqi army, which has not been a particularly effective fighting force, retook Ramadi.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
586,SANDERS,ISIS has lost I think 40 percent of the territory that it held in the last year.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

587,SANDERS,"Hopefully, and you know, one can't predict the future, that maybe our training and their fighting capabilities are improving and we are going to make some progress in destroying ISIS.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
588,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, 30 seconds: How long are these troops going to be in Afghanistan?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
589,TODD,We have more American troops in Afghanistan than what we were talking about with Iraq.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
590,CLINTON,"Oh, absolutely.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
591,CLINTON,The president decided to leave more troops than he had originally planned in Afghanistan.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
592,CLINTON,"We have a very cooperative government there, with Ashraf Ghani and his top -- his top partner, Abdullah.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
593,CLINTON,And they are doing their very best.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
594,CLINTON,And the Afghan army is actually fighting.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
595,CLINTON,The Afghan army is taking heavy losses defending Afghan territory.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
596,CLINTON,And I would have to make an evaluation based on the circumstances at the time I took office as to how much help they continue to need.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
597,CLINTON,Because it's not just the Taliban.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
598,CLINTON,"We now are seeing outposts of, you know, fighters claiming to be affiliated with ISIS.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
599,CLINTON,"So, we've got this arc of instability from North Africa to South Asia, and we have to pay close attention to it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

600,CLINTON,"And we have to build coalitions, something that I did to take on the Iranian nuclear program, and what I will do as president to make sure that we defeat these terrorist networks.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
601,TODD,"You know, Senator Sanders, nobody knows who your foreign policy advisers are.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
602,TODD,You haven't given a major foreign policy speech.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

603,TODD,"And it doesn't sound like all the time that foreign policy is a priority, other than when you're asked about it, and you say you're going to crush ISIS, as you said last night and earlier.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
604,TODD,You have not proactively laid out a foreign policy doctrine yet.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
605,TODD,Why?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
606,SANDERS,"Well, that's not quite accurate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
607,SANDERS,I did give a speech at Georgetown where I talked about democratic socialism and foreign policy.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
608,SANDERS,"Maybe I shouldn't have combined the two in the same speech, because the foreign policy part of it didn't get much attention.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
609,SANDERS,"So, let me take this opportunity to give you a very short speech here on the issue.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
610,SANDERS,"I think, while it is true that the secretary and I voted differently on the war in Iraq, what is important is that we learn the lesson of the war in Iraq.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
611,SANDERS,"And that lesson is intrinsic to my foreign policy if elected president, is the United States cannot do it alone.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
612,SANDERS,We cannot be the policeman of the world.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
613,SANDERS,We are now spending more I believe than the next eight countries on defense.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
614,SANDERS,We have got to work in strong coalition with the major powers of the world and with those Muslim countries that are prepared to stand up and take on terrorism.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
615,SANDERS,"So I would say that the key doctrine of the Sanders administration would be no, we cannot continue to do it alone; we need to work in coalition.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
616,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
617,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

618,CLINTON,"A group of national security experts, military intelligence experts, issued a very concerning statement about Senator Sanders's views on foreign policy and national security, pointing out some of the comments he has made on these issues, such as inviting Iranian troops into Syria to try to resolve the conflict there; putting them right at the doorstep of Israel.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
619,CLINTON,"Asking Saudi Arabia and Iran to work together, when they can't stand each other and are engaged in a proxy battle right at this moment.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

620,CLINTON,"So I do think questions have been raised and questions have to be answered because when New Hampshire voters go on Tuesday to cast your vote, you are voting both for a president and a commander in chief.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

621,CLINTON,"And there is no way to predict what comes in the door of that White House from day to day that can pose a threat to the United States or one of our friends and allies, and I think this is a big part of the job interview that we are all conducting with the voters here.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
622,TODD,"All right, Senator, 30 seconds.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
623,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

624,SANDERS,"(OFF-MIKE) I fully, fully concede that Secretary Clinton, who was secretary of State for four years, has more experience -- hat is not arguable -- in foreign affairs.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
625,SANDERS,"But experience is not the only point, judgment is.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
626,SANDERS,"And once again, back in 2002, when we both looked at the same evidence about the wisdom of the war in Iraq, one of us voted the right way and one of us didn't.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
627,SANDERS,"In terms of Iran and in terms of Saudi Arabia, of course they hate each other.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
628,SANDERS,That's no great secret.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

629,SANDERS,"But John Kerry, who is I think doing a very good job, has tried to at least get these people in the room together because both of them are being threatened by ISIS.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

630,CLINTON,"Well, let me just add that, you know, I've said this before and I'm very proud of it, that when it comes to judgment, having run a hard race against Senator Obama at the time, he turned to me to be secretary of State.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

631,CLINTON,"And when it comes to the biggest counterterrorism issues that we faced in this administration, namely whether or not to go after bin Laden, I was at that table, I was exercising my judgment to advise the president on what to do, on that, on Iran, on Russia on China, on a whole raft of issues.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
632,CLINTON,Because I know from my own experience that you've got to be ready on day one.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
633,CLINTON,"There is just too much unpredictable threat and danger in the world today, you know, to try to just say wait, I'll get to that when I can.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
634,CLINTON,That is just not an acceptable approach.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
635,SANDERS,Well...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

636,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, at the -- at the last Democratic debate in Charleston -- I want to get specific here -- Senator Sanders called for moving as aggressively as we can to normalize relations with Iran.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
637,MADDOW,Your campaign has criticized him for saying that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
638,MADDOW,"Now that he's standing next to you here on this stage, can you explain why the U.S. shouldn't try to normalize relations in Iran in your view?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
639,CLINTON,Absolutely.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
640,CLINTON,"You know, I did put together the coalition to impose sanctions.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
641,CLINTON,"I actually started the negotiations that led to the nuclear agreement, sending some much my closest aides to begin the conversations with the Iranians.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
642,CLINTON,I'm very pleased we got that nuclear agreement.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
643,CLINTON,It puts a lid on the nuclear weapons program.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
644,CLINTON,"We have to enforce it, there have to be consequences attached to it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
645,CLINTON,But that is not our only problem with Iran.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
646,CLINTON,We have to figure out how to deal with Iran as the principal state sponsor of terrorism in the world.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
647,CLINTON,They are destabilizing governments in the region.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
648,CLINTON,They continue to support Hezbollah and Hamas in Lebanon against Israel.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
649,CLINTON,A lot of work that we have do is going to be incredibly hard.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
650,CLINTON,"I'm prepared to do that work, but I believe, just as I did with imposing the sanctions, you have to get action for action.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
651,CLINTON,"If we were to normalize relations right now, we would remove one of the biggest pieces of leverage we have to try to influence and change Iranian behavior.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
652,CLINTON,The president doesn't think we should.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
653,CLINTON,I certainly don't think we should.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

654,CLINTON,"I believe we have to take this step by step to try to reign in Iranian aggression, their support for terrorism and the other bad behavior that can come back and haunt us.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
655,SANDERS,Who said That think we should normalize relations with Iran tomorrow?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
656,SANDERS,I never said that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
657,SANDERS,I think we should move forward as quickly as we can.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
658,SANDERS,And you're right.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
659,SANDERS,They are a sponsor of terrorism around the world and we have to address that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
660,SANDERS,"But you know, a number of years ago, people were saying normal relationship with Cuba, what a bad and silly idea.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
661,SANDERS,"They're Communists, they are our enemy.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
662,SANDERS,Well guess what?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
663,SANDERS,Change has come.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
664,SANDERS,So please don't suggest that I think we normalize relations with Tehran tomorrow.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
665,SANDERS,We don't.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
666,SANDERS,"But I would like to see us move forward, and hopefully some day that will happen.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
667,SANDERS,"And I would say if I might, Madam Secretary -- and you can correct me if I'm wrong.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
668,SANDERS,When you ran against Senator Obama you thought him naive because he thought it was a good idea to talk to our enemies.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
669,SANDERS,I think those are exactly the people you have to talk to and you have to negotiate with.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
670,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
671,CLINTON,"Well Senator, let me just correct the record if I can.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
672,CLINTON,You know -- let me correct the record.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
673,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
674,TODD,"30 seconds, madam secretary.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
675,CLINTON,"As I -- as I certainly recall, the question was to meet with without conditions.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
676,CLINTON,"And you're right, I was against that.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
677,CLINTON,I was against it then I would be against it now.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
678,SANDERS,OK.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
679,CLINTON,"Part of diplomacy, the hard work of diplomacy is trying to extract whatever concessions you can get, and giving something the other side wants.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

680,CLINTON,"Of course you've got to try to make peace with, and work with those who are your adversaries, but you don't just rush in, open the door, and say, ""Here I am. Let's talk and make a deal.""",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
681,CLINTON,That's not the way it works.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
682,SANDERS,"I think President Obama had the right idea, and the bottom line is that of course there have to be conditions.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
683,SANDERS,"But, of course it doesn't do us any good to not talk with our adversaries...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
684,CLINTON,"... Well, we set conditions on Iran.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
685,CLINTON,"We worked hard to get them established, and to be enforced, and then we talked.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
686,CLINTON,That's exactly the right...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
687,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
688,CLINTON,"... And, that's what I did with the President, so he and I are on the very same page.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
689,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
690,SANDERS,"Just to set the record straight, I very strongly supported the agreement which makes certain that Iran does not get a nuclear weapon.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
691,TODD,"Alright, as Commander in Chief, Senator Sanders, you've got to prioritize potential threats to the United States.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
692,TODD,"Three countries, North Korea, Iran, Russia.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
693,TODD,How would you rank them in order of their threat to America's security right now...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
694,SANDERS,... ISIS...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
695,TODD,Starting with the biggest threat.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
696,SANDERS,"ISIS, you forgot one...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
697,TODD,I didn't say that...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
698,SANDERS,"... No, no...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
699,TODD,... No...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
700,SANDERS,... ISIS would be ...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
701,TODD,... We already had that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
702,TODD,I'm talking about these three countries.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
703,TODD,"How would you orient our national security, our national defense posture.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

704,SANDERS,"Clearly North Korea is a very strange situation because it is such an isolated country run by a handful of dictators, or maybe just one, who seems to be somewhat paranoid.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
705,SANDERS,"And, who had nuclear weapons.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
706,SANDERS,"And, our goal there, in my view, is to work and lean strongly on China to put as much pressure.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

707,SANDERS,"China is one of the few major countries in the world that has significant support for North Korea, and I think we got to do everything we can to put pressure on China.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
708,SANDERS,"I worry very much about an isolated, paranoid country with atomic bombs.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

709,SANDERS,"I think, clearly, we got to work closely with China to resolve the serious problems we have, and I worry about Putin and his military adventurism in the Crimea and the Ukraine.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
710,TODD,"Secretary of Defense Ash Carter this week picked one of those three, and he has said Russia is, basically, the most important national security threat.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
711,TODD,Sort of reorienting the defense and the challenges to that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
712,TODD,Do you agree with his decisions...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
713,SANDERS,"... No, I don't.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
714,SANDERS,"I worry very, very much about an isolated country.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
715,SANDERS,That's what makes me nervous.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
716,SANDERS,Russia lives in the world.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
717,SANDERS,China lives in the world.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
718,SANDERS,"North Korea is a very, very strange country because it is so isolated, and I do feel that a nation with nuclear weapons, they have got to be dealt with.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
719,SANDERS,Dealt with effectively.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
720,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, what do you think of Secretary of Defense Ash Carter.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
721,TODD,"He's basically putting Russia above Iran, above North Korea, as sort of the chief national security challenge right now.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
722,CLINTON,"I haven't talked to Secretary Carter, but here's what I would think he's planning.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
723,CLINTON,"We do have the nuclear weapons agreement with Iran, that's an enforcement consequence, action for action, follow on.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
724,CLINTON,"We have a plan, we will watch them, we will be vigilant.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
725,CLINTON,We do have to worry about North Korea.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
726,CLINTON,"They continue to develop their nuclear weapons capability, and they're working very hard on their ballistic missile capability.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
727,CLINTON,"And, I know that some of those plans could very well lead to a missile that might reach Hawaii, if not the West Coast.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
728,CLINTON,"We do have to try to get the countries in the region to work with us to do everything we can to confine, and constrain them.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
729,CLINTON,"But, what Secretary Carter is looking at is the constant pressure that Russia's putting on our European allies.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
730,CLINTON,The way that Russia is trying to move the boundaries of the post-World War II Europe.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
731,CLINTON,"The way that he is trying to set European countries against one another, seizing territory, holding it in Crimea.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
732,CLINTON,Beginning to explore whether they could make some inroads in the Baltics.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
733,CLINTON,We know that they are deeply engaged in supporting Assad because they want to have a place in the Middle East.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
734,CLINTON,"They have a naval base, they have an air base in Syria.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
735,CLINTON,They want to hang on to that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
736,CLINTON,"I think what Secretary Carter is seeing, and I'm glad he is, is that we got to get NATO back working for the common defense.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

737,CLINTON,"We've got to do more to support our partners in NATO, and we have to send a very clear message to Putin that this kind of belligerence, that this kind of testing of boundaries will have to be responded to.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
738,CLINTON,"The best way to do that is to put more armor in, put more money from the Europeans in so they're actually contributing more to their own defense.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
739,TODD,"Thank you both, Rachel?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
740,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, I want to ask you about a national security issue that is closer to home.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
741,MADDOW,"There are thousands of veterans, over 100,000 veterans living in the state of New Hampshire.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

742,MADDOW,"If either one of you is nominated as the Democratic Party's nominee, you will likely face a Republican opponent in the general election who wants to privatize or even abolish big parts of the V.A.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
743,MADDOW,It's a newly popular idea in conservative politics.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
744,MADDOW,How will you win the argument on that issue given the problems that have been exposed at the V.A.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
745,MADDOW,in the last few years?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
746,MADDOW,What's your argument that the V.A.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
747,MADDOW,should still exist and should not be privatized?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
748,CLINTON,"Well, first of all, I'm absolutely against privatizing the V.A.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
749,CLINTON,And I am going do everything I can to build on the reforms that Senator Sanders and others in Congress have passed to try to fix what's wrong with the V.A.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
750,CLINTON,There are a lot of issues about wait times and services that have to be fixed because our veterans deserve nothing but the best.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
751,CLINTON,"But you're absolutely right, you know, Rachel, this is another part of the Koch brothers agenda.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

752,CLINTON,"They've actually formed an organization to try to begin to convince Americans we should no longer have guaranteed health care, specialized care for our veterans.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
753,CLINTON,I will fight that as hard as I can.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

754,CLINTON,"I think there's where we can enlist the veterans service organizations, the veterans of America, because, yes, let's fix the V.A., but we will never let it be privatized, and that is a promise.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
755,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

756,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, you, as a congressional leader on veterans issues and the Veterans Committee, you've worked in a very bipartisan way with Senator John McCain and others on veterans issues.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
757,MADDOW,"Is the right contour of the fight, the way she's talking about this issue?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
758,SANDERS,Let me agree.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
759,SANDERS,"You know, as the secretary knows, I chaired -- I had the privilege and the honor of chairing the Senate Committee on Veterans' Affairs.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
760,SANDERS,"And it is interesting to me, you know, Republicans give a lot of speeches about how much they love veterans.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

761,SANDERS,"I work with the American Legion, the VFW, the DAV, the Vietnam Vets, and virtually every veterans organization to put together the most comprehensive piece of the veterans legislation in the modern history of America.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
762,SANDERS,That's what I did.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
763,SANDERS,And I brought it to the floor of the Senate.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
764,SANDERS,"Every Democrat voted for it, I got two Republicans.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
765,SANDERS,We ended up with 56 votes and I couldn't get the 60 votes that I needed.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
766,SANDERS,That is pathetic.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

767,SANDERS,"This was legislation supported by all of the veterans organizations, addressing many of the serious problems that veterans face in health care and in how we deliver benefits to them.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
768,SANDERS,"So Republicans talk a good game about veterans, but when it came to put money on the line to protect our veterans, frankly, they were not there.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
769,SANDERS,"What I did next, Rachel, is I had to retreat a little bit, I had to compromise.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
770,SANDERS,I did work with John McCain.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
771,SANDERS,I did work with Jeff Miller over in the House.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
772,SANDERS,"And we put together not the bill that I wanted, but probably the most comprehensive V.A.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
773,SANDERS,health care bill in the modern history of this country.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

774,SANDERS,"Secretary Clinton is absolutely right, there are people, Koch brothers among others, who have a group called Concerned Veterans of America, funded by the Koch brothers.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
775,SANDERS,"The Koch brothers, by the way, want to destroy Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, every governmental program passed since the 1930s.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
776,SANDERS,"Yes, there are people out there who want to privatize it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
777,SANDERS,The last point that I'd make.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
778,SANDERS,I had a hearing.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
779,SANDERS,I had all of the veterans groups in front of me.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

780,SANDERS,"And I said to them, tell me when a veteran gets in to the V.A., understanding there are waiting lines and real problems, when a veteran gets into the system, is the quality of care good?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
781,SANDERS,"Without exception, what they said, good, excellent, very good.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
782,SANDERS,We've got to strengthen the V.A.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
783,SANDERS,We do not privatize the V.A.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
784,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
785,MADDOW,"Thank you, Senator.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
786,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, Secretary Clinton, we're going to take another break.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
787,MADDOW,We'll be talking about Social Security and some of those other issues when we come back.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

793,TODD,"Senator Sanders, The Iowa Democratic Party has declared Hillary Clinton the winner of Monday's Iowa caucuses -- narrowest of margins.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

794,TODD,"Today, the Des Moines Register has an editorial that calls for the audit of the results, saying, quote, ""what happened Monday night at the Democratic caucuses was a debacle, period. The results were too close not to do a complete audit.""",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
795,TODD,"Senator Sanders, do you accept the idea that Hillary Clinton won Iowa?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
796,TODD,And do you -- or do you believe the caucuses are still an open question?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
797,SANDERS,"Well, I agree with the Des Moines Register, but let's not blow this out of proportion.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
798,SANDERS,"This is not a -- this is not, like, a winner-take-all thing.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
799,SANDERS,"I think where we now stand -- correct me if I'm wrong -- you have 22 delegates, I have 20 delegates.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
800,SANDERS,"We need 2,500 delegates to win the nomination.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
801,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
802,SANDERS,"You know, so this is not -- this is not the biggest deal in the world.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
803,SANDERS,"We think, by the way, based on talking to our precinct captains, we may have at least two more delegates.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
804,SANDERS,"What the Des Moines Register said -- you know, there were coin -- I think there were half a dozen coin flips -- a fairly chaotic type situation.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
805,SANDERS,"At the end of the day, no matter how it's recounted, it will break roughly even.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
806,SANDERS,"And by the way, I love and respect the caucus process in Iowa.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
807,SANDERS,"See, and I don't have to say it, because they voted already.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
808,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
809,SANDERS,"And I love New Hampshire, too, because you haven't voted, but...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
810,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
811,SANDERS,"... but, look, I think people are blowing this up out of proportion.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
812,SANDERS,But I think we need improvements in the process by which results are determined.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
813,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, will you participate in some sort of audit, if that's what the party wants to do?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
814,TODD,You good with that?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
815,CLINTON,"Whatever they decide to do, that's fine.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
816,TODD,That's fair enough.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
817,TODD,OK.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

819,TODD,"Good, we move on.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
820,TODD,We're happy with that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
821,TODD,We have more questions.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
822,MADDOW,"Senator -- Senator Sanders, in 1964...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
823,SANDERS,Oh (inaudible).,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
824,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
825,SANDERS,"See, when you are old, then they go back all these years.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
826,SANDERS,All right.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
827,SANDERS,What have you got?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
828,MADDOW,"In 1964, I heard that the Republicans nominated Barry Goldwater, who was the hero of the conservative movement.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
829,MADDOW,"He was, however, far to the right of most of that party.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
830,MADDOW,"In 1972, the Democrats nominated George McGovern, who was a hero of liberals in the antiwar movement, but he was to the left of his party's mainstream.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
831,MADDOW,"Both of those nominees made activists very excited, and they both got destroyed in the general election.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
832,MADDOW,Even Democrats who love you worry about your fate in a general election.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
833,MADDOW,And I know you have good head-to-head polling numbers against Republican frontrunners right now.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
834,MADDOW,We know that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
835,MADDOW,But do you have a general election strategy that is different than the way you're running right now to try to get the nomination?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
836,SANDERS,"Well, you know, a general election is different than a primary and caucus process.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
837,SANDERS,But let me just say this.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
838,SANDERS,"In terms of where we are right now, as you mention, Rachel, in a number of national and state, including New Hampshire.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

839,SANDERS,"For example, the last poll I saw -- there may have been a new one -- last one I saw here in New Hampshire, a battleground state, had me defeating Trump by 19; the secretary defeating him by one.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
840,SANDERS,There were also pretty large margins in Iowa and Wisconsin.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
841,SANDERS,These are polls.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
842,SANDERS,Polls go up.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
843,SANDERS,Polls go down.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
844,SANDERS,"But here's why I think I will be, if nominated, the strongest candidate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

845,SANDERS,"Democrats win when there is a large voter turnout; when people are excited; when working people, middle class people and young people are prepared to engage in the political process.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
846,SANDERS,"Republicans win when people are demoralized and you have a small voter turnout, which by the way is why they love voter suppression.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

847,SANDERS,"I believe that our campaign up to now has shown that we can create an enormous amount of enthusiasm from working people, from young people, who will get involved in the political process and which will drive us to a very large voter turnout.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
848,SANDERS,"If there is a large voter turnout, not only do we retain the White House, but I think we regain the Senate.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
849,SANDERS,We win governors' chairs up and down the line.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

850,SANDERS,"So I believe if you want to retain the White House, if you want to see Democrats do well across the board, I think our campaign is the one that creates the large voter turnout and helps us win.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
851,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

852,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, your campaign surrogates, and people who have endorsed you, have suggested that or even said that if Senator Sanders is the nominee, that Democrats will suffer nationwide and the chances will go down of Democrats holding onto the White House.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
853,MADDOW,"With him here standing next to you, can you tell us whether or not you believe he would win the general election if he were nominated?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
854,CLINTON,"I can only tell you what I believe, and that is that I am the strongest candidate to take it to the Republicans and win in November.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
855,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
856,CLINTON,And I say that with great -- with great respect for the campaign that Senator Sanders has been running.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
857,CLINTON,"I personally am thrilled at the numbers of people, and particularly young people who are coming to support your campaign.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
858,CLINTON,I hope that I will be able to earn their support.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
859,CLINTON,"They may not support me now, but I support them and we'll work together.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
860,CLINTON,"But what I'm concerned about is the views of many Democrats who know their states, who know how hard it is to win a general election.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
861,CLINTON,And it also will push whoever the nominee is into the spotlight.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
862,CLINTON,I've been vetted.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
863,CLINTON,There's hardly anything you don't know about me.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
864,CLINTON,"And I think it's fair to say that whoever is in that position, Senator Sanders or anyone else who might have run, will face the most withering onslaught.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
865,CLINTON,"So, I think that I am the person who can do all aspects of the job.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
866,CLINTON,I think I'm the person best prepared to take the case to the Republicans.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
867,CLINTON,"And I think that at the end of the day, it's not so much electability.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

868,CLINTON,"It is who the American people can believe can keep them safe, can get the economy moving again, can get incomes rising, can build on the progressive accomplishments of President Obama.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
869,CLINTON,And I think that the coalition that President Obama put together to win twice is a coalition that I can put together and add to.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
870,CLINTON,And that's what I'm prepared to...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
871,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
872,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
873,TODD,We'll stay on this issue.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
874,TODD,We'll stay on this topic.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

875,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, just like there are some Democrats that question Senator Sanders' ability in the general election, many Democratic voters that our reporters have been running into in Iowa and New Hampshire, they tell our reporters over and over again they're worried about the emails issue, not because they don't believe your explanation, but because it's a drip-drip, because the cloud is hanging over your head and that it will impact the general election.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
876,TODD,They see your numbers right now and they think it's the email issue as to why you're not polling very well.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
877,TODD,So can you reassure these Democrats that somehow the email issue isn't going to blow up your candidacy if you're the nominee?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
878,CLINTON,Absolutely I can.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
879,CLINTON,"You know, before it was emails, it was Benghazi, and the Republicans were stirring up so much controversy about that.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
880,CLINTON,"And I testified for 11 hours, answered their questions.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
881,CLINTON,"They basically said yeah, didn't get her.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
882,CLINTON,We tried.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
883,CLINTON,That was all a political ploy.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

884,CLINTON,"Now, we had a development in the email matter today when it came out that Secretary Powell and close aides to Former Secretary Rice used private e-mail accounts.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

885,CLINTON,"and now you have these people in the government who are doing the same thing to Secretary Powell and Secretary Rice's aide they've been doing to me, which is that I never sent or received any classified material.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
886,CLINTON,They are retroactively classifying it.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
887,CLINTON,"I agree completely with Secretary Powell, who said today this is an absurdity.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
888,CLINTON,And so I think the American people will know it's an absurdity.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
889,CLINTON,I have absolutely no concerns about it whatsoever.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
890,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
891,TODD,"All right, Madam Secretary, there is an open -- there is an open FBI investigation into this matter about how you may have handled classified material.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
892,TODD,Are you 100 percent confident that nothing is going to come of this FBI investigation?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
893,CLINTON,I am 100 percent confident.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
894,CLINTON,This is a security review that was requested.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
895,CLINTON,It is being carried out.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
896,CLINTON,It will be resolved.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

897,CLINTON,"But I have to add if there's going to be a security review about me, there's going to have to be security reviews about a lot of other people, including Republican office holders, because we've got this absurd situation of retroactive classifications.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
898,CLINTON,"Honest to goodness, this is -- this just beggars the imagination.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
899,CLINTON,"So I have absolutely no concerns about it, but we've got to get to the bottom of what's really going on here, and I hope that will happen.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
900,TODD,"Well, Senator sanders, you famously at the first debate said you didn't give a darn about her emails; I think you used another (inaudible).",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
901,SANDERS,(OFF-MIKE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
902,TODD,You're right.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
903,TODD,I'm trying to -- it's a -- it's a family hour still right now.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

905,TODD,"And you mostly have refrained from commenting on it, but recently you called it a very serious issue, and then the other day you said well she's getting slapped with the email controversy.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
906,TODD,Are you -- how are you feeling about these darn emails now?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

908,SANDERS,There's a process under way.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

911,TODD,"Senator Sanders, thank you.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
912,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

913,SANDERS,"And by the way -- and by the way, if I may, the secretary probably doesn't know that there's not a day that goes by when I am not asked to attack her on that issue, and I have refrained from doing that and I will continue to refrain from doing that.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
914,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
915,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, thank you.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
916,MADDOW,"Senator, in December, one of your campaign staffers was fired from your campaign for taking voter data essentially from the Clinton campaign.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
917,MADDOW,You apologized for that when the incident was made public.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

918,MADDOW,"Your campaign has now been criticized for its operatives essentially impersonating culinary union members wearing union pins in Nevada, and the Nashua Telegraph has complained recently that you falsely implied in an advertisement that they had endorsed you when they did not.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
919,MADDOW,"None of these issues obviously is the end of the world, but they all are of a piece.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
920,MADDOW,Are you in some sense losing control of your campaign?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
921,SANDERS,Not losing control of our campaign.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

922,SANDERS,"You know, we have hired a whole lot of people in a rapid way and I am familiar with the first two instances and they are unacceptable, and we have apologized and dealt with that.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
923,SANDERS,"In terms of the last one, as I understand it, we did not suggest that we had the endorsement of a newspaper.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
924,SANDERS,"Newspapers who make endorsements also say positive things about other candidates, and to the best of my knowledge, that is what we did.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
925,SANDERS,"So we never said, never said that somebody, a newspaper endorsed us that did not.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
926,SANDERS,What we did say is blah blah blah blah was said by the newspaper.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
927,MADDOW,"Just to follow up on that, the title of the ad in question was Endorsement.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
928,SANDERS,But that was only for -- that was not to be on television.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
929,SANDERS,That's an important point.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

930,SANDERS,"That was just something -- as the secretary knows, you put titles on ads and you send them out, but there was no word in that ad, none, that said that those newspapers had endorsed us.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
931,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, do you want 30 seconds on that issue?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
932,CLINTON,No.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
933,MADDOW,"And with that, we will (inaudible).",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
934,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

936,MADDOW,"Welcome back to the University of New Hampshire, and the Democratic candidates' debate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
937,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, on the issue of the death penalty, here in New Hampshire, the one person who is on death row is there for killing a police officer.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
938,MADDOW,"It's a crime that has caused anguish in this state, both among death penalty opponents and death penalty supporters.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

939,MADDOW,"The last time I had the chance to talk with you on this issue, on the death penalty, you said that capital punishment has a place in a very few federal cases, but you also said you would breathe a sigh of relief if the Supreme Court abolished the death penalty nationwide.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
940,MADDOW,"Tonight, do you still support capital punishment, even if you do so reluctantly?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
941,CLINTON,"Yes, I do.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

942,CLINTON,"And -- you know, what I hope the Supreme Court will do is make it absolutely clear that any state that continues capital punishment either must meet the highest standards of evidentiary (ph) proof of effective assistance of counsel or they cannot continue it because that, to me, is the real dividing line.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
943,CLINTON,"I have much more confidence in the federal system, and I do reserve it for particularly heinous crimes in the federal system, like terrorism.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
944,CLINTON,I have strong feelings about that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

945,CLINTON,"I thought it was appropriate after a very thorough trial that Timothy McVeigh received the death penalty for blowing up the Federal Building in Oklahoma City, killing 168 people, including 19 children in a daycare center.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

946,CLINTON,"I do for very limited, particularly heinous crimes believe it is an appropriate punishment, but I deeply disagree with the way that too many states are still implementing it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
947,CLINTON,"If it were possible to separate the federal from the state system by the Supreme Court, that would, I think, be an appropriate outcome.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

948,MADDOW,"Senator Sanders, you have singled out the death penalty, and Senator Clinton's support for the death penalty, as an issue that makes it hard to consider as progressive in your mind...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
949,SANDERS,"... Look, I hear what the Secretary said, and I understand, but look, there are -- all of us know that we have seen in recent years horrible, horrible crimes.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

950,SANDERS,"It's hard to imagine how people can do, bomb, and kill 168 people in Oklahoma City, or do the Boston Marathon bombing, but this is what I believe, and for a couple of reasons.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
951,SANDERS,"Number one, too many innocent people, including minorities, African Americans, have been executed when they were not guilty.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
952,SANDERS,That's number one.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
953,SANDERS,We have to be very careful about making sure about that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
954,SANDERS,"But, second of all, and maybe, in a deeper reason, of course there are barbaric acts out there.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
955,SANDERS,"But, in a world of so much violence and killing, I just don't believe that government itself should be part of the killing.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
956,SANDERS,"So, when somebody commits...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
957,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
958,SANDERS,"... Somebody commits any of these terrible crimes that we have seen, you lock them up, and you toss away the key.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
959,SANDERS,They're never going to get out.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
960,SANDERS,"But, I just don't' want to see government be part of killing.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
961,SANDERS,That's all.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
962,SANDERS,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
963,MADDOW,"Another issue related to the proper role of government, and in this case, specifically the role of government between the federal government and the states.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
964,MADDOW,"I want to talk for a moment about the issue of Flint, Michigan.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

965,MADDOW,"On the Flint lead poisoning disaster, you have both been highly critical of Governor Rick Snyder of Michigan, and how the state in Michigan both caused the lead poisoning problem, and has not acted fast enough to fix it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
966,MADDOW,You have both been outspoken on that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
967,MADDOW,The fact is that Michigan though has not fixed it.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
968,MADDOW,There is no door to door delivery of clean water in Flint even today.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
969,MADDOW,"Not a single lead pipe has been replaced in Flint, even today.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
970,MADDOW,"If the state is failing, would you, Secretary Clinton, would you as President order a federal response to get it right over and above the wishes of the state?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
971,CLINTON,Absolutely.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
972,CLINTON,Absolutely.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
973,CLINTON,"You know, Rachel, you and I have talked about this before.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
974,CLINTON,I thank you for going to Flint to hold that town hall.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
975,CLINTON,"I will be in Flint at the Mayor's invitation on Sunday to get an in depth briefing about what is, and is not happening.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
976,CLINTON,This is an emergency.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

977,CLINTON,"Everyday that goes by that these people, particularly the children, are not tested so we can know what steps must be taken to try to remediate the effects of the poisoning that they have been living with is a day lost in a child's life.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
978,CLINTON,"I know from the work that I've done over so many years, lead, the toxic nature of lead can affect you brain development, your body development, your behavior.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
979,CLINTON,I absolutely believe that what is being done is not sufficient.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

980,CLINTON,"We need to be absolutely clear about everything that should be done from today to tomorrow, into the future to try to remedy the terrible burden that the people of Flint are bearing.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

981,CLINTON,"That includes fixing their pipes, it includes guaranteeing whatever healthcare and educational embellishments they may need going forward, and I think the federal government has way where it can bill the state of Michigan.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
982,CLINTON,"If Michigan won't do it, there have to be ways that we can begin to move, and then make them pay for it, and hold them accountable.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
983,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
984,MADDOW,Senator Sanders are there things the President could be doing?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
985,MADDOW,"President Obama could be ordering, done, right now, in Flint, Michigan that are not being done that you as President would do?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
986,SANDERS,Absolutely.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
987,SANDERS,I think the Secretary described the situation appropriately.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
988,SANDERS,"You know, I don't go around asking for governor's resignations every day.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
989,SANDERS,"In fact, I think I never have in my life.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
990,SANDERS,But I did ask for the resignation of Governor Snyder because his irresponsibility...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
991,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
992,SANDERS,... was so outrageous.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
993,SANDERS,What we are talking about are children being poisoned.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
994,SANDERS,That's what we're talking about.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

995,SANDERS,"We don't know, no one knows for sure because they haven't done the appropriate studies, but there's no question that kids' intellectual development may have been impacted.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
996,SANDERS,We don't know how many thousands.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
997,SANDERS,The idea that there has not been a dramatic response is beyond comprehension.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
998,SANDERS,"And when you have one of the, I think, significant public health crises of recent years, of course the federal government comes in.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
999,SANDERS,"And of course the federal government says, you're not going to be poisoning little kids and impacting their entire lives.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1000,SANDERS,Last point on this.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1001,SANDERS,And I suspect the secretary agrees.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1002,SANDERS,One wonders if this were a white suburban community what kind of response there would have been.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1003,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1004,SANDERS,"Flint, Michigan, is a poor community.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1005,SANDERS,It is disproportionately African-American and minority.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1006,SANDERS,And what has happened there is absolutely unacceptable.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1007,MADDOW,"Senator, thank you.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1008,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, let me turn to the issue of trade.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1009,TODD,In the '90s you supported NAFTA.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1010,TODD,But you opposed it when you ran for the president in 2008.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1011,TODD,"As secretary of state, you supported TPP, and then -- which, of course, is that trade agreement with a lot of Asian countries, but you now oppose it as you make your second bid for president.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1012,TODD,"If elected, should Democrats expect that once you're in office you will then become supportive of these trade agreements again?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1013,CLINTON,"You know, Chuck, I've only had responsibility for voting for trade agreements as a senator.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1014,CLINTON,"And I voted a multinational trade agreement when I was senator, the CAFTA agreement, because I did not believe it was in the best interests of the workers of America, of our incomes, and I opposed it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1015,CLINTON,"I did hope that the TPP, negotiated by this administration, would put to rest a lot of the concerns that many people have expressed about trade agreements.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1016,CLINTON,And I said that I was holding out that hope that it would be the kind of trade agreement that I was looking for.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1017,CLINTON,I waited until it had actually been negotiated because I did want to give the benefit of the doubt to the administration.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1018,CLINTON,"Once I saw what the outcome was, I opposed it.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1019,CLINTON,Now I have a very clear view about this.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1020,CLINTON,We have to trade with the rest of the world.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1021,CLINTON,We are 5 percent of the world's population.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1022,CLINTON,We have to trade with the other 95 percent.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1023,CLINTON,And trade has to be reciprocal.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1024,CLINTON,That's the way the global economy works.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1025,CLINTON,But we have failed to provide the basic safety net support that American workers need in order to be able to compete and win in the global economy.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1026,CLINTON,So it's not just what's in the trade agreement that I'm interested in.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1027,CLINTON,I did help to renegotiate the trade agreement that we inherited from President Bush with Korea.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1028,CLINTON,We go the UAW on board because of changes we made.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1029,CLINTON,"So there are changes that I believe would make a real difference if they could be achieved, but I do not currently support it as it is written.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1030,TODD,"Well, Senator Sanders, I know you want to respond on this, you have never supported a trade deal since you've been in Congress.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1031,SANDERS,Absolutely right.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1032,TODD,But if you do that as president...,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1033,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1034,TODD,"If you do that as president, how are you not essentially letting China, who will do all of these deals around the world, how are you going to prevent China from essentially setting the rules of trade for the world?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1035,SANDERS,"Chuck, I believe in trade, but I do not believe in unfettered free trade.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1036,SANDERS,I believe in fair trade which works for the middle class and working families of this country and not just large multinational corporations.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1037,SANDERS,I was not only in opposition to NAFTA -- and this is an area where the secretary and I have disagreements.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1038,SANDERS,"I was not only in opposition to NAFTA, I was on the picket line in opposition to NAFTA because I understood -- I don't think this is really rocket science.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1039,SANDERS,We heard all of the people tell us how many great jobs would be created.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1040,SANDERS,"I didn't believe that for a second because I understood what the function of NAFTA, CAFTA, PNTR with China, and the TPP is, it's to say to American workers, hey, you are now competing against people in Vietnam who make 56 cents an hour minimum wage.",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1041,SANDERS,I don't want American workers to compete against people making 56 cents an hour.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1042,SANDERS,"I don't want companies shutting down in America, throwing people out on the street, moving to China, and bringing their products back into this country.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1043,SANDERS,"So, do I believe in trade?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1044,SANDERS,"Of course, I believe in trade.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1045,SANDERS,"But the current trade agreements over the last 30 years were written by corporate America, for corporate America, resulted in the loss of millions of decent-paying jobs, 60,000 factories in America lost since 2001, millions of decent-paying jobs; and also a downward spiral, a race to the bottom where employers say, ""Hey, you don't want to take a cut in pay? We're going to China.""",1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1046,SANDERS,Workers today are working longer hours for lower wages.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1047,SANDERS,Trade is one of the reasons for that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1048,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1049,TODD,All right.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1050,TODD,Thank you both.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1052,TODD,We'll be right back.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
