1059,TODD,The home stretch of this only Democratic debate in the final week before the primary.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1060,TODD,"Let me start with you, Secretary Clinton, on this question.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1061,TODD,"Obviously, President Obama got a lot of ambitious stuff done in his first year and a half.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1062,TODD,You're going to have to make choices.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1063,TODD,And there's a lot of heavy lifts.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1064,TODD,And he made choices.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1065,TODD,"He did healthcare and it came at the expense, arguably, of immigration reform.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1066,TODD,"Had he put immigration reform first, perhaps that gets done and healthcare doesn't.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1067,TODD,"So there are three big lifts that you've talked about: immigration, gun reform, climate change.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1068,TODD,What do you do first?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1069,TODD,Because you know the first one is the one you have the best shot at getting done.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1070,CLINTON,"Well, I -- I don't accept that premise, Chuck.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1071,CLINTON,I think that we've got so much business we have to do.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1072,CLINTON,We've talked a lot tonight about what we're against -- we're against income inequality.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1073,CLINTON,We're against the abuses of powerful interests.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1074,CLINTON,We're against a lot of things.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1075,CLINTON,I'm for a lot of things.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1076,CLINTON,"I don't want to just stop bad things from happening, I want to start good things from happening.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1077,CLINTON,"And I believe, if I'm so fortunate to get the nomination, I will begin to work immediately on putting together an agenda, beginning to talk with members of Congress and others about how we can push forward.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1078,CLINTON,"I want to have half a billion more solar panels deployed, the first four years.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1079,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1080,CLINTON,I want to have enough clean energy to power every home the next four years.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1081,CLINTON,"I want us to keep working on the Affordable Care Act, to get not only to 100 percent coverage, but bring down the costs of prescription drugs and out-of-pocket costs.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1082,CLINTON,"I want to move forward on paid family leave, on early childhood education, I want us to do more for small businesses.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1083,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1084,CLINTON,"Small businesses have to create most of the jobs, and we're not creating and growing small businesses.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1085,CLINTON,"I think, if you have a smart agenda, you pick the committees that you know have to begin to work on these various pieces -- because that's the way Congress is set up.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1086,CLINTON,"You go through different committees, and you really make a big push in the beginning.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1087,CLINTON,"Immigration reform, economic revitalization with manufacturing, with infrastructure -- we put it out there, and we begin to work on an ambitious, big, bold agenda that will actually produce the results that I want to see for our country.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1088,TODD,"All right, but Senator Sanders...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1089,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1090,TODD,... you've still got to do something first.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1091,TODD,"As you know, history said -- shows what you pick first is your best shot at getting, and how you prioritize things.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1092,SANDERS,"No, let...",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1093,TODD,"Immigration reform, for instance, fell by the wayside in the first term because of this.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1094,SANDERS,I am absolutely supportive of comprehensive immigration reform and a path towards citizenship for 11 million people today who are living in the shadows.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1095,SANDERS,All right?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1096,SANDERS,We got to do that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1097,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1098,SANDERS,"But you miss -- when you looked at the issues, you missed two of the most important.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1099,SANDERS,And that is you're not going to accomplish what has to be done for working families and the middle class unless there is campaign finance reform.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1100,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1101,SANDERS,"So long as big money interests control the United States Congress, it is gonna be very hard to do what has to be done for working families.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1102,SANDERS,So let me be very clear.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1103,SANDERS,"No nominee of mine, if I'm elected president, to the United States Supreme Court will get that nomination unless he or she is loud and clear, and says they will vote to overturn Citizens United.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1104,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1105,SANDERS,"Second point -- second point is that the only way we make change in terms of health care, in terms of dealing with a broken criminal justice system which, today, allows us to have more people in jail than any other country -- largely African-American and Latino -- the only way we create millions of jobs by rebuilding our infrastructure or have a tax system that says to the wealthy that they are going to pay their fair share, is when millions of people become involved in the political process.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1106,SANDERS,"No, you just can't negotiate with Mitch McConnell.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1107,SANDERS,"Mitch is gonna have to look out the window and see a whole lot of people saying, ""Mitch, stop representing the billionaire class. Start listening to working families.""",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1108,SANDERS,"And as president, that's what I will work hard on.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1109,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1110,TODD,OK.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1111,TODD,Thank you.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1112,MADDOW,"Secretary Clinton, Republicans, particularly in campaign years, often talk about which departments of government -- which agencies of government they would get rid of if they were elected president.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1113,MADDOW,"The EPA, the Department of Education, the Commerce Department, oops -- is -- is there a department of government that you would get rid of?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1114,MADDOW,Or is there a whole new one that you would create?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1115,CLINTON,The answer to both of those is no.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1116,CLINTON,I'm interested in making what we have work better.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1117,CLINTON,I want to streamline programs that are duplicative and redundant.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1118,CLINTON,"I want to have a top-to-bottom review about what works and what doesn't work, and be absolutely clear we're getting rid of what doesn't work.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1119,CLINTON,I have had the opportunity to run a big agency.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1120,CLINTON,I was very flattered when Henry Kissinger said I ran the State Department better -- better than anybody had run it in a long time.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1121,CLINTON,So I have an idea of what it's going to take to make our government work more efficiently.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1122,CLINTON,"And when you put together a budget, you have to make a lot of hard decisions, but I think it's not appropriate to say ""I'm going to get rid of this, get rid of that"" until you have a very good process that gives you the information about what to do.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1123,CLINTON,"But I want to add something else, you know, because look, we have so much work to do in our country, and I think it's the greatest work that Americans will be called to do.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1124,CLINTON,"And of course, we have to have people in every community involved in it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1125,CLINTON,"We have to have the political voice, the political grassroots speaking up and speaking out about what we have to try to accomplish in Washington.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1126,CLINTON,"But we also need to have a very clear set of goals that we are going to achieve, and we need to level with the American people about what they are, what they will cost, what will be expected of our citizenry.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1127,CLINTON,"So I see as president having a constant dialogue with Americans here's what we're trying to get done, here's why I need your help, here's why you may think comprehensive immigration reform with a path to citizenship isn't something you care about, but I'm telling you it will help fix the labor market, it will bring people out of the shadows --",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1128,MADDOW,"Thank you, Secretary Clinton.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1129,CLINTON,-- it will actually raise wages.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1130,CLINTON,You have to make all those connections so that you've got people with you every step of the way.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1131,CLINTON,That's what I want to do.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1132,MADDOW,Thank you very much.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1133,MADDOW,Thank you.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1134,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1135,TODD,"All right, before we go, I want to ask each one of these.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1136,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, you've made it clear when you look at Senator Sanders, you do not see a president, but do you see --",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1137,CLINTON,I never said that.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1138,TODD,But do you see -- do you see a vice president?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1139,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1140,CLINTON,Look --,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1141,TODD,Would you unite the party by trying to pick Senator Sanders as your running mate?,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1142,CLINTON,"Well, I'm certainly going to unite the party, but I'm not -- I'm not getting ahead of myself.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1143,CLINTON,I think that would be a little bit presumptuous.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1144,CLINTON,"If I'm so fortunate as to be the nominee, the first person I will call to talk to about where we go and how we get it done will be Senator Sanders.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1145,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1146,TODD,"Senator, would you consider the secretary?",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1147,SANDERS,I agree with what the secretary said.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1148,SANDERS,We shouldn't be getting ahead of ourselves.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1149,SANDERS,"And as I have said many times, you know, sometimes in these campaigns, things get a little bit out of hand.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1150,SANDERS,"I happen to respect the secretary very much, I hope it's mutual.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1151,SANDERS,"And on our worst days, I think it is fair to say we are 100 times better than any Republican candidate.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1152,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1153,CLINTON,That's true.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1154,CLINTON,That's true.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1155,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1156,TODD,"Secretary Clinton, closing statements.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1157,TODD,You are first.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1158,CLINTON,"Well first, thanks to MSNBC and thanks to all of you for holding this debate before the New Hampshire primary.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1159,CLINTON,"I am going to campaign as hard as I can between now and Tuesday to earn your votes in that primary, and I hear some talk that people are trying to decide do they vote with their heart, do they vote with their head, I'm asking you to bring both your heart and your head to vote with you on Tuesday because we have a lot of work that can only come because your heart is moved.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1160,CLINTON,"You know, we didn't get to talk about the continuing struggles that Americans face with racism, with sexism, with discrimination against the LGBT community, with new Americans, with people with disabilities.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1161,CLINTON,"Yes, we have income inequality, we have other forms of inequality that we need to stand up against and absolutely diminish from our society.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1162,CLINTON,"So I have been moved by my heart ever since I was a young woman about the age of a lot of Senator Sanders' supporters worrying what I can do to make a difference for my country, and I will bring that heart with me, but I will also tell you we've got to get our heads together to come up with the best answers to solve the problems so that people can have real differences in their lives that will make them better for now and into the future.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1163,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1164,TODD,"Thank you, Madam Secretary.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1165,TODD,Senator Sanders.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1166,SANDERS,I -- my dad came to this country at the age of 17 from Poland.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1167,SANDERS,"Didn't have any money, couldn't speak English, he died pretty young, and I think it would have been beyond his wildest dreams to see his son up here on this stage today running for president.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1168,SANDERS,"I love this country and my dad loved this country, and he was the most proud American because of what it gave him in terms of raising his family, even though we never had much money.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1169,SANDERS,"But today in America, we are the only major country on earth that doesn't guarantee health care to all people, that doesn't guarantee paid family and medical leave.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1170,SANDERS,We have the highest rate of childhood poverty of almost any major country on earth.,1,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1171,SANDERS,We are seeing millions of families unable to send their kids to college in the United States of America.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1172,SANDERS,I'm running for president because I believe it is just too late for establishment politics and establishment economics.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1173,SANDERS,I do believe we need a political revolution where millions of people stand up and say loudly and clearly that our government belongs to all of us and not just a handful of wealthy campaign contributors.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1174,SANDERS,Thank you all.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1175,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1176,TODD,"Well, there you have it.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1177,TODD,"I promise you, Rachel and I have a lot more questions, but we just don't have any more time, unless we could (inaudible) a third hour, but I don't think so.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1178,TODD,Our debate coverage -- (inaudible) debate coverage will continue in just a moment with our colleague (inaudible).,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1179,TODD,"And we want to thank all of you for being here, and we want to thank the two candidates for taking part in this important event.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1180,MADDOW,"We also want to thank our host, the University of New Hampshire, and the people of New Hampshire.",0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1181,MADDOW,You guys get to vote in just five days.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1182,MADDOW,I can't wait to see how it turns out.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1183,MADDOW,Don't screw up.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1184,TODD,We'll see you in a few minutes.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1185,TODD,Thank you.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv
1186,MADDOW,Thank you.,0,20160209_msnbc_dem.tsv

1,BLITZER,It's time for the candidates to introduce themselves right now.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

3,BLITZER,"Dr. Carson, you're first.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
4,CARSON,"If someone had tried to describe today's America to you 30 years ago, you would have listened in disbelief.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
5,CARSON,"Americans know that our nation is heading off the abyss of destruction, secondary to divisiveness, fiscal irresponsibility, and failure to lead.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
6,CARSON,"Marco, Donald, Ted, John, we will not solve any of these problems by trying to destroy each other.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
7,CARSON,What we need to do is be looking for solutions tonight.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

10,BLITZER,Governor Kasich?,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

11,KASICH,"Well, you know, on the way over here, even getting ready earlier and sitting in the green room and watching the early coverage, you know, my father carried mail on his back and his father was a coal miner and my mother's mother was an immigrant, could barely speak English.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
12,KASICH,And I'm standing on this stage.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
13,KASICH,It's pretty remarkable.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
14,KASICH,"But I want to tell you, there's a lot of young people watching tonight.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
15,KASICH,You can do whatever you want to do in your life.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
16,KASICH,"America is an amazing country, where a kid like me can grow up to run for president of the United States and be on this stage tonight.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
17,KASICH,"So to all the young people that are out there, your hopes, your dreams, pursue them.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
18,KASICH,Shoot for the stars.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
19,KASICH,"America's great, and you can do it.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
20,KASICH,"Thank you, Wolf.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
21,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

23,RUBIO,"Well, thank you.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

24,RUBIO,"This election, we have to decide the identity of America in the 21st century, but as part of this primary, we have to find out our identity as a party and as a movement.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
25,RUBIO,"Thirty-six years ago, Ronald Reagan and George H.W.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
26,RUBIO,Bush began the Reagan Revolution.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
27,RUBIO,"For a generation, they defined conservatism as limited government and free enterprise and a strong national defense.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
28,RUBIO,But they also appealed to our hopes and our dreams.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

29,RUBIO,"Now we have to decide if we are still that kind of party and still that kind of movement, or if we're simply going to become a party that preys on people's angers and fears.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

30,RUBIO,I hope we remain that conservative movement that appeals to our hopes and our dreams and the belief that America will always be better in its future than it's been in its story history.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
31,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1217,KASICH,"Well, I think it takes three things, Wolf.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
1218,KASICH,And I've done it.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
1219,KASICH,"I mean, I -- we got the budget balanced.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
1220,KASICH,We cut the capital gains tax.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
1221,KASICH,"You see, in order to get this economy moving again, you have to grow the economy, and you have to restrain the spending.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
1222,KASICH,"And when I was chairman, we cut that capital gains tax and we instituted a significant program to get to balance.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1223,KASICH,"We had a balanced budget four years in a row, had to take on every interest group in Washington -- every single one of them -- and we paid down a half a trillion of the national debt.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1225,KASICH,Because you want job growth.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1227,KASICH,You will never be able to do it.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1228,KASICH,"Now, I -- I inherited an an $8 billion hole in Ohio, I have common-sense regulations, I have tax cuts -- the biggest of any governor in the country -- and we have a fiscal plan.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1231,KASICH,Now we have a $2 billion surplus.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv
1232,KASICH,"Our credit is strong, our pensions are strong.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1233,KASICH,"And, look -- I've got a plan to take to Washington, and I will have it there in the first hundred days, and it will include shifting welfare, education, transportation, Medicaid and job training back to us, so we can begin, in the states, to be the laboratories of innovation.",0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1964,RUBIO,And I think they should comply with that.,0,20160226_10_gop.tsv

1,BLITZER,"Secretary Clinton and Senator Sanders, you can now move to your lecterns while I explain a few ground rules.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
2,BLITZER,"As moderator, I'll guide the discussion, asking questions and follow-ups.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
3,BLITZER,You'll also get questions from Dana Bash and Errol Louis.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
4,BLITZER,"You'll each have one minute and 15 seconds to answer questions, 30 seconds for follow- ups.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
5,BLITZER,Timing lights will signal when your time is up.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
6,BLITZER,Both candidates have agreed to these rules now.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
7,BLITZER,"Opening statements, you'll each have two minutes.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
8,BLITZER,Let's begin with Senator Sanders.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
9,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
10,SANDERS,"Wolf, thank you very much.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
11,SANDERS,"CNN, thank you very much.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
12,SANDERS,"Secretary Clinton, thank you very much.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
13,SANDERS,"When we began this campaign almost a year ago, we started off at 3 percent in the polls.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
14,SANDERS,We were about 70 points behind Secretary Clinton.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
15,SANDERS,"In the last couple of weeks, there were two polls out there that had us ahead.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
16,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
17,SANDERS,"Of the last nine caucuses and primaries, we have won eight of them, many of them by landslide victories.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
18,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

19,SANDERS,"Over the last year, we have received almost 7 million individual campaign contributions, averaging -- guess what -- $27 apiece, more individual campaign contributions than any candidate in American history at this point in a campaign.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
20,SANDERS,The reason that our campaign has done so well is because we're doing something very radical: We're telling the American people the truth.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

21,SANDERS,And the truth is that this country is not going to move forward in a significant way for working people unless we overturn this disastrous Citizens United Supreme Court decision...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
22,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
23,SANDERS,... and unless we have real campaign reform so that billionaires and super PACs cannot buy elections.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
24,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

25,SANDERS,"This campaign is also determined to end a rigged economy where the rich get richer and everybody else get poorer, and create an economy that works for all of us, not just the 1 percent.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
26,SANDERS,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

28,CLINTON,"Well, first of all, it's great to be here in New York, and I am delighted to...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
29,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
30,CLINTON,... have this chance to discuss the issues that are important to our future.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
31,CLINTON,I was so honored to serve as a senator from New York for eight years...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
32,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

33,CLINTON,... and to work to provide opportunity for all of our citizens to make it possible that we could knock down the barriers that stand in the way of people getting ahead and staying ahead.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
34,CLINTON,"And during those eight years, we faced some difficult challenges together.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
35,CLINTON,We faced 9/11.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
36,CLINTON,We worked hard to rebuild New York.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
37,CLINTON,I was particularly concerned about our first responders and others who'd been affected in their health by what they had experienced.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

38,CLINTON,We worked hard to bring jobs from Buffalo to Albany and all parts of New York to give more hard-working people a chance to really make the most out of their own talents.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
39,CLINTON,And we worked hard to really keep New York values at the center of who we are and what we do together.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
40,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
41,CLINTON,And that is -- that is exactly what I want to do as your president.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
42,CLINTON,We will celebrate our diversity.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
43,CLINTON,"We will work together, bringing us back to being united, setting some big, bold, progressive goals for America.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

44,CLINTON,"That's what I'm offering in this campaign, to build on the work, to build on the value that we share here in New York, to take those to Washington, and to knock down those barriers that in any way hold back not only individual Americans, bur our country from reaching our full potential.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
45,CLINTON,That is what my campaign is about.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

139,BASH,"Secretary Clint, the government announced yesterday that five of the biggest banks on Wall Street have failed to develop plans to dismantle themselves in the event of another financial crisis.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
140,BASH,This is the second time in two years those banks neglected to come up with credible plans.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
141,BASH,"So, as president, would you call on regulators to start the process of breaking up these banks?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
142,BASH,"Something that the law not only allows, but actually explicitly encourages?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
143,CLINTON,Absolutely.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
144,CLINTON,"You know, this is what I've saying for the past year.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
145,CLINTON,"No bank is too big to fail, no executive too powerful to jail.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
146,CLINTON,I have been talking about what we should be doing under Dodd- Frank.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
147,CLINTON,"I'm glad that Senator Sanders is now joining in talking about Dodd-Frank, because Dodd-Frank sets forth the approach that needs to be taken.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
148,CLINTON,"I believe, and I will appoint regulators who are tough enough and ready enough to break up any bank that fails the test under Dodd-Frank.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
149,CLINTON,There are two sections there.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

150,CLINTON,"If they fail either one, that they're a systemic risk, a grave risk to our economy, or if they fail the other, that their living wills, which is what you're referring to, is inadequate.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
151,CLINTON,Let's look at what is at stake here.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
152,CLINTON,We can never let Wall Street wreck Main street again.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
153,CLINTON,I spoke out against Wall Street when I was a Senator from New York.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
154,CLINTON,I have been standing up and saying continuously we have the law.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
155,CLINTON,We've got to execute under it.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
156,CLINTON,"So, you're right.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

157,CLINTON,"I will move immediately to break up any financial institution, but I go further because I want the law to extend to those that are part of the shadow banking industry.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
158,CLINTON,"The big insurance companies, the hedge funds, something that I have been arguing for now a long time...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
159,BASH,"... Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
160,BASH,"Senator Sanders, you were recently asked what you would replace the big Wall Street banks with if you could break them up.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
161,BASH,"You said, quote, ""That's their decision.""",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
162,BASH,Why would you trust the banks to restructure themselves?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
163,SANDERS,"First, Dana...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
164,BASH,when you said the whole business model was fraudulent?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
165,SANDERS,That's right.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
166,SANDERS,"So, let's start off with the basic premise.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
167,SANDERS,A few days ago Goldman Sachs formally reached a settlement with the United States government for $5 billion dollars.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
168,SANDERS,"What Goldman Sachs acknowledged was, essentially, that they were selling fraudulent packages of subprime mortgage loans.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
169,SANDERS,"Goldman Sachs was not the only bank, other banks, of course, did the same.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

170,SANDERS,"Now, I don't need Dodd-Frank now to tell me that we have got to break up these banks, A, because they're based on fraudulent principles, and B, because when you have six financial institutions that have assets equivalent to 58% of the GFP of this country, they are just too big, too much concentration of wealth and power.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
171,BASH,"But, Senator...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
172,SANDERS,The point is we have got to break them up so that they do not pose a systemic risk and so that we have a vibrant economy with a competitive financial system.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
173,BASH,"But Senator, you didn't answer the specific question which is not just about breaking up the banks, but why allow the banks to do it themselves?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
174,SANDERS,Because I'm not sure that the government should say is you are too big to fail.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
175,SANDERS,You've got to be a certain size.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
176,SANDERS,"And, then the banks themselves can figure out what they want to sell off.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
177,SANDERS,I don't know that it's appropriate that the Department of Treasury to be making those decisions.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
178,SANDERS,What we need is to make sure that they are safe.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
179,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
180,CLINTON,"Dana, you know -- I love being in Brooklyn.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
181,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE) (CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

182,CLINTON,"Dana, let me add here that there are two ways to at this under Dodd-Frank, which is after all the law we passed under President Obama, and I'm proud that Barney Frank, one of the authors, has endorsed me because what I have said continuously is, yes, sometimes the government may have to order certain actions.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

187,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

190,CLINTON,And hold them accountable as well.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
191,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

193,BASH,Can you name one decision that she made as senator that shows that he favored banks because of the money she received?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
194,SANDERS,Sure.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
195,SANDERS,Sure.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

196,SANDERS,"The obvious decision is when the greed and recklessness and illegal behavior of wall street brought this country into the worst economic downturn since the Great Recession -- the Great Depression of the '30s, when millions of people lost their jobs, and their homes, and their life savings, the obvious response to that is that you've got a bunch of fraudulent operators and that they have got to be broken up.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
197,SANDERS,"That was my view way back, and I introduced legislation to do that.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
198,SANDERS,"Now, Secretary Clinton was busy giving speeches to Goldman Sachs for $225,000 a speech.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
199,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
200,SANDERS,So the problem response -- the proper response in my view is we should break them up.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
201,SANDERS,And that's what my legislation does.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
202,CLINTON,"Well, you can tell, Dana, he cannot come up with any example, because there is no example.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
203,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
204,CLINTON,It is important -- it's always important.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
205,CLINTON,"It may be inconvenient, but it's always important to get the facts straight.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
206,CLINTON,I stood up against the behaviors of the banks when I was a senator.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
207,CLINTON,I called them out on their mortgage behavior.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
208,CLINTON,I also was very willing to speak out against some of the special privileges they had under the tax code.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
209,CLINTON,"When I went to the secretary of state office, the president -- President Obama led the effort to pass the Dodd-Frank bill.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
210,CLINTON,That is the law.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
211,CLINTON,"Now, this is our ninth debate.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
212,CLINTON,"In the prior eight debates, I have said, we have a law.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
213,CLINTON,"You don't just say, we're upset about this.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
214,CLINTON,I'm upset about it.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
215,CLINTON,"You don't just say, go break them up.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
216,CLINTON,"You have a law, because we are a nation of laws.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

479,BLITZER,But only 1.2 percent of the guns recovered in New York in 2014 were from Vermont.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
480,BLITZER,"Are you seriously blaming Vermont, and implicitly Senator Sanders, for New York's gun violence?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
481,CLINTON,"No, of course not.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
482,CLINTON,Of course not.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
483,CLINTON,This is -- this is a serious difference between us.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
484,SYSTEM,(LAUGHTER),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

485,CLINTON,"And what I want to start by saying -- it's not a laughing matter -- 90 people on average a day are killed or commit suicide or die in accidents from guns, 33,000 people a year.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
486,CLINTON,"I take it really seriously, because I have spent more time than I care to remember being with people who have lost their loved ones.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
487,CLINTON,"So, yes, we have a problem in America.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
488,CLINTON,We need a president who will stand up against the gun lobby.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
489,CLINTON,We need a president who will fight for commonsense gun safety reforms.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
490,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
491,CLINTON,And what we have here is a big difference.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
492,CLINTON,Senator Sanders voted against the Brady Bill five times.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

493,CLINTON,"He voted for the most important NRA priority, namely giving immunity from liability to gun-makers and dealers, something that is at the root of a lot of the problems that we are facing.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

494,CLINTON,"Then he doubled down on that in the New York Daily News interview, when asked whether he would support the Sandy Hook parents suing to try to do something to rein in the advertising of the AR-15, which is advertised to young people as being a combat weapon, killing on the battlefield.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
495,CLINTON,He said they didn't deserve their day in court.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
496,CLINTON,I could not disagree more.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
497,CLINTON,"And, finally, this is the only industry in America, the only one.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
498,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
499,CLINTON,That has this kind of special protection.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
500,CLINTON,"We hear a lot from Senator Sanders about the greed and recklessness of Wall Street, and I agree.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
501,CLINTON,We've got to hold Wall Street accountable...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
502,BLITZER,... Thank you...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
503,CLINTON,"... Well, what about the greed and recklessness of gun manufacturers and dealers in America?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
504,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE) (CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
505,BLITZER,Senator?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
506,BLITZER,"Well, the only problem is, Wolf, she didn't answer your question.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
507,BLITZER,You asked her whether she thought that Vermont was responsible.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
508,BLITZER,You asked her whether she thought that Vermont was responsible for a lot of the gun violence.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
509,BLITZER,You made the point what she said was totally absurd.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
510,BLITZER,"I asked her, are you seriously blaming Vermont and implicitly Senator Sanders for New York's gun violence.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
511,BLITZER,She said no.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
512,BLITZER,"But, go ahead.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
513,SANDERS,Then why did she put out that statement?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
514,CLINTON,I put it out...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
515,SANDERS,"... Excuse me, I think I'm responding now.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
516,BLITZER,"Please, go ahead sir.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
517,SANDERS,"A statement that was refuted by the governor of the state of Vermont, who was a supporter of hers, who said, yeah, in campaigns people tend to exaggerate.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
518,SANDERS,Here is the fact on guns.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
519,SANDERS,Let's talk about guns.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
520,SANDERS,"That horrible, horrible Sandy Hook -- what's the word we want to use, murder, assault, slaughter, unspeakable act.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
521,SANDERS,"Back in 1988, I ran for the United States Congress one seat in the state of Vermont.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
522,SANDERS,"I probably lost that election, which I lost by three points, because I was the only candidate running who said, you know what?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
523,SANDERS,"We should ban assault weapons, not seen them sold or distributed in the United States of America.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
524,SANDERS,I've got a D-minus voting record from the NRA.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
525,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

526,SANDERS,"And, in fact, because I come from a state which has virtually no gun control, I believe that I am the best qualified candidate to bring back together that consensus that is desperately needed in this country.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
527,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
528,BLITZER,"Thank you, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
529,BLITZER,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
530,SYSTEM,(CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

531,BLITZER,"Secretary Clinton, I want you to respond to that, but why did you put out that statement blaming Vermont and its gun policy for some of the death of -- by guns in New York?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
532,CLINTON,"Well, the facts are that most of the guns that end up committing crimes in New York come from out of state.",1,20160414_9dem.tsv
533,CLINTON,They come from the states that don't have kind of serious efforts to control guns that we do in New York.,1,20160414_9dem.tsv
534,CLINTON,"But let me say this -- in 1988, as we've heard on every debate occasion, Senator Sanders did run for the Congress and he lost.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
535,CLINTON,"He came back in 1990 and he won, and during that campaign he made a commitment to the NRA that he would be against waiting periods.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
536,CLINTON,"And, in fact, in his own book, he talks about his 1990 campaign, and here's what he said.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
537,CLINTON,"He clearly was helped by the NRA, because they ran ads against his opponent.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
538,CLINTON,"So, then he went to the Congress, where he has been a largely very reliable supporter of the NRA.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
539,CLINTON,"Voting -- he kept his word to the NRA, he voted against the Brady Bill five times because it had waiting periods in it.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
540,CLINTON,"Thankfully, enough people finally voted for it to keep guns out of the hands of who should not have them.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
541,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
542,BLITZER,"Senator, I want you to respond, but I also want you to respond to this.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
543,BLITZER,You recently said you do not think crime victims should be able to sue gun makers for damages.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
544,BLITZER,"The daughter of the Sandy Hook Elementary School who was killed back in the 2012 mass shooting, says you owe her and families an apology.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
545,BLITZER,Do you?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
546,SANDERS,What we need to do is to do everything that we can to make certain that guns do not fall into the hands of people who do not have them.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

547,SANDERS,"Now, I voted against this gun liability law because I was concerned that in rural areas all over this country, if a gun shop owner sells a weapon legally to somebody, and that person then goes out and kills somebody, I don't believe it is appropriate that that gun shop owner who just sold a legal weapon to be held accountable and be sued.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
548,SANDERS,"But, what I do believe is when gun shop owners and others knowingly are selling weapons to people who should not have them -- somebody walks in.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
549,SANDERS,"They want thousands of rounds of ammunition, or they want a whole lot of guns, yes, that gun shop owner or that gun manufacturer should be held liable.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
550,BLITZER,"So, Senator, do you owe the Sandy Hook families an apology?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
551,SANDERS,"No, I don't think I owe them an apology.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
552,SANDERS,"They are in court today, and actually they won a preliminary decision today.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
553,SANDERS,"They have the right to sue, and I support them and anyone else who wants the right to sue.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

554,CLINTON,"Well, I believe that the law that Senator Sanders voted for that I voted against, giving this special protection to gun manufacturers and to dealers, is an absolute abdication of responsibility on the part of those who voted for it.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

555,CLINTON,"This is a -- this is a unique gift given to only one industry in the world by the United States Congress, as Senator Murphy from Connecticut said, we have tougher standards holding toy gun manufacturers and sellers to account than we do for real guns.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
556,CLINTON,And the point that Senator Sanders keeps making about how he wouldn't want a mom and pop store -- that was not the point of this.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
557,CLINTON,"And if he can point to any, any incident where that happened, I would love to hear about it.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
558,CLINTON,"What was really going on, I'll tell you, because it has a lot to do with New York City.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
559,CLINTON,New York City was on the brink of being able to hold manufacturers and dealers accountable through a very carefully crafted legal strategy.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
560,BLITZER,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
561,CLINTON,"The NRA came to their supporters in the Congress and said, stop it, stop it now, and Senator Sanders joined those who did.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
562,BLITZER,"Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
563,BLITZER,"Senator, go ahead.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

564,SANDERS,"Let me just reiterate -- just reiterate so there is no confusion, decades ago, before it was popular, in a rural state with no gun control, Bernie Sanders said, let's ban assault weapons, not see them distributed in the United States of America.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
565,BLITZER,"Thank you, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

568,LOUIS,It also imposed tougher prison sentences and eliminated federal funding for inmate education.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
569,LOUIS,"Looking at the bill as a whole, do you believe it was a net positive or do you think it was a mistake?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
570,CLINTON,"Well, I think that it had some positive aspects to it.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
571,CLINTON,And you mentioned some of them.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
572,CLINTON,"The Violence Against Women Act, which has been a very important piece of legislation, in my opinion.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
573,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
574,CLINTON,And it also did some things which were to provide more opportunities for young people.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
575,CLINTON,"So if we were to have the balance sheet on one side, there are some positive actions and changes.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
576,CLINTON,"On the other side, there were decisions that were made that now we must revisit and we have to correct.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
577,CLINTON,I think that sentences got much too long.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
578,CLINTON,"The original idea was not that we would increase sentences for non-violent low-level offenders, but once the federal government did what it did, states piled on.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
579,CLINTON,So we have a problem.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
580,CLINTON,And the very first speech I gave in this campaign was about what I will do to reform the criminal justice system and end the over-mass incarceration.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

581,CLINTON,"So I think that if all of us go and look back at where we were, Senator Sanders voted for the crime bill, and he says the same thing, there were some good things, and things that we have to change and learn from.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
582,CLINTON,So that's how I see it.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
583,CLINTON,And I think we ought to be putting our attention on forging a consensus to make the changes that will divert more people from the criminal justice system to start.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
584,LOUIS,"Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
585,CLINTON,To tackle systemic racism and divert people in the beginning.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

589,CLINTON,"Well, look, I supported the crime bill.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
590,CLINTON,My husband has apologized.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

595,CLINTON,I've seen the results of what has happened in families and in communities.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

596,CLINTON,"That's why I chose to make my very first speech a year ago on this issue, Errol, because I want to focus the attention of our country and to make the changes we need to make.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
597,CLINTON,And I also want people...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

605,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

611,SANDERS,This took us a good step forward.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
612,SANDERS,We're talking about the weapon that killed the children in Sandy Hook.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
613,SANDERS,"This banned assault weapons, not insignificant.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
614,SANDERS,But where we are today is we have a broken criminal justice system.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
615,SANDERS,We have more people in jail than any other country on Earth.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
616,SANDERS,"And in my view, what we have got to do is rethink the system from the bottom on up.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
617,SANDERS,"And that means, for a start -- and we don't talk about this.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
618,SANDERS,The media doesn't talk about it -- you got 51 percent of African-American kids today who graduated high school who are unemployed or underemployed.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
619,SANDERS,You know what I think?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
620,SANDERS,"Maybe we invest in jobs and education for those kids, not jails and incarceration.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
621,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

623,SANDERS,And I'll tell you what else I think.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
624,SANDERS,"And that is, we have got -- and this is the difference between the secretary and myself as I understand it.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
625,SANDERS,We have got to have the guts to rethink the so-called war on drugs.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
626,SANDERS,"Too many lives... BLITZER: Thank you, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
627,SANDERS,"Too many lives have been destroyed because people possessed marijuana, millions over a 30-year period.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
628,SANDERS,And that is why I believe we should take marijuana out of the federal Controlled Substance Act.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
629,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

631,LOUIS,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

633,CLINTON,"Well, look, I think that, as Senator Sanders said about what I said, I will say about what he said.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
634,CLINTON,I think that we recognize that we have a set of problems that we cannot ignore and we must address.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

635,CLINTON,"And that is why I have been promoting for my entire adult life, I think, the idea of investing early in kids, early childhood education, universal pre-K, like what Mayor de Blasio brought to New York.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
636,CLINTON,We have got to help more kids get off to a good start.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

645,LOUIS,"To fulfill that promise, you'd have to release roughly half a million prisoners.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
646,LOUIS,"How are you going to do that, since the vast majority of American prisoners are not under federal jurisdiction?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

648,SANDERS,And you know what?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

649,SANDERS,"In a very divided Congress, and a very divided politics in America, actually the one area where there is some common ground is conservatives understand that it's insane to be spending $80 billion a year locking up 2.2 million people.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

650,SANDERS,"With federal and presidential leadership, we will work with state governments to make sure that people are released from jail under strong supervision, that they get the kind of job training and education they need so they can return to their communities.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
651,SANDERS,"On this one, Errol, actually I think you're going to see progressive and conservative support.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
652,SANDERS,"We can do it, if we're prepared to be bold.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

659,BLITZER,Let's turn to another critically important issue.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
660,BLITZER,"Senator, Secretary, the issue of energy and the environment.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
661,BLITZER,"Secretary Clinton, Senator Sanders has said you are in the pocket of the fossil fuel industry.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
662,BLITZER,You say you're sick and tired of him lying about your record.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
663,BLITZER,What are his lies?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

664,CLINTON,"Well, let me start by saying we need to talk about this issue and we should talk about it in terms of the extraordinary threats that climate change pose to our country and our world.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
665,CLINTON,"And that's why for the last many years, both in the Senate and as secretary of State, it's been a big part of my commitment to see what could be done.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
666,CLINTON,"But there has never been any doubt that when I was a senator, I tried -- I joined with others to try to get rid of the subsidies for big oil.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
667,CLINTON,"And I have proposed that again, because that's what I think needs to be done as we transition from fossil fuels to clean energy.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

668,CLINTON,"And everyone who's looked at this independently, ""The Washington Post"" and others, who give us both hard times when called for on facts, have said that this is absolutely an incorrect false charge.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
669,CLINTON,"So, we both have relatively small amounts of contributions from people who work for fossil fuel companies.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
670,CLINTON,Best we can tell from the reports that are done.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
671,CLINTON,"But, that is not being supported by big oil, and I think it's important to distinguish that.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
672,CLINTON,"And, let's talk about what each of us has proposed to try to combat greenhouse gas emissions and put us on the fastest track possible to clean energy.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
673,BLITZER,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
674,BLITZER,"We're going to get to that to, but I want you to respond, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
675,SANDERS,"It is one thing, as the Secretary indicated, to talk about workers.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
676,SANDERS,"I'm sure I have contributions, you have contributions from workers in every industry in the country.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
677,SANDERS,"But, as I understand it, 43 lobbyists for the fossil fuel industry maxed out, gave the maximum amount of money to Secretary Clinton's campaign.",1,20160414_9dem.tsv
678,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
679,SANDERS,"Now, that's not saying -- and, then some people say, well, given the hundreds of millions of dollars she raises it's a small amount.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
680,SANDERS,That's true.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
681,SANDERS,"But, that does not mean to say that the lobbyists thought she was a pretty good bet on this issue.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
682,SANDERS,"Now, what I think is when we look at climate change now, we have got to realize that this is a global environmental crisis of unprecedented urgency.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
683,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE) (CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
684,SANDERS,"And, it is not good enough.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
685,SANDERS,"You know, if we, God forbid, were attacked tomorrow the whole country would rise up and say we got an enemy out there and we got to do something about it.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
686,SANDERS,That was what 9/11 was about.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
687,SANDERS,"We have an enemy out there, and that enemy is going to cause drought and floods and extreme weather disturbances.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
688,SANDERS,There's going to be international conflict.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
689,SANDERS,"(APPLAUSE) I am proud, Wolf, that I have introduced the most comprehensive climate change legislation...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
691,BLITZER,Thank you...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
692,SANDERS,... Including a tax on carbon.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
693,SANDERS,Something I don't believe Secretary Clinton supports.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
694,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE) (CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
695,BLITZER,"Secretary Clinton, go ahead and respond.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
696,CLINTON,"Well, let's talk about the global environmental crisis.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

697,CLINTON,"Starting in 2009 as your Secretary of State, I worked with President Obama to bring China and India to the table for the very first time, to get a commitment out of them that they would begin to address their own greenhouse gas emissions.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
698,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

699,CLINTON,"I continued to work on that throughout the four years as Secretary of State, and I was very proud that President Obama and America led the way to the agreement that was finally reached in Paris with 195 nations committing to take steps to actually make a difference in climate change.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
700,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
701,CLINTON,"And, I was surprised and disappointed when Senator Sanders attacked the agreement, said it was not enough, it didn't go far enough.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
702,CLINTON,"You know, at some point putting together 195 countries, I know a little bit about that, was a major accomplishment...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
703,BLITZER,... Thank you...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
704,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
705,CLINTON,"... And, our President led the effort to protect our world and he deserve our appreciation, not our criticism...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
706,BLITZER,"... Go ahead, Senator...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
707,SANDERS,... Let's talk about that.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
708,SANDERS,"When you were Secretary of State, you also worked hard to expand fracking to countries all over the world.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
709,SYSTEM,(CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
710,SANDERS,"The issue here -- of course the agreement is a step forward, but you know agreements and I know agreements, there's a lot of paper there.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
711,SANDERS,We've got to get beyond paper right now.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
712,SANDERS,"We have got to lead the world in transforming our energy system, not tomorrow, but yesterday.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
713,SANDERS,"(APPLAUSE) And, what that means, Wolf, it means having the guts to take on the fossil fuel industry.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
714,SANDERS,"Now, I am on board legislation that says, you know what, we ain't going to excavate for fossil fuel on public land.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
715,SANDERS,That's not Secretary Clinton's position.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
716,BLITZER,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
717,BLITZER,Let us support a tax on carbon...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
718,BLITZER,... Secretary Clinton...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
719,SANDERS,... Not Secretary Clinton's position.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
720,BLITZER,... Go ahead and respond.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
721,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

722,CLINTON,"Well, I'm a little bewildered about how to respond when you have an agreement which gives you the framework to actually take the action that would have only come about because under the Obama administration in the face of implacable hostility from the Republicans in Congress, President Obama moved forward on gas mileage, he moved forward on the clean power plant.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
723,CLINTON,He has moved forward on so many of the fronts that he could given the executive actions that he was able to take.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
724,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

725,CLINTON,"And, you know, I am getting a little bit -- I'm getting a little bit concerned here because, you know, I really believe that the President has done an incredible job against great odds and deserves to be supported.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
726,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE) (CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
727,CLINTON,"Now, it's easy -- it's easy to diagnose the problem.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
728,CLINTON,It's harder to do something about the problem.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
729,CLINTON,And...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
730,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
731,BLITZER,"Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
732,BLITZER,We'll continue on this.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
733,BLITZER,"Errol -- Errol Louis, go ahead with your question.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
734,SANDERS,Wolf.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
735,SANDERS,Wolf.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
736,BLITZER,We're going to continue on this.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
737,BLITZER,"Errol, go ahead.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
738,LOUIS,"OK. Secretary Clinton, as secretary of state, you also pioneered a program to promote fracking around the world, as you described.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
739,LOUIS,"Fracking, of course, a way of extracting natural gas.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

740,LOUIS,"Now as a candidate for president, you say that by the time you're done with all your rules and regulations, fracking will be restricted in many places around the country.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
741,LOUIS,Why have you changed your view on fracking?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

742,CLINTON,"No, well, I don't think I've changed my view on what we need to do to go from where we are, where the world is heavily dependent on coal and oil, but principally coal, to where we need to be, which is clean renewable energy, and one of the bridge fuels is natural gas.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

743,CLINTON,"And so for both economic and environmental and strategic reasons, it was American policy to try to help countries get out from under the constant use of coal, building coal plants all the time, also to get out from under, especially if they were in Europe, the pressure from Russia, which has been incredibly intense.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
744,CLINTON,So we did say natural gas is a bridge.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
745,CLINTON,"We want to cross that bridge as quickly as possible, because in order to deal with climate change, we have got to move as rapidly as we can.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
746,CLINTON,That's why I've set big goals.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

747,CLINTON,I want to see us deploy a half a billion more solar panels by the end of my first term and enough clean energy to provide electricity to every home in America within 10 years.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
748,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

749,CLINTON,"So I have big, bold goals, but I know in order to get from where we are, where the world is still burning way too much coal, where the world is still too intimidated by countries and providers like Russia, we have got to make a very firm but decisive move in the direction of clean energy.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
750,LOUIS,"Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
751,LOUIS,"All right, Senator?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
752,SANDERS,"All right, here is -- here is a real difference.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
753,SANDERS,"This is a difference between understanding that we have a crisis of historical consequence here, and incrementalism and those little steps are not enough.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
754,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
755,SANDERS,Not right now.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
756,SANDERS,Not on climate change.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
757,SANDERS,"Now, the truth is, as secretary of state, Secretary Clinton actively supported fracking technology around the world.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
758,SANDERS,"Second of all, right now, we have got to tell the fossil fuel industry that their short-term profits are not more important than the future of this planet.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
759,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
760,SANDERS,And that means -- and I would ask you to respond.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
761,SANDERS,Are you in favor of a tax on carbon so that we can transit away from fossil fuel to energy efficiency and sustainable energy at the level and speed we need to do?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
762,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

763,CLINTON,"You know, I have laid out a set of actions that build on what President Obama was able to accomplish, building on the clean power plan, which is currently under attack by fossil fuels and the right in the Supreme Court, which is one of the reasons why we need to get the Supreme Court justice that President Obama has nominated to be confirmed so that we can actually continue to make progress.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
764,CLINTON,I don't take a back seat to your legislation that you've introduced that you haven't been able to get passed.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
765,CLINTON,I want to do what we can do to actually make progress in dealing with the crisis.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
766,CLINTON,That's exactly what I have proposed.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
767,LOUIS,"OK, thank you, Secretary Clinton.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
768,CLINTON,And my approach I think is going to get us there faster without tying us up into political knots with a Congress that still would not support what you are proposing.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
769,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
770,LOUIS,"Senator Sanders, you've said that climate change is the greatest change to our nation's security.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
771,SANDERS,Secretary Clinton did not answer one simple question.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
772,LOUIS,"Excuse me, Senator, Senator, Senator, Senator, Senator...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
773,SANDERS,Are you for a tax on carbon or not?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
774,LOUIS,I have a question for you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
775,LOUIS,You've said that climate change is the greatest threat to our nation's security.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
776,LOUIS,You've called for a nationwide ban on fracking.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
777,LOUIS,You've also called for phasing out all nuclear power in the U.S.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
778,LOUIS,"But wouldn't those proposals drive the country back to coal and oil, and actually undermine your fight against global warming?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
779,SANDERS,"No, they wouldn't.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
780,SANDERS,"Look, here's where we are.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
781,SANDERS,Let me reiterate.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
782,SANDERS,We have a global crisis.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
783,SANDERS,Pope Francis reminded us that we are on a suicide course.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
784,SANDERS,"Our legislation understands, Errol, that there will be economic dislocation.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
785,SANDERS,It is absolutely true.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
786,SANDERS,There will be some people who lose their job.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
787,SANDERS,And we build into our legislation an enormous amount of money to protect those workers.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
788,SANDERS,It is not their fault...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
789,SANDERS,It is not their fault that fossil fuels are destroying our climate.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
790,SANDERS,"But we have got to stand up and say right now, as we would if we were attacked by some military force, we have got to move urgency -- urgently and boldly.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
791,SANDERS,What does that mean?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
792,UNIDENTIFIED MALE,"Senator -- senator, jobs...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
793,SANDERS,Yes?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

794,UNIDENTIFIED MALE,"-- jobs are one thing, but with less than 6 percent of all U.S. energy coming from solar, wind and geothermal, and 20 percent of U.S. power coming from nuclear, if you phase out all of that, how do you make up...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
795,SANDERS,"Well, you don't phase...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
796,UNIDENTIFIED MALE,-- that difference?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
797,SANDERS,-- it all out tomorrow.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
798,SANDERS,And you certainly don't phase nuclear out tomorrow.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
799,SANDERS,But this is what you do do.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
800,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
801,SANDERS,What you do do is say that we are going to have a massive program -- and I had introduced -- introduced legislation for 10 million solar rooftops.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
802,SANDERS,We can put probably millions of people to work retrofitting and weatherizing buildings all over this country.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
803,SYSTEM,(CHEERING),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
804,SANDERS,Saving -- rebuilding our rail system.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
805,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
806,SANDERS,Our mass transit system.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
807,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

808,SANDERS,"If we approach this, Errol, as if we were literally at a war -- you know, in 1941, under Franklin Delano Roosevelt, we moved within three years, within three more years to rebuild our economy to defeat Nazism and Japanese imperialism.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
809,SANDERS,That is exactly the kind of approach we need right now.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
810,BLITZER,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
811,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
812,SANDERS,Lead the world.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
813,BLITZER,"Thank you, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
814,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
815,BLITZER,Let's turn to another critically important issue...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
816,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
817,BLITZER,-- the issue of national security and foreign policy.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

818,BLITZER,"Secretary Clinton, President Obama says the worst mistake in office that he made over these past seven and a half years was not preparing for Libya after Moammar Qadafi was removed.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
819,BLITZER,You were his secretary of State.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
820,BLITZER,Aren't you also responsible for that?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
821,CLINTON,"Well, let me say I think we did a great deal to help the Libyan people after Qadafi's demise.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
822,CLINTON,And here's what we did.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

823,CLINTON,"We helped them hold two successful elections, something that is not easy, which they did very well because they had a pent up desire to try to chart their own future after 42 years of dictatorship.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
824,CLINTON,I was very proud of that.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
825,CLINTON,"We got rid of the chemical weapons stockpile that Qadafi had, getting it out of Libya, getting it away from militias or terrorist groups.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
826,CLINTON,We also worked to help them set up their government.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
827,CLINTON,We sent a lot of American experts there.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
828,CLINTON,"We offered to help them secure their borders, to train a new military.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
829,CLINTON,"They, at the end, when it came to security issues, Wolf, did not want troops from any other country, not just us, European or other countries, in Libya.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
830,CLINTON,And so we were caught in a very difficult position.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
831,CLINTON,"They could not provide security on their own, which we could see and we told them that, but they didn't want to have others helping to provide that security.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
832,CLINTON,"And the result has been a clash between different parts of the country, terrorists taking up some locations in the country.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
833,CLINTON,And we can't walk away from that.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
834,CLINTON,We need to be working with European and Arab partners...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
835,BLITZER,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
836,CLINTON,-- with the United Nations in order to continue to try to support them.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
837,CLINTON,The Libyan people deserve a chance at democracy and self- government.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
838,CLINTON,"And I, as president, will keep trying to give that to them",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
839,BLITZER,"Senator, go ahead.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
840,SANDERS,"According to ""The New York Times.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
841,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
842,SANDERS,"for President Obama, this was a pretty tough call, like a 51-49 call, do you overthrow Qadafi, who, of course, was a horrific dictator?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
843,SANDERS,"The New York Times"" told us it was Secretary Clinton who led the effect for that regime change.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
844,SANDERS,And this is the same type of mentality that supported the war in Iraq.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
845,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
846,SANDERS,Look...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
847,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
848,SANDERS,"-- Qadafi, Saddam Hussein are brutal, brutal murdering thugs.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
849,SANDERS,No debate about that.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
850,SANDERS,But what we have got to do and what the president was saying is we didn't think thoroughly about what happens the day after you get rid of these dictators.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
851,SANDERS,"Regime change often has unintended consequences in Iraq and in Libya right now, where ISIS has a very dangerous foothold.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
852,SANDERS,And I think if you studied the whole history of...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
853,BLITZER,Yes.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
854,SANDERS,"-- American involvement in regime change, you see that quite often.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
855,BLITZER,"Secretary, we're going to let you respond.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
856,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
857,CLINTON,"Yes, well, I...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
858,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
860,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

861,CLINTON,"-- I -- I would just point out that there was a vote in the Senate as to whether or not the United States should support the efforts by the Libyan people to protect themselves against the threats, the genocidal threats coming from Gadhafi, and whether we should go to the United Nations to seek Security Council support.",1,20160414_9dem.tsv
862,CLINTON,"Senator Sanders voted for that, and that's exactly what we did.",1,20160414_9dem.tsv
863,SANDERS,No.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
864,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
865,CLINTON,"We went to the United Nations -- yes, he did.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
866,CLINTON,We went to the United Nations Security Council.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
867,CLINTON,We got support from the Security Council.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
868,CLINTON,And we then supported the efforts of our European and Arab allies and partners.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
869,CLINTON,This was a request made to our government by the Europeans and by the Arabs because of their great fear of what chaos in Syria would do to them.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
870,CLINTON,"And if you want to know what chaos does, not just to the people inside but the people on the borders, look at Syria.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
871,CLINTON,"Nobody stood up to Assad and removed him, and we have had a far greater disaster in Syria than we are currently dealing with right now in Libya.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
872,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
873,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
874,BLITZER,"Senator, go ahead.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
875,SANDERS,Secretary Clinton made this charge in previous debates and just repeating it doesn't make it truer.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
876,SANDERS,"What you are talking about is what I think was what they call the unanimous consent, you know what that is, where basically, do we support Libya moving to democracy?",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
877,SANDERS,"Well, you know what, I surely have always supported Libya moving to democracy.",1,20160414_9dem.tsv
878,SANDERS,But please do not confuse that with your active effort for regime change without contemplating what happened the day after.,1,20160414_9dem.tsv
879,SANDERS,Totally different issue.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
880,CLINTON,"Well, that isn't...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
881,SANDERS,"Second of all -- second of all, if I might, in terms of Syria, in terms of Syria...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
882,BLITZER,"Senator, let her respond to that, then we'll get to that.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
883,BLITZER,"Go ahead, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
884,CLINTON,"There was also in that a reference to the Security Council, and I know you're not shy when you oppose something, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
885,CLINTON,"So, yes, it was unanimous.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
886,CLINTON,"That's exactly right, including you.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
887,CLINTON,And what we did was to try to provide support for our European and Arab allies and partners.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
888,CLINTON,The decision was the president's.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
889,CLINTON,Did I do the due diligence?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
890,CLINTON,Did I talk to everybody I could talk to?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
891,CLINTON,Did I visit every capital and then report back to the president?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
892,CLINTON,"Yes, I did.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
893,CLINTON,That's what a secretary of state does.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
894,CLINTON,"But at the end of the day, those are the decisions that are made by the president to in any way use American military power.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
895,CLINTON,And the president made that decision.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
896,CLINTON,"And, yes, we did try without success because of the Libyans' obstruction to our efforts, but we did try and we will continue to try to help the Libyan people.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
897,BLITZER,"Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
898,BLITZER,"Go ahead, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
899,SANDERS,"If you listen, you know -- two points.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
900,SANDERS,"Number one, yes, 100-0 in the Senate voted for democracy in Libya and I would vote for that again.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

901,SANDERS,But that is very different from getting actively involved to overthrow and bring about regime change without fully understanding what the consequence of that regime change would be.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

902,SANDERS,"Second of all, I know you keep referring to Barack Obama all night here, but you in Syria, you in Syria talked about a no-fly zone, which the president certainly does not support, nor do I support because, A, it will cost an enormous sum of money, second of all, it runs the risk of getting us sucked into perpetual warfare in that region.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

903,SANDERS,"Thirdly, when we talk about Syria right now, no debate, like Gadhafi, like Saddam Hussein, Assad is another brutal murdering dictator, but right now our fight is to destroy ISIS first, and to get rid of Assad second.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
904,CLINTON,"Well, I think Senator Sanders has just reinforced my point.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

905,CLINTON,"Yes, when I was secretary of state I did urge, along with the Department of Defense and the CIA that we seek out, vet, and train, and arm Syrian opposition figures so that they could defend themselves against Assad.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
906,CLINTON,The president said no.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
907,CLINTON,"Now, that's how it works.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
908,CLINTON,People who work for the president make recommendations and then the president makes the decision.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
909,CLINTON,So I think it's only fair to look at where we are in Syria today.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

910,CLINTON,"And, yes, I do still support a no-fly zone because I think we need to put in safe havens for those poor Syrians who are fleeing both Assad and ISIS and have some place that they can be safe.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
911,BLITZER,"Staying on national security, Dana Bash has a question.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

912,BASH,"Senator Sanders, in 1997, you said this about NATO, you said, quote: ""It is not the time to continue wasting tens of billions of dollars helping to defend Europe, let alone assuming more than our share of any cost associated with expanding NATO.""",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
913,BASH,Do you still feel that way?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
914,SANDERS,"Well, what I believe, if my memory is correct here, we spend about 75 percent of the entire cost of the military aspect of NATO.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

915,SANDERS,"Given the fact that France has a very good health care system and free public education, college education for their people, the U.K. has a good National Health Service and they also provide fairly reasonable higher education, you know what, yeah, I do believe that the countries of Europe should pick up more of the burden for their defense.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
916,SANDERS,"Yes, I do.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
917,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
918,BASH,"And just following up, Senator Sanders, Donald Trump also argues that NATO is unfair economically to the U.S. because America pays a disproportionate share.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
919,BASH,So how is what you say about NATO and your proposal different than his?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
920,SANDERS,"Well, you got to ask -- you got to ask Trump.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

921,SANDERS,"All I can tell you is, with a huge deficit, with 47 million people living in poverty, with our inner cities collapsing, yeah, I do think countries like Germany and U.K. and France and European countries whose economy, or at least its standard of living and health care and education, they're doing pretty well.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv

922,SANDERS,"So I would not be embarrassed as president of the United States to stay to our European allies, you know what, the United States of America cannot just support your economies.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
923,SANDERS,You got to put up your own fair share of the defense burden.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
924,SANDERS,Nothing wrong with that.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
925,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
926,BASH,Secretary Clinton?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
927,CLINTON,I support our continuing involvement in NATO.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
928,CLINTON,And it is important to ask for our NATO allies to pay more of the cost.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
929,CLINTON,"There is a requirement that they should be doing so, and I believe that needs to be enforced.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
