1402,CLINTON,"And when we end up with the number of delegates we need, we will unite the party and have a unified convention...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1403,BLITZER,"Senator, go ahead.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1404,CLINTON,... that we'll go onto the general election with.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1405,SANDERS,The reason -- the reason why in virtually every contest we are winning by very strong margins younger people -- and I'm not just talking about very young.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

1406,SANDERS,"You know, the older you get, the younger young gets -- 45 or younger -- is I think people are sensing that establishment politics and dependence on Wall Street and big money interest is really never going to address the crises that we face.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1407,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

1408,SANDERS,"And people understand, you can't take money from powerful special interests into your PAC and then really expect the American people to believe you're going to stand up to these powerful special interests.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1409,SANDERS,So I am very proud of the fact that we have brought millions of new people into the political process...,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1410,BLITZER,"Thank you, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1411,SANDERS,... many of whom previously had given up.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1412,BLITZER,"Thank you, Senator, very much.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1413,BLITZER,"The candidates, they will make their final pitches to New York voters right after this.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1414,BLITZER,Welcome back to the CNN presidential debate.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1415,BLITZER,It's time for the candidates' closing statements.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1416,BLITZER,Each candidate will have two minutes.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1417,BLITZER,"Senator Sanders, you're first.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1418,SANDERS,"I grew up in Brooklyn, New York...",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1419,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv

1420,SANDERS,"... the son of an immigrant who came to this country from Poland at the age of 17 without a nickel in his pocket, never made a whole lot of money, but was a very proud American, because this country gave him and my mom the opportunity to send their kids to college.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1421,SANDERS,I believe that this country has enormous potential if we have the guts to take on the big money interests who dominate our economic and political life.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

1422,SANDERS,"And I disagree with Secretary Clinton in the belief that you can get money from Wall Street, that you can get money for a super PAC from powerful special interests, and then at the end of the day do what has to be done for the working families of this country.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1423,SANDERS,I just don't accept that.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

1424,SANDERS,"What I believe is that this country, if we stand together and not let the Trumps of the world divide us up, can guarantee health care to all people as a right, can have paid family and medical leave, can make public colleges and universities tuition-free, can lead the world in transforming our energy system and combatting climate change, can break up the large financial institutions, can demand that the wealthiest people in this country start paying their fair share of taxes.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1425,SANDERS,"And we can do that when millions of people stand up, fight back, and create a government that works for all of us, not just the 1 percent.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1426,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1427,SANDERS,That is what the political revolution is about.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1428,SANDERS,That is what this campaign is about.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1429,SANDERS,"And with your help, we're going to win here in New York.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1430,SANDERS,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1431,SANDERS,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1432,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1433,BLITZER,Secretary Clinton?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1434,BLITZER,Secretary Clinton?,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1435,CLINTON,Thank you.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1436,CLINTON,I am very grateful for the fact that the people of New York gave me the great honor of serving as your senator.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1437,CLINTON,"You took a chance on me in 2000, and then you re-elected me with one of the biggest margins we've had in our state in 2006.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1438,CLINTON,"During those years, we worked closely together.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1439,CLINTON,"I tried to have your back, and time and time again, you had mine.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1440,CLINTON,We took on the challenges of 9/11 together.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1441,CLINTON,We got the money to rebuild New York.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

1442,CLINTON,"We came to the aid of our brave first responders, construction workers, and others who endangered their own health by helping to save lives and search for survivors.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1443,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1444,CLINTON,We worked to create jobs -- despite the disastrous policies of George W. Bush -- across New York.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1445,CLINTON,And we stood up time and time again against all kinds of vested powerful interests.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv

1446,CLINTON,"I'm asking for your support again in the primary on Tuesday to continue that work together, to take what we did in New York and to take those New York values to the White House, and put them to work on behalf of all of our people, to knock down the barriers that stand in the way.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1447,CLINTON,"You know, of course we have economic barriers.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1448,CLINTON,I've been fighting against those trying to even the odds most of my adult life.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1449,CLINTON,"But we also have racial barriers, gender barriers, homophobic barriers, disability barriers.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1450,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1451,CLINTON,We have a lot of barriers that stand in the way of people being treated as they should and having the chance to live up to their own God-given potential.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1452,CLINTON,So I am humbly asking for your support on Tuesday.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1453,CLINTON,I'll work my heart out for you again.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1454,CLINTON,"And together, we won't just make promises we can't keep.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1455,CLINTON,We'll deliver results that will improve the lives of the people in New York and in America.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1456,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1457,CLINTON,That's what we'll do together.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1458,CLINTON,"Thank you, New York.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1459,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1460,BLITZER,"Thank you, Secretary.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1461,BLITZER,"Thank you very much, Senator.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1462,BLITZER,I want to thank the candidates for a really terrific debate.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1463,BLITZER,"Thanks also to Dana Bash and Errol Louis, as well as NY1, the Democratic National Committee, and everyone here at the Duggal Greenhouse at the Brooklyn Navy Yard.",0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1464,BLITZER,Stay with CNN now for complete coverage of the New York primary next Tuesday.,0,20160414_9dem.tsv
1,TRUMP,"Thank you, thank you.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
2,TRUMP,Thank you very much.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
3,TRUMP,"Friends, delegates and fellow Americans: I humbly and gratefully accept your nomination for the presidency of the United States.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
4,TRUMP,"USA, USA, USA, USA, USA.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

5,TRUMP,Who would have believed that when we started this journey because we are a team would have received almost 14 million votes the most in the history of the Republican party and that the Republican party would get 60 percent more votes than it received eight years ago.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
6,TRUMP,Who would have believed this.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
7,TRUMP,Who would have believed this.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
8,TRUMP,The Democrats on the other hand received 20 percent fewer votes than they got four years ago.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
9,TRUMP,Not so good.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
10,TRUMP,Not so good.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
11,TRUMP,"Together, we will lead our party back to the White House, and we will lead our country back to safety, prosperity, and peace.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
12,TRUMP,We will be a country of generosity and warmth.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
13,TRUMP,But we will also be a country of law and order.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
14,TRUMP,Our Convention occurs at a moment of crisis for our nation.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
15,TRUMP,"The attacks on our police, and the terrorism of our cities, threaten our very way of life.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
16,TRUMP,Any politician who does not grasp this danger is not fit to lead our country.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
17,TRUMP,Americans watching this address tonight have seen the recent images of violence in our streets and the chaos in our communities.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
18,TRUMP,"Many have witnessed this violence personally, some have even been its victims.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
19,TRUMP,"I have a message for all of you: the crime and violence that today afflicts our nation will soon, and I mean very soon, come to an end.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
20,TRUMP,"Beginning on January 20th of 2017, safety will be restored.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
21,TRUMP,The most basic duty of government is to defend the lives of its own citizens.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
22,TRUMP,Any government that fails to do so is a government unworthy to lead.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
23,TRUMP,It is finally time for a straightforward assessment of the state of our nation.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
24,TRUMP,I will present the facts plainly and honestly.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
25,TRUMP,We cannot afford to be so politically correct anymore.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
26,TRUMP,"So if you want to hear the corporate spin, the carefully-crafted lies, and the media myths the Democrats are holding their convention next week.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
27,TRUMP,Go there.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
28,TRUMP,"But here, at our convention, there will be no lies.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
29,TRUMP,"We will honor the American people with the truth, and nothing else.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
30,TRUMP,These are the facts: Decades of progress made in bringing down crime are now being reversed by this Administration's rollback of criminal enforcement.,1,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
31,TRUMP,Homicides last year increased by 17 percent in America's fifty largest cities.,1,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
32,TRUMP,That's the largest increase in 25 years.,1,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
33,TRUMP,"In our nation's capital, killings have risen by 50 percent.",1,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
34,TRUMP,They are up nearly 60% in nearby Baltimore.,1,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
35,TRUMP,"In the President's hometown of Chicago, more than 2,000 people have been the victims of shootings this year alone.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
36,TRUMP,"And more than 4,000 have been killed in the Chicago area since he took office.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
37,TRUMP,The number of police officers killed in the line of duty has risen by almost 50% compared to this point last year.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
38,TRUMP,"Nearly 180,000 illegal immigrants with criminal records, ordered deported from our country, are tonight roaming free to threaten peaceful citizens.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
39,TRUMP,The number of new illegal immigrant families who have crossed the border so far this year already exceeds the entire total from 2015.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
40,TRUMP,They are being released by the tens of thousands into our communities with no regard for the impact on public safety or resources.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
41,TRUMP,One such border-crosser was released and made his way to Nebraska.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
42,TRUMP,"There, he ended the life of an innocent young girl named Sarah Root.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

44,TRUMP,Number one in her class.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
45,TRUMP,"Her killer was then released a second time, and he is now a fugitive from the law.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
46,TRUMP,I've met Sarah's beautiful family.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
47,TRUMP,"But to this Administration, their amazing daughter was just one more American life that wasn't worth protecting.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
48,TRUMP,No more.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

64,TRUMP,One after another.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

123,TRUMP,I have no patience for injustice.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
124,TRUMP,"No tolerance for government incompetence of which there is so much, no sympathy for leaders who fail their citizens.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

126,TRUMP,And I won't look the other way.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

127,TRUMP,"And when a Secretary of State illegally stores her emails on a private server, deletes 33,000 of them so the authorities can't see her crime, puts our country at risk, lies about it in every different form and faces no consequence – I know that corruption has reached a level like never ever before in our country.",1,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

139,TRUMP,"In this cause, I am proud to have at my side the next Vice President of the United States: Governor Mike Pence of Indiana.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

365,TRUMP,"It reads: ""I'm With Her"".",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
366,TRUMP,I choose to recite a different pledge.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
367,TRUMP,"My pledge reads: ""I'M WITH YOU – THE AMERICAN PEOPLE.""",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
368,TRUMP,I am your voice.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv

369,TRUMP,"So to every parent who dreams for their child, and every child who dreams for their future, I say these words to you tonight: I am With You, and I will fight for you, and I will win for you.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
370,TRUMP,"To all Americans tonight, in all of our cities and in all of our towns, I make this promise: We Will Make America Strong Again.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
371,TRUMP,We Will Make America Proud Again.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
372,TRUMP,We Will Make America Safe Again.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
373,TRUMP,And We Will Make America Great Again.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
374,TRUMP,"God bless you, and goodnight.",0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
375,TRUMP,I love you.,0,20160722_trump_acceptance.tsv
1,HOLT,"Good evening from Hofstra University in Hempstead, New York.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
2,HOLT,"I'm Lester Holt, anchor of ""NBC Nightly News.""",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
3,HOLT,I want to welcome you to the first presidential debate.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
4,HOLT,The participants tonight are Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
5,HOLT,"This debate is sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates, a nonpartisan, nonprofit organization.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
6,HOLT,"The commission drafted tonight's format, and the rules have been agreed to by the campaigns.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
7,HOLT,"The 90-minute debate is divided into six segments, each 15 minutes long.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
8,HOLT,We'll explore three topic areas tonight: Achieving prosperity; America's direction; and securing America.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
9,HOLT,"At the start of each segment, I will ask the same lead-off question to both candidates, and they will each have up to two minutes to respond.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
10,HOLT,"From that point until the end of the segment, we'll have an open discussion.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
11,HOLT,The questions are mine and have not been shared with the commission or the campaigns.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
12,HOLT,The audience here in the room has agreed to remain silent so that we can focus on what the candidates are saying.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

13,HOLT,"I will invite you to applaud, however, at this moment, as we welcome the candidates: Democratic nominee for president of the United States, Hillary Clinton, and Republican nominee for president of the United States, Donald J. Trump.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
14,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160926_1pres.tsv
15,CLINTON,"How are you, Donald?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
16,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160926_1pres.tsv
17,HOLT,Good luck to you.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
18,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20160926_1pres.tsv
19,HOLT,"Well, I don't expect us to cover all the issues of this campaign tonight, but I remind everyone, there are two more presidential debates scheduled.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
20,HOLT,"We are going to focus on many of the issues that voters tell us are most important, and we're going to press for specifics.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
21,HOLT,"I am honored to have this role, but this evening belongs to the candidates and, just as important, to the American people.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
22,HOLT,"Candidates, we look forward to hearing you articulate your policies and your positions, as well as your visions and your values.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
23,HOLT,"So, let's begin.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
24,HOLT,"We're calling this opening segment ""Achieving Prosperity.""",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
25,HOLT,And central to that is jobs.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
26,HOLT,There are two economic realities in America today.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
27,HOLT,"There's been a record six straight years of job growth, and new census numbers show incomes have increased at a record rate after years of stagnation.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
28,HOLT,"However, income inequality remains significant, and nearly half of Americans are living paycheck to paycheck.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

29,HOLT,"Beginning with you, Secretary Clinton, why are you a better choice than your opponent to create the kinds of jobs that will put more money into the pockets of American works?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
30,CLINTON,"Well, thank you, Lester, and thanks to Hofstra for hosting us.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
31,CLINTON,The central question in this election is really what kind of country we want to be and what kind of future we'll build together.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
32,CLINTON,"Today is my granddaughter's second birthday, so I think about this a lot.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
33,CLINTON,"First, we have to build an economy that works for everyone, not just those at the top.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
34,CLINTON,"That means we need new jobs, good jobs, with rising incomes.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
35,CLINTON,I want us to invest in you.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
36,CLINTON,I want us to invest in your future.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

37,CLINTON,"That means jobs in infrastructure, in advanced manufacturing, innovation and technology, clean, renewable energy, and small business, because most of the new jobs will come from small business.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
38,CLINTON,We also have to make the economy fairer.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
39,CLINTON,"That starts with raising the national minimum wage and also guarantee, finally, equal pay for women's work.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
40,CLINTON,I also want to see more companies do profit-sharing.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
41,CLINTON,"If you help create the profits, you should be able to share in them, not just the executives at the top.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
42,CLINTON,And I want us to do more to support people who are struggling to balance family and work.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
43,CLINTON,I've heard from so many of you about the difficult choices you face and the stresses that you're under.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
44,CLINTON,"So let's have paid family leave, earned sick days.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
45,CLINTON,Let's be sure we have affordable child care and debt-free college.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
46,CLINTON,How are we going to do it?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
47,CLINTON,We're going to do it by having the wealthy pay their fair share and close the corporate loopholes.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
48,CLINTON,"Finally, we tonight are on the stage together, Donald Trump and I. Donald, it's good to be with you.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
49,CLINTON,We're going to have a debate where we are talking about the important issues facing our country.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
50,CLINTON,"You have to judge us, who can shoulder the immense, awesome responsibilities of the presidency, who can put into action the plans that will make your life better.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
51,CLINTON,I hope that I will be able to earn your vote on November 8th.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
52,HOLT,"Secretary Clinton, thank you.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
53,HOLT,"Mr. Trump, the same question to you.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
54,HOLT,It's about putting money -- more money into the pockets of American workers.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
55,HOLT,You have up to two minutes.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
56,TRUMP,"Thank you, Lester.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

59,TRUMP,They're going to many other countries.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
60,TRUMP,You look at what China is doing to our country in terms of making our product.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
61,TRUMP,"They're devaluing their currency, and there's nobody in our government to fight them.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
62,TRUMP,And we have a very good fight.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
63,TRUMP,And we have a winning fight.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
64,TRUMP,"Because they're using our country as a piggy bank to rebuild China, and many other countries are doing the same thing.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
65,TRUMP,"So we're losing our good jobs, so many of them.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

76,TRUMP,But we have to stop our jobs from being stolen from us.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

82,TRUMP,We cannot let it happen.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
83,TRUMP,"Under my plan, I'll be reducing taxes tremendously, from 35 percent to 15 percent for companies, small and big businesses.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
84,TRUMP,That's going to be a job creator like we haven't seen since Ronald Reagan.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

92,HOLT,"Secretary Clinton, would you like to respond?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

104,CLINTON,"You know, Donald was very fortunate in his life, and that's all to his benefit.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

191,CLINTON,That's a lot of jobs; that's a lot of new economic activity.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

192,CLINTON,"So I've tried to be very specific about what we can and should do, and I am determined that we're going to get the economy really moving again, building on the progress we've made over the last eight years, but never going back to what got us in trouble in the first place.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

478,TRUMP,"Why did she delete 33,000...",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

483,HOLT,Secretary Clinton?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
484,CLINTON,"Well, I think you've seen another example of bait-and- switch here.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
485,CLINTON,"For 40 years, everyone running for president has released their tax returns.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
486,CLINTON,"You can go and see nearly, I think, 39, 40 years of our tax returns, but everyone has done it.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
487,CLINTON,We know the IRS has made clear there is no prohibition on releasing it when you're under audit.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
488,CLINTON,"So you've got to ask yourself, why won't he release his tax returns?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
489,CLINTON,And I think there may be a couple of reasons.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
490,CLINTON,"First, maybe he's not as rich as he says he is.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
491,CLINTON,"Second, maybe he's not as charitable as he claims to be.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

492,CLINTON,"Third, we don't know all of his business dealings, but we have been told through investigative reporting that he owes about $650 million to Wall Street and foreign banks.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

493,CLINTON,"Or maybe he doesn't want the American people, all of you watching tonight, to know that he's paid nothing in federal taxes, because the only years that anybody's ever seen were a couple of years when he had to turn them over to state authorities when he was trying to get a casino license, and they showed he didn't pay any federal income tax.",1,20160926_1pres.tsv
494,TRUMP,That makes me smart.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
495,CLINTON,"So if he's paid zero, that means zero for troops, zero for vets, zero for schools or health.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

496,CLINTON,"And I think probably he's not all that enthusiastic about having the rest of our country see what the real reasons are, because it must be something really important, even terrible, that he's trying to hide.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
497,CLINTON,"And the financial disclosure statements, they don't give you the tax rate.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
498,CLINTON,They don't give you all the details that tax returns would.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
499,CLINTON,And it just seems to me that this is something that the American people deserve to see.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
500,CLINTON,"And I have no reason to believe that he's ever going to release his tax returns, because there's something he's hiding.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
501,CLINTON,And we'll guess.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
502,CLINTON,We'll keep guessing at what it might be that he's hiding.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
503,CLINTON,"But I think the question is, were he ever to get near the White House, what would be those conflicts?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
504,CLINTON,Who does he owe money to?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
505,CLINTON,"Well, he owes you the answers to that, and he should provide them.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

507,HOLT,Do you want to respond to that?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
508,CLINTON,I do.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
509,CLINTON,"You know, I made a mistake using a private e- mail.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
510,TRUMP,That's for sure.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
511,CLINTON,"And if I had to do it over again, I would, obviously, do it differently.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
512,CLINTON,But I'm not going to make any excuses.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
513,CLINTON,"It was a mistake, and I take responsibility for that.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
514,HOLT,Mr. Trump?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
515,TRUMP,That was more than a mistake.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
516,TRUMP,That was done purposely.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
517,TRUMP,OK?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
518,TRUMP,That was not a mistake.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
519,TRUMP,That was done purposely.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

520,TRUMP,"When you have your staff taking the Fifth Amendment, taking the Fifth so they're not prosecuted, when you have the man that set up the illegal server taking the Fifth, I think it's disgraceful.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
521,TRUMP,"And believe me, this country thinks it's -- really thinks it's disgraceful, also.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

523,TRUMP,That I can tell you.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
524,TRUMP,You learn a lot from financial disclosure.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

531,TRUMP,But it's not $650.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

533,TRUMP,"But I could give you a list of banks, I would -- if that would help you, I would give you a list of banks.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

540,TRUMP,It's because it's about time that this country had somebody running it that has an idea about money.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

541,TRUMP,"When we have $20 trillion in debt, and our country's a mess, you know, it's one thing to have $20 trillion in debt and our roads are good and our bridges are good and everything's in great shape, our airports.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

544,TRUMP,So the worst of all things has happened.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
545,TRUMP,"We owe $20 trillion, and we're a mess.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
546,TRUMP,We haven't even started.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

549,TRUMP,And it's really a shame.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
550,TRUMP,And it's politicians like Secretary Clinton that have caused this problem.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

553,TRUMP,We're a serious debtor nation.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
554,TRUMP,"And we have a country that needs new roads, new tunnels, new bridges, new airports, new schools, new hospitals.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
555,TRUMP,"And we don't have the money, because it's been squandered on so many of your ideas.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
556,HOLT,We'll let you respond and we'll move on to the next segment.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

564,CLINTON,"I've met dishwashers, painters, architects, glass installers, marble installers, drapery installers, like my dad was, who you refused to pay when they finished the work that you asked them to do.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

569,TRUMP,Maybe he didn't do a good job and I was unsatisfied with his work...,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
570,CLINTON,"Well, to...",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

572,CLINTON,"Do the thousands of people that you have stiffed over the course of your business not deserve some kind of apology from someone who has taken their labor, taken the goods that they produced, and then refused to pay them?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

579,CLINTON,You even at one time suggested that you would try to negotiate down the national debt of the United States.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

581,TRUMP,Wrong.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
582,CLINTON,"Well, sometimes there's not a direct transfer of skills from business to government, but sometimes what happened in business would be really bad for government.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

584,CLINTON,And we need to be very clear about that.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

587,TRUMP,I built an unbelievable company.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
588,TRUMP,"Some of the greatest assets anywhere in the world, real estate assets anywhere in the world, beyond the United States, in Europe, lots of different places.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
589,TRUMP,It's an unbelievable company.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
590,TRUMP,"But on occasion, four times, we used certain laws that are there.",1,20160926_1pres.tsv
591,TRUMP,"And when Secretary Clinton talks about people that didn't get paid, first of all, they did get paid a lot, but taken advantage of the laws of the nation.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
592,TRUMP,"Now, if you want to change the laws, you've been there a long time, change the laws.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
593,TRUMP,But I take advantage of the laws of the nation because I'm running a company.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
594,TRUMP,"My obligation right now is to do well for myself, my family, my employees, for my companies.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
595,TRUMP,And that's what I do.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
596,TRUMP,But what she doesn't say is that tens of thousands of people that are unbelievably happy and that love me.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

599,TRUMP,But we're opening the Old Post Office.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
600,TRUMP,"Under budget, ahead of schedule, saved tremendous money.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

606,TRUMP,The Trump International is way under budget and way ahead of schedule.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
607,TRUMP,And we should be able to do that for our country.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

611,HOLT,"The share of Americans who say race relations are bad in this country is the highest it's been in decades, much of it amplified by shootings of African-Americans by police, as we've seen recently in Charlotte and Tulsa.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
612,HOLT,"Race has been a big issue in this campaign, and one of you is going to have to bridge a very wide and bitter gap.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
613,HOLT,So how do you heal the divide?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
614,HOLT,"Secretary Clinton, you get two minutes on this.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
615,CLINTON,"Well, you're right.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
616,CLINTON,Race remains a significant challenge in our country.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

617,CLINTON,"Unfortunately, race still determines too much, often determines where people live, determines what kind of education in their public schools they can get, and, yes, it determines how they're treated in the criminal justice system.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
618,CLINTON,We've just seen those two tragic examples in both Tulsa and Charlotte.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
619,CLINTON,And we've got to do several things at the same time.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
620,CLINTON,We have to restore trust between communities and the police.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
621,CLINTON,"We have to work to make sure that our police are using the best training, the best techniques, that they're well prepared to use force only when necessary.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
622,CLINTON,"Everyone should be respected by the law, and everyone should respect the law.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
623,CLINTON,"Right now, that's not the case in a lot of our neighborhoods.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
624,CLINTON,"So I have, ever since the first day of my campaign, called for criminal justice reform.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
625,CLINTON,I've laid out a platform that I think would begin to remedy some of the problems we have in the criminal justice system.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
626,CLINTON,"But we also have to recognize, in addition to the challenges that we face with policing, there are so many good, brave police officers who equally want reform.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
627,CLINTON,So we have to bring communities together in order to begin working on that as a mutual goal.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
628,CLINTON,And we've got to get guns out of the hands of people who should not have them.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
629,CLINTON,"The gun epidemic is the leading cause of death of young African- American men, more than the next nine causes put together.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
630,CLINTON,"So we have to do two things, as I said.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
631,CLINTON,We have to restore trust.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
632,CLINTON,We have to work with the police.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
633,CLINTON,We have to make sure they respect the communities and the communities respect them.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
634,CLINTON,"And we have to tackle the plague of gun violence, which is a big contributor to a lot of the problems that we're seeing today.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

636,HOLT,How do you heal the divide?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
637,TRUMP,"Well, first of all, Secretary Clinton doesn't want to use a couple of words, and that's law and order.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
638,TRUMP,And we need law and order.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
639,TRUMP,"If we don't have it, we're not going to have a country.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

640,TRUMP,"And when I look at what's going on in Charlotte, a city I love, a city where I have investments, when I look at what's going on throughout various parts of our country, whether it's -- I mean, I can just keep naming them all day long -- we need law and order in our country.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
641,TRUMP,"I just got today the, as you know, the endorsement of the Fraternal Order of Police, we just -- just came in.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
642,TRUMP,"We have endorsements from, I think, almost every police group, very -- I mean, a large percentage of them in the United States.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
643,TRUMP,"We have a situation where we have our inner cities, African- Americans, Hispanics are living in he'll because it's so dangerous.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
644,TRUMP,"You walk down the street, you get shot.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
645,TRUMP,"In Chicago, they've had thousands of shootings, thousands since January 1st.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
646,TRUMP,Thousands of shootings.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
647,TRUMP,"And I'm saying, where is this?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
648,TRUMP,Is this a war-torn country?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
649,TRUMP,What are we doing?,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
650,TRUMP,And we have to stop the violence.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
651,TRUMP,We have to bring back law and order.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

652,TRUMP,"In a place like Chicago, where thousands of people have been killed, thousands over the last number of years, in fact, almost 4,000 have been killed since Barack Obama became president, over -- almost 4,000 people in Chicago have been killed.",1,20160926_1pres.tsv
653,TRUMP,We have to bring back law and order.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
654,TRUMP,"Now, whether or not in a place like Chicago you do stop and frisk, which worked very well, Mayor Giuliani is here, worked very well in New York.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
655,TRUMP,It brought the crime rate way down.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
656,TRUMP,But you take the gun away from criminals that shouldn't be having it.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

659,TRUMP,And they have guns.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
660,TRUMP,And they shoot people.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
661,TRUMP,And we have to be very strong.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
662,TRUMP,And we have to be very vigilant.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
663,TRUMP,We have to be -- we have to know what we're doing.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
664,TRUMP,"Right now, our police, in many cases, are afraid to do anything.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
665,TRUMP,"We have to protect our inner cities, because African-American communities are being decimated by crime, decimated.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

675,TRUMP,"No, the argument is that we have to take the guns away from these people that have them and they are bad people that shouldn't have them.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
676,TRUMP,These are felons.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

677,TRUMP,"These are people that are bad people that shouldn't be -- when you have 3,000 shootings in Chicago from January 1st, when you have 4,000 people killed in Chicago by guns, from the beginning of the presidency of Barack Obama, his hometown, you have to have stop-and-frisk.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
678,TRUMP,You need more police.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

690,TRUMP,Some really bad things.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

692,TRUMP,"But we need -- Lester, we need law and order.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
693,TRUMP,"And we need law and order in the inner cities, because the people that are most affected by what's happening are African-American and Hispanic people.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
694,TRUMP,And it's very unfair to them what our politicians are allowing to happen.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

709,CLINTON,"But there were some problems, some unintended consequences.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
710,CLINTON,Too many young African-American and Latino men ended up in jail for nonviolent offenses.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

711,CLINTON,"And it's just a fact that if you're a young African-American man and you do the same thing as a young white man, you are more likely to be arrested, charged, convicted, and incarcerated.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
712,CLINTON,So we've got to address the systemic racism in our criminal justice system.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

718,CLINTON,So there are some positive ways we can work on this.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv
719,CLINTON,And I believe strongly that commonsense gun safety measures would assist us.,0,20160926_1pres.tsv

721,CLINTON,"In a lot of places, our police are outgunned.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

724,CLINTON,"If you're too dangerous to fly, you are too dangerous to buy a gun.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv
725,CLINTON,"So there are things we can do, and we ought to do it in a bipartisan way.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

730,CLINTON,"And therefore, I think we need all of us to be asking hard questions about, you know, why am I feeling this way?",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

731,CLINTON,"But when it comes to policing, since it can have literally fatal consequences, I have said, in my first budget, we would put money into that budget to help us deal with implicit bias by retraining a lot of our police officers.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

736,CLINTON,"They want support, they want more training, they want more assistance.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

741,TRUMP,"First of all, I agree, and a lot of people even within my own party want to give certain rights to people on watch lists and no- fly lists.",0,20160926_1pres.tsv

1,QUIJANO,Good evening.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

2,QUIJANO,"From Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia, and welcome to the first, and only, vice presidential debate of 2016, sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
3,QUIJANO,"I'm Elaine Quijano, anchor at CBSN, and correspondent for CBS News.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
4,QUIJANO,It's an honor to moderate this debate between Senator Tim Kaine and Governor Mike Pence.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
5,QUIJANO,Both are longtime public servants who are also proud fathers of sons serving in the U.S. Marines.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
6,QUIJANO,The campaigns have agreed to the rules of this 90-minute debate.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
7,QUIJANO,There will be nine different segments covering domestic and foreign policy issues.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
8,QUIJANO,Each segment will begin with a question to both candidates who will each have two minutes to answer.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
9,QUIJANO,Then I'll ask follow-up questions to facilitate a discussion between the candidates.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
10,QUIJANO,"By coin toss, it's been determined that Senator Kaine will be first to answer the opening question.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
11,QUIJANO,We have an enthusiastic audience tonight.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
12,QUIJANO,They've agreed to only express that enthusiasm once at the end of the debate and right now as we welcome Governor Mike Pence and Senator Tim Kaine.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
13,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
14,QUIJANO,"Gentlemen, welcome.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
15,QUIJANO,It truly is a privilege to be with both of you tonight.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
16,QUIJANO,I'd like to start with the topic of presidential leadership.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

17,QUIJANO,"Twenty-eight years ago tomorrow night, Lloyd Bentsen said the vice presidential debate was not about the qualifications for the vice presidency, but about how if tragedy should occur, the vice president has to step in without any margin for error, without time for preparation, to take over the responsibility for the biggest job in the world.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
18,QUIJANO,"What about your qualities, your skills, and your temperament equip you to step into that role at a moment's notice?",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
19,QUIJANO,Senator Kaine?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
20,KAINE,"Elaine, thank you for being here tonight, and, Governor Pence, welcome.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
21,KAINE,"It is so great to be back at Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
22,KAINE,This is a very special place.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
23,KAINE,"Sixty-five years ago, a young, courageous woman, Barbara Johns, led a walkout of her high school, Moton High School.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
24,KAINE,She made history by protesting school segregation.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
25,KAINE,She believed our nation was stronger together.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
26,KAINE,And that walkout led to the Brown v. Board of Education decision that moved us down the path toward equality.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
27,KAINE,"I am so proud to be running with another strong, history-making woman, Hillary Clinton, to be president of the United States.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

28,KAINE,"I'm proud because her vision of stronger together, building an economy that works for all, not just those at the top, being safe in the world not only with a strong military, but also strong alliances to battle terrorism and climate change, and also to build a community of respect, just like Barbara Johns tried to do 65 years ago.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
29,KAINE,That's why I'm so proud to be her running mate.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
30,KAINE,Hillary told me why she asked me to be her running mate.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
31,KAINE,She said the test of a Clinton administration will not be the signing of a bill or the passage of a bill.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

32,KAINE,"It'll be whether we can make somebody's life better, whether we can make a classroom better learning environment for schoolkids or teachers, whether we can make a safer -- it's going to be about results.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
33,KAINE,"And she said to me, you've been a missionary and a civil rights lawyer.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
34,KAINE,You've been a city councilman and mayor.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
35,KAINE,You've been a lieutenant governor and governor and now a U.S. senator.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

36,KAINE,I think you will help me figure out how to govern this nation so that we always keep in mind that the success of the administration is the difference we make in people's lives.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
37,KAINE,"And that's what I bring to the ticket, that experience having served at all levels of government.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
38,KAINE,But my primary role is to be Hillary Clinton's right-hand person and strong supporter as she puts together the most historic administration possible.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
39,KAINE,And I relish that role.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
40,KAINE,I'm so proud of her.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
41,KAINE,"I'll just say this: We trust Hillary Clinton, my wife and I, and we trust her with the most important thing in our life.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
42,KAINE,We have a son deployed overseas in the Marine Corps right now.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
43,KAINE,"We trust Hillary Clinton as president and commander-in-chief, but the thought of Donald Trump as commander-in-chief scares us to death.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
44,QUIJANO,Governor Pence?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
45,PENCE,"Well, first off, thank you, Elaine, and thank you to -- thank you to Norwood University for their wonderful hospitality and the Commission on Presidential Debates.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
46,PENCE,"It's deeply humbling for me to be here, to be surrounded by my -- my wonderful family.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
47,PENCE,"And, Senator Kaine, it's an honor to be here with you, as well.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

48,PENCE,"And I just -- I also want to say -- I want to say thanks to everyone that's looking in tonight, who understands what an enormously important time this is in the life of our nation.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
49,PENCE,"For the last seven-and-a-half years, we've seen America's place in the world weakened.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

50,PENCE,"We've seen an economy stifled by more taxes, more regulation, a war on coal, and a failing health care reform come to be known as Obamacare, and the American people know that we need to make a change.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
51,PENCE,And so I want to thank all of you for being -- being with us tonight.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
52,PENCE,I also want to thank Donald Trump for making that call and inviting us to be a part of this ticket.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
53,PENCE,"I have to tell you, I'm a -- I'm a small-town boy from a place not too different from Farmville.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
54,PENCE,I grew up with a cornfield in my backyard.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
55,PENCE,My grandfather had immigrated to this country when he was about my son's age.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
56,PENCE,My mom and dad built a -- everything that matters in a small town in Southern Indiana.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
57,PENCE,They built a family and -- and a good name and a business.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
58,PENCE,And they raised a family.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

59,PENCE,"And I dreamed some day of representing my home town in Washington, D.C., but I -- honestly, Elaine, I never imagined -- never imagined I'd have the opportunity to be governor of the state that I love, let alone be sitting at a table like this in this kind of a position.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

60,PENCE,"So to answer your question, I would say I -- I would hope that if -- if the responsibility ever fell to me in this role, that I would meet it with the way that I'm going to meet the responsibility should I be elected vice president of the United States.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

61,PENCE,"And that's to bring a lifetime of experience, a lifetime growing up in a small town, a lifetime where I've served in the Congress of the United States, where -- where I've led a state that works in the great state of Indiana, and whatever other responsibilities might follow from this, I -- I would hope and, frankly, I would pray to be able to meet that moment with that -- that lifetime of experience.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

62,QUIJANO,"Senator Kaine, on the campaign trail, you praised Secretary Clinton's character, including her commitment to public service, yet 60 percent of voters don't think she's trustworthy.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
63,QUIJANO,Why do so many people distrust her?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
64,QUIJANO,Is it because they have questions about her e-mails and the Clinton Foundation?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
65,KAINE,"Elaine, let me tell you why I trust Hillary Clinton.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
66,KAINE,Here's what people should look at as they look at a public servant.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
67,KAINE,Do they have a passion in their life that showed up before they were in public life?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
68,KAINE,"And have they held onto that passion throughout their life, regardless of whether they were in office or not, succeeding or failing?",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
69,KAINE,Hillary Clinton has that passion.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

70,KAINE,"From a time as a kid in a Methodist youth group in the suburbs of Chicago, she has been focused on serving others with a special focus on empowering families and kids.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

71,KAINE,"As a civil rights lawyer in the South, with the Children's Defense Fund, first lady of Arkansas and this country, senator, secretary of state, it's always been about putting others first.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
72,KAINE,And that's a sharp contrast with Donald Trump.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
73,KAINE,Donald Trump always puts himself first.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
74,KAINE,"He built a business career, in the words of one of his own campaign staffers, ""off the backs of the little guy.""",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

75,KAINE,"And as a candidate, he started his campaign with a speech where he called Mexicans rapists and criminals, and he has pursued the discredited and really outrageous lie that President Obama wasn't born in the United States.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
76,KAINE,It is so painful to suggest that we go back to think about these days where an African-American could not be a citizen of the United States.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
77,KAINE,"And I can't imagine how Governor Pence can defend the insult- driven selfish ""me first"" style of Donald Trump.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
78,QUIJANO,"Governor Pence, let me ask you, you have said Donald Trump is, quote, ""thoughtful, compassionate, and steady.""",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
79,QUIJANO,"Yet 67 percent of voters feel he is a risky choice, and 65 percent feel he does not have the right kind of temperament to be president.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
80,QUIJANO,Why do so many Americans think Mr. Trump is simply too erratic?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
81,PENCE,"Well, let me -- let me say first and foremost that, Senator, you and Hillary Clinton would know a lot about an insult- driven campaign.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
82,PENCE,It really is remarkable.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

86,KAINE,You guys love Russia.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

173,KAINE,OK.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

174,QUIJANO,"According to the nonpartisan Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget, neither of your economic plans will reduce the growing $19 trillion gross national debt.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
175,QUIJANO,"In fact, your plans would add even more to it.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
176,QUIJANO,Both of you were governors who balanced state budgets.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
177,QUIJANO,Are you concerned that adding more to the debt could be disastrous for the country.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
178,QUIJANO,Governor Pence?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
179,PENCE,"I think the fact that -- that under this past administration was of which Hillary Clinton was a part, we've almost doubled the national debt is atrocious.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
180,PENCE,"I mean, I'm very proud of the fact that -- I come from a state that works.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
181,PENCE,The state of Indiana has balanced budgets.,1,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
182,PENCE,"We cut taxes, we've made record investments in education and in infrastructure, and I still finish my term with $2 billion in the bank.",1,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
183,PENCE,That's a little bit different than when Senator Kaine was governor here in Virginia.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
184,PENCE,He actually -- he actually tried to raise taxes by about $4 billion.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
185,PENCE,He left his state about $2 billion in the hole.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
186,PENCE,"In the state of Indiana, we've cut unemployment in half; unemployment doubled when he was governor.",1,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

187,PENCE,"But I think he's a very fitting running mate for Hillary Clinton, because in the wake of a season where American families are struggling in this economy under the weight of higher taxes and Obamacare and the war on coal and the stifling avalanche of regulation coming out of this administration, Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine want more of the same.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
188,PENCE,"It really is remarkable that they actually are advocating a trillion dollars in tax increases, which I get that.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
189,PENCE,You tried to raise taxes here in Virginia and were unsuccessful.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

190,PENCE,"But a trillion dollars in tax increases, more regulation, more of the same war on coal, and more of Obamacare that now even former President Bill Clinton calls Obamacare a crazy plan.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
191,PENCE,But Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine want to build on Obamacare.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
192,PENCE,They want to expand it into a single-payer program.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
193,PENCE,"And for all the world, Hillary Clinton just thinks Obamacare is a good start.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

194,PENCE,"Look, Donald Trump and I have a plan to get this economy moving again just the way that it worked in the 1980s, just the way it worked in the 1960s, and that is by lowering taxes across the board for working families, small businesses and family farms, ending the war on coal that is hurting jobs and hurting this economy even here in Virginia, repealing Obamacare lock, stock, and barrel, and repealing all of the executive orders that Barack Obama has signed that are stifling economic growth in this economy.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
195,PENCE,We can get America moving again.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
196,PENCE,"Put on top of that the kind of trade deals that'll put the American worker first, and you've got a prescription for real growth.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
197,PENCE,"And when you get the economy growing, Elaine, that's when you can deal with the national debt.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

198,PENCE,"When we get back to 3.5 percent to 4 percent growth with Donald Trump's plan will do, then we're going to have the resources to meet our nation's needs at home and abroad, and we're going to have the ability to bring down the national debt.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
199,QUIJANO,Senator Kaine?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
200,KAINE,"Elaine, on the economy, there's a fundamental choice for the American electorate.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
201,KAINE,"Do you want a ""you're hired"" president in Hillary Clinton or do you want a ""you're fired"" president in Donald Trump?",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
202,KAINE,I think that's not such a hard choice.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
203,KAINE,"Hillary and I have a plan that's on the table that's a ""you're hired"" plan.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
204,KAINE,Five components.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
205,KAINE,"First thing we do is we invest in manufacturing, infrastructure, and research in the clean energy jobs of tomorrow.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

206,KAINE,"Second thing is we invest in our workforce, from pre-K education to great teachers to debt-free college and tuition-free college for families that make less than $125,000 a year.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
207,KAINE,"Third, we promote fairness by raising the minimum wage, so you can't work full-time and be under the poverty level, and by paying women equal pay for equal work.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
208,KAINE,"Fourth, we promote small business growth, just as we've done in Virginia, to make it easier to start and grow small businesses.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
209,KAINE,Hillary and I each grew up in small-business families.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
210,KAINE,"My dad, who ran an iron working and welding shop, is here tonight.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

211,KAINE,"And, fifth, we have a tax plan that targets tax relief to middle- class individuals and small businesses and asks those at the very top who've benefited as we've come out of recession to pay more.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
212,KAINE,The Trump plan is a different plan.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
213,KAINE,"It's a ""you're fired"" plan.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
214,KAINE,And there's two key elements to it.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
215,KAINE,"First, Donald Trump said wages are too high.",1,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
216,KAINE,And both Donald Trump and Mike Pence think we ought to eliminate the federal minimum wage.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
217,KAINE,"Mike Pence, when he was in Congress, voted against raising the minimum wage above $5.15.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
218,KAINE,And he has been a one-man bulwark against minimum wage increases in Indiana.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
219,KAINE,"The second component of the plan is massive tax breaks for the very top, trillions of dollars of tax breaks for people just like Donald Trump.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

220,KAINE,"The problem with this, Elaine, is that's exactly what we did 10 years ago and it put the economy into the deepest recession -- the deepest recession since the 1930s.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
221,KAINE,Independent analysts say the Clinton plan would grow the economy by 10.5 million jobs.,1,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
222,KAINE,The Trump plan would cost 3.5 million jobs.,1,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

224,KAINE,Because his tax plan basically helps him.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

225,KAINE,"And if he ever met his promise and he gave his tax returns to the American public like he said he would, we would see just how much his economic plan is really a Trump-first plan.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

227,QUIJANO,"Yesterday, Mr. Trump said he brilliantly used the laws to pay as little tax as legally possible.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
228,QUIJANO,Does that seem fair to you?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

234,PENCE,"I mean, the truth of the matter is, the policies of this administration, which Hillary Clinton and Senator Kaine want to continue, have run this economy into a ditch.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
