1168,PENCE,that she refused to turn over in her private server...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1169,QUIJANO,Senator Kaine...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1170,PENCE,and we'd have a much better picture of what the Clinton Foundation was about.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1171,QUIJANO,"Senator Kaine, if you had intelligence that North Korea was about to launch a missile, a nuclear-armed missile capable of reaching the United States, would you take preemptive action?",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1172,KAINE,"If we -- look, a president should take action to defend the United States against imminent threat.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1173,KAINE,You have to.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1174,KAINE,A president has to do that.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1175,KAINE,"Now exactly what action, you would have to determine what your intelligence was, how certain you were of that intelligence, but you would have to take action.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1176,KAINE,You asked the question about how do we deal with a North Korea.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1177,KAINE,I'm on the Foreign Relations Committee.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1178,KAINE,We just did an extensive sanctions package against North Korea.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1179,KAINE,"And interestingly enough, Elaine, the U.N. followed and did this -- virtually the same package.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1180,KAINE,Often China will use their veto in the Security Council to veto a package like that.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1181,KAINE,"They're starting to get worried about North Korea, too.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1182,KAINE,"So they actually supported the sanctions package, even though many of the sanctions are against Chinese firms, Chinese financial institutions.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1183,KAINE,"So we're working together with China, and we need to.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1184,KAINE,"China's another one of those relationships where it's competitive, it's also challenging, and in times like North Korea, we have to be able to cooperate.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1185,KAINE,Hillary understands that very well.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1186,KAINE,"She went once famously to China and stood up at a human rights meeting and looked them in the eye and said, ""Women's rights are human rights.""",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1187,KAINE,"They didn't want her to say that, but she did.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1188,KAINE,But she's also worked on a lot of diplomatic and important diplomatic deals with China.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1189,KAINE,And that's what it's going to take.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1190,KAINE,"The thing I would worry a little bit about is that Donald Trump owes about $650 million to banks, including the Bank of China.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1191,KAINE,I'm not sure he could stand up so tough to the people who have loaned him money.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1192,QUIJANO,All right.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1193,QUIJANO,I'd like to turn to our next segment now.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1194,QUIJANO,"And in this, I'd like to focus on social issues.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1195,QUIJANO,You have both been open about the role that faith has played in your lives.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1196,QUIJANO,Can you discuss in detail a time when you struggled to balance your personal faith and a public policy position?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1197,QUIJANO,Senator Kaine?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1198,KAINE,"Yeah, that's an easy one for me, Elaine.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1199,KAINE,It's an easy one.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1200,KAINE,I'm really fortunate.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1201,KAINE,I grew up in a wonderful household with great Irish Catholic parents.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1202,KAINE,My mom and dad are sitting right here.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1203,KAINE,I was educated by Jesuits at Rockhurst High School in Kansas City.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1204,KAINE,My 40th reunion is in 10 days.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1205,KAINE,"And I worked with Jesuit missionaries in Honduras, now nearly 35 years ago, and they were the heroes of my life.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1206,KAINE,I try to practice my religion in a very devout way and follow the teachings of my church in my own personal life.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1207,KAINE,"But I don't believe in this nation, a First Amendment nation, where we don't raise any religion over the other, and we allow people to worship as they please, that the doctrines of any one religion should be mandated for everyone.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1208,KAINE,"For me, the hardest struggle in my faith life was the Catholic Church is against the death penalty and so am I.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1209,KAINE,"But I was governor of a state, and the state law said that there was a death penalty for crimes if the jury determined them to be heinous.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1210,KAINE,And so I had to grapple with that.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1211,KAINE,"When I was running for governor, I was attacked pretty strongly because of my position on the death penalty.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1212,KAINE,"But I looked the voters of Virginia in the eye and said, look, this is my religion.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1213,KAINE,"I'm not going to change my religious practice to get one vote, but I know how to take an oath and uphold the law.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1214,KAINE,"And if you elect me, I will uphold the law.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1215,KAINE,"And I was elected, and I did.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1216,KAINE,"It was very, very difficult to allow executions to go forward, but in circumstances where I didn't feel like there was a case for clemency, I told Virginia voters I would uphold the law, and I did.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1217,KAINE,That was a real struggle.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1218,KAINE,"But I think it is really, really important that those of us who have deep faith lives don't feel that we could just substitute our own views for everybody else in society, regardless of their views.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1219,QUIJANO,Governor Pence?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1220,PENCE,"Well, it's a wonderful question.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1221,PENCE,And my Christian faith is at the very heart of who I am.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1222,PENCE,I was also raised in a wonderful family of faith.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1223,PENCE,It was a church on Sunday morning and grace before dinner.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1224,PENCE,But my Christian faith became real for me when I made a personal decision for Christ when I was a freshman in college.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1225,PENCE,And I've tried to live that out however imperfectly every day of my life since.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1226,PENCE,"And with my wife at my side, we've followed a calling into public service, where we've -- we've tried to -- we've tried to keep faith with the values that we cherish.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1227,PENCE,"And with regard to when I struggle, I appreciate, and -- and -- and -- I have a great deal of respect for Senator Kaine's sincere faith.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1228,PENCE,I truly do.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1229,KAINE,That's shared.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1230,PENCE,"But for me, I would tell you that for me the sanctity of life proceeds out of the belief that -- that ancient principle that -- where God says before you were formed in the womb, I knew you, and so for my first time in public life, I sought to stand with great compassion for the sanctity of life.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1231,PENCE,"The state of Indiana has also sought to make sure that we expand alternatives in health care counseling for women, non-abortion alternatives.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1232,PENCE,I'm also very pleased at the fact we're well on our way in Indiana to becoming the most pro-adoption state in America.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1233,PENCE,"I think if you're going to be pro-life, you should -- you should be pro- adoption.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1234,PENCE,But what I can't understand is with Hillary Clinton and now Senator Kaine at her side is to support a practice like partial-birth abortion.,1,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1235,PENCE,"I mean, to hold to the view -- and I know Senator Kaine, you hold pro-life views personally -- but the very idea that a child that is almost born into the world could still have their life taken from them is just anathema to me.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1236,PENCE,And I cannot -- I can't conscience about -- about a party that supports that.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1237,PENCE,Or that -- I know you've historically opposed taxpayer funding of abortion.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1238,PENCE,But Hillary Clinton wants to -- wants to repeal the longstanding provision in the law where we said we wouldn't use taxpayer dollars to fund abortion.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1239,PENCE,"So for me, my faith informs my life.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1240,PENCE,I try and spend a little time on my knees every day.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1241,PENCE,"But it all for me begins with cherishing the dignity, the worth, the value of every human life.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1242,KAINE,"Elaine, this is a fundamental question, a fundamental question.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1243,KAINE,"Hillary and I are both people out of religious backgrounds, from Methodist church experience, which was really formative for her as a public servant.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1244,KAINE,But we really feel like you should live fully and with enthusiasm the commands of your faith.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1245,KAINE,But it is not the role of the public servant to mandate that for everybody else.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1246,KAINE,So let's talk about abortion and choice.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1247,KAINE,Let's talk about them.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1248,KAINE,We support Roe v. Wade.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1249,KAINE,"We support the constitutional right of American women to consult their own conscience, their own supportive partner, their own minister, but then make their own decision about pregnancy.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1250,KAINE,That's something we trust American women to do that.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1251,KAINE,"And we don't think that women should be punished, as Donald Trump said they should, for making the decision to have an abortion.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1252,KAINE,Governor Pence wants to repeal Roe v. Wade.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1253,KAINE,He said he wants to put it on the ash heap of history.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1254,KAINE,And we have some young people in the audience who weren't even born when Roe was decided.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1255,KAINE,This is pretty important.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1256,KAINE,"Before Roe v. Wade, states could pass criminal laws to do just that, to punish women if they made the choice to terminate a pregnancy.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1257,KAINE,I think you should live your moral values.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1258,KAINE,"But the last thing, the very last thing that government should do is have laws that would punish women who make reproductive choices.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1259,KAINE,And that is the fundamental difference between a Clinton-Kaine ticket and a Trump- Pence ticket that wants to punish women who make that choice.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1260,PENCE,"No, it's really not.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1261,PENCE,Donald Trump and I would never support legislation that punished women who made the heartbreaking choice to end a pregnancy.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1262,KAINE,Then why did Donald Trump say that?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1263,PENCE,We just never would.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1264,KAINE,Why did he say that?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1265,PENCE,"Well, look, it's -- look, he's not a polished politician like you and Hillary Clinton.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1266,PENCE,And so...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1267,KAINE,"Well, I would admit that's not a polished...",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1268,SYSTEM,(CROSSTALK),0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1269,PENCE,"You know, things don't always come out exactly the way he means them.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1270,KAINE,"Well, can I say...",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1271,PENCE,But I'm telling you what the policy of our administration would be.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1272,KAINE,Great line from the -- great line from the gospel of Matthew.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1273,KAINE,"From the fullness of the heart, the mouth speaks.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1274,PENCE,Yeah.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1275,KAINE,When Donald Trump says women should be punished or Mexicans are rapists and criminals...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1276,PENCE,I'm telling you...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1277,KAINE,"or John McCain is not a hero, he is showing you who he is.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1278,PENCE,"Senator, you've whipped out that Mexican thing again.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1279,PENCE,He -- look...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1280,KAINE,Can you defend it?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1281,PENCE,"There are criminal aliens in this country, Tim, who have come into this country illegally who are perpetrating violence and taking American lives.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1282,KAINE,You want to -- you want to use a big broad brush against Mexicans on that?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1283,PENCE,He also said and many of them are good people.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1284,PENCE,You keep leaving that out of your quote.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1285,PENCE,"And if you want me to go there, I'll go there.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1286,PENCE,"But here's -- there is a choice, and it is a choice on life.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1287,PENCE,"I couldn't be more proud to be standing with Donald Trump, who's standing for the right to life.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1288,PENCE,"It's a principle that -- Senator Kaine -- and I'm very gentle about this, because I really do respect you -- it's a principle that you embrace.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1289,PENCE,"And I have appreciated the fact that you've supported the Hyde amendment, which bans the use of taxpayer funding for abortion, in the past, but that's not Hillary Clinton's view.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1290,PENCE,"People need to understand, we can come together as a nation.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1291,PENCE,We can create a culture of life.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1292,PENCE,More and more young people today are embracing life because we know we are -- we're better for it.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1293,PENCE,We can -- like Mother Teresa said at that famous national prayer breakfast...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1294,KAINE,This is important --,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1295,PENCE,bring the -- let's welcome the children into our world.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1296,PENCE,There are so many families around the country who can't have children.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1297,PENCE,We could improve adoption...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1298,KAINE,"But, Governor...",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1299,PENCE,so that families that can't have children can adopt more readily those children from crisis pregnancies.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1300,KAINE,"Governor, why don't you trust women to make this choice for themselves?",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1301,KAINE,We can encourage people to support life.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1302,KAINE,Of course we can.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1303,KAINE,But why don't you trust women?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1304,KAINE,Why doesn't Donald Trump trust women to make this choice for themselves?,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1305,KAINE,That's what we ought to be doing in public life.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1306,KAINE,"Living our lives of faith or motivation with enthusiasm and excitement, convincing other, dialoguing with each other about important moral issues of the day...",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1307,PENCE,Because there are...,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1308,KAINE,"but on fundamental issues of morality, we should let women make their own decisions.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1309,PENCE,"Because there is -- a society can be judged by how it deals with its most vulnerable, the aged, the infirm, the disabled, and the unborn.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1310,PENCE,I believe it with all my heart.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1311,PENCE,And I couldn't be more proud to be standing with a pro-life candidate in Donald Trump.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1312,QUIJANO,I do have one final question for you both tonight.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1313,QUIJANO,It has been a divisive campaign.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1314,QUIJANO,"Senator Kaine, if your ticket wins, what specifically are you going to do to unify the country and reassure the people who voted against you?",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1315,KAINE,That's a really important one.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1316,KAINE,"That may be the $64,000 question, because it has been a divisive campaign.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1317,KAINE,"And again, Hillary is running a campaign about stronger together, and Donald Trump -- and this is -- this is not directed at this man, except to the extent that he can't defend Donald Trump -- Donald Trump has run a campaign that's been about one insult after the next.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1318,KAINE,But we do have to bring the country together.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1319,KAINE,So here's what we'll do.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1320,KAINE,"Hillary Clinton was first lady, then senator for eight years and secretary of state.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1321,KAINE,And I served in the Senate.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1322,KAINE,"And I'm really amazed, Elaine, as I talk to Republican senators, how well they regard and respect Hillary Clinton.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1323,KAINE,She was on the Armed Services Committee.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1324,KAINE,She was on other committees.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1325,KAINE,"She worked across the aisle when she was first lady to get the CHIP program passed so that 8 million low-income kids have health insurance in this country, including 150,000 in Indiana.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1326,KAINE,She worked across the aisle after 9/11 to get health benefits for the first responders who bravely went into the towers and into the Pentagon.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1327,KAINE,"She worked to get benefits for -- TRICARE benefits for National Guard members, including Hoosiers and Virginians in the National Guard.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1328,KAINE,She has a track record of working across the aisle to make things happen.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1329,KAINE,"And, you know, Elaine, I have the same track record.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1330,KAINE,I was a governor of Virginia with two Republican houses.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1331,KAINE,"And in the Senate, I have good working relationships across the aisle.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1332,KAINE,"Because I think it's fine to be a Democrat or Republican or independent, but after Election Day, the goal is work together.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1333,KAINE,And Hillary Clinton has a track record of accomplishment across the aisle that will enable her to do just that when we work with the new Congress in January.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1334,QUIJANO,"Governor, how will you unify the country if you win?",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1335,PENCE,"Well, thank you, Elaine, and thanks for a great discussion...",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1336,KAINE,Absolutely.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1337,PENCE,tonight.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1338,PENCE,"Thank you, Senator.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1339,PENCE,This is a very challenging time in the life of our nation.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1340,PENCE,"Weakened America's place in the world after the leadership of Hillary Clinton and Barack Obama on the world stage has been followed by an economy that is truly struggling, stifled by an avalanche of more taxes, more regulation, Obamacare, the war on coal, and the kind of trade deals that have put American workers in the back seat.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1341,PENCE,"I think the best way that we can bring people together is through change in Washington, D.C.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1342,PENCE,"You know, I served in Washington, D.C., for 12 years in the Congress of the United States.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1343,PENCE,"And I served with many Republicans and Democrats, men and women of goodwill.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1344,PENCE,"The potential is there to really change the direction of this country, but it's going to take leadership to do it.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1345,PENCE,The American people want to see our nation standing tall on the world stage again.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1346,PENCE,"They want to see us supporting our military, rebuilding our military, commanding the respect of the world, and they want to see the American economy off to the races again.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1347,PENCE,They want to see an American comeback.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1348,PENCE,And Donald Trump's entire career has been about building.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1349,PENCE,"It's been about -- it's going through hardship just like a businessperson does and finding a way through smarts and ingenuity and resilience to fight forward and -- when Donald Trump becomes president of the United States, we're going to have a stronger America.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1350,PENCE,"When you hear him say he wants to make America great again, when we do that, I truly do believe the American people are going to be standing taller.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1351,PENCE,They're going to see that real change can happen after decades of just talking about it.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1352,PENCE,"And when that happens, the American people are going to stand tall, stand together, and we'll have the kind of unity that's been missing for way too long.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1353,QUIJANO,"All right, gentlemen, thank you so much.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1354,QUIJANO,This concludes the vice presidential debate.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1355,QUIJANO,"My thanks to the candidates, the commission, and to you for watching.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv

1356,QUIJANO,"Please tune in this Sunday for the second presidential debate at Washington University in St. Louis and the final debate on October 19th at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1357,QUIJANO,"From Farmville, Virginia, I'm Elaine Quijano of CBS News.",0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1358,QUIJANO,Good night.,0,20161005_vice_pres.tsv
1,RADDATZ,"Ladies and gentlemen the Republican nominee for president, Donald J. Trump, and the Democratic nominee for president, Hillary Clinton.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
2,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20161010_2pres.tsv
3,COOPER,Thank you very much for being here.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
4,COOPER,We're going to begin with a question from one of the members in our town hall.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
5,COOPER,Each of you will have two minutes to respond to this question.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
6,COOPER,"Secretary Clinton, you won the coin toss, so you'll go first.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
7,COOPER,Our first question comes from Patrice Brock.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
8,COOPER,Patrice?,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
9,QUESTION,"Thank you, and good evening.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
10,QUESTION,"The last debate could have been rated as MA, mature audiences, per TV parental guidelines.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

11,QUESTION,"Knowing that educators assign viewing the presidential debates as students' homework, do you feel you're modeling appropriate and positive behavior for today's youth?",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
12,CLINTON,"Well, thank you.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
13,CLINTON,Are you a teacher?,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

14,CLINTON,"Yes, I think that that's a very good question, because I've heard from lots of teachers and parents about some of their concerns about some of the things that are being said and done in this campaign.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
15,CLINTON,And I think it is very important for us to make clear to our children that our country really is great because we're good.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
16,CLINTON,"And we are going to respect one another, lift each other up.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

17,CLINTON,"We are going to be looking for ways to celebrate our diversity, and we are going to try to reach out to every boy and girl, as well as every adult, to bring them in to working on behalf of our country.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
18,CLINTON,I have a very positive and optimistic view about what we can do together.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

19,CLINTON,"That's why the slogan of my campaign is ""Stronger Together,"" because I think if we work together, if we overcome the divisiveness that sometimes sets Americans against one another, and instead we make some big goals -- and I've set forth some big goals, getting the economy to work for everyone, not just those at the top, making sure that we have the best education system from preschool through college and making it affordable, and so much else.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
20,CLINTON,"If we set those goals and we go together to try to achieve them, there's nothing in my opinion that America can't do.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
21,CLINTON,So that's why I hope that we will come together in this campaign.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
22,CLINTON,"Obviously, I'm hoping to earn your vote, I'm hoping to be elected in November, and I can promise you, I will work with every American.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
23,CLINTON,"I want to be the president for all Americans, regardless of your political beliefs, where you come from, what you look like, your religion.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1219,TRUMP,They'll make money.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1220,TRUMP,They'll pay off our national debt.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1221,TRUMP,"They'll pay off our tremendous budget deficits, which are tremendous.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1222,TRUMP,But we are putting our energy companies out of business.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1223,TRUMP,We have to bring back our workers.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1224,TRUMP,"You take a look at what's happening to steel and the cost of steel and China dumping vast amounts of steel all over the United States, which essentially is killing our steelworkers and our steel companies.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1225,TRUMP,We have to guard our energy companies.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1226,TRUMP,We have to make it possible.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1227,TRUMP,The EPA is so restrictive that they are putting our energy companies out of business.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1228,TRUMP,"And all you have to do is go to a great place like West Virginia or places like Ohio, which is phenomenal, or places like Pennsylvania and you see what they're doing to the people, miners and others in the energy business.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1229,TRUMP,It's a disgrace.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1234,CLINTON,"And actually -- well, that was very interesting.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1235,CLINTON,"First of all, China is illegally dumping steel in the United States and Donald Trump is buying it to build his buildings, putting steelworkers and American steel plants out of business.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1236,CLINTON,That's something that I fought against as a senator and that I would have a trade prosecutor to make sure that we don't get taken advantage of by China on steel or anything else.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1237,CLINTON,"You know, because it sounds like you're in the business or you're aware of people in the business -- you know that we are now for the first time ever energy-independent.",1,20161010_2pres.tsv
1238,CLINTON,We are not dependent upon the Middle East.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1239,CLINTON,But the Middle East still controls a lot of the prices.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1240,CLINTON,So the price of oil has been way down.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1241,CLINTON,"And that has had a damaging effect on a lot of the oil companies, right?",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1242,CLINTON,"We are, however, producing a lot of natural gas, which serves as a bridge to more renewable fuels.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1243,CLINTON,And I think that's an important transition.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1244,CLINTON,We've got to remain energy-independent.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1245,CLINTON,It gives us much more power and freedom than to be worried about what goes on in the Middle East.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1246,CLINTON,We have enough worries over there without having to worry about that.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1247,CLINTON,"So I have a comprehensive energy policy, but it really does include fighting climate change, because I think that is a serious problem.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1248,CLINTON,"And I support moving toward more clean, renewable energy as quickly as we can, because I think we can be the 21st century clean energy superpower and create millions of new jobs and businesses.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1249,CLINTON,But I also want to be sure that we don't leave people behind.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1250,CLINTON,"That's why I'm the only candidate from the very beginning of this campaign who had a plan to help us revitalize coal country, because those coal miners and their fathers and their grandfathers, they dug that coal out.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1251,CLINTON,A lot of them lost their lives.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1252,CLINTON,"They were injured, but they turned the lights on and they powered their factories.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1253,CLINTON,I don't want to walk away from them.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1254,CLINTON,So we've got to do something for them.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1255,COOPER,Secretary Clinton...,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1256,CLINTON,But the price of coal is down worldwide.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1257,CLINTON,So we have to look at this comprehensively.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1258,COOPER,Your time is up.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1259,CLINTON,And that's exactly what I have proposed.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1260,CLINTON,I hope you will go to HillaryClinton.com and look at my entire policy.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1261,COOPER,Time is up.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1265,RADDATZ,"We've sneaked in one more question, and it comes from Karl Becker.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1266,QUESTION,Good evening.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1267,QUESTION,"My question to both of you is, regardless of the current rhetoric, would either of you name one positive thing that you respect in one another?",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1268,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1269,RADDATZ,"Mr. Trump, would you like to go first?",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1270,CLINTON,"Well, I certainly will, because I think that's a very fair and important question.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1271,CLINTON,"Look, I respect his children.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1272,CLINTON,"His children are incredibly able and devoted, and I think that says a lot about Donald.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1273,CLINTON,"I don't agree with nearly anything else he says or does, but I do respect that.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1274,CLINTON,And I think that is something that as a mother and a grandmother is very important to me.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1275,CLINTON,"So I believe that this election has become in part so -- so conflict-oriented, so intense because there's a lot at stake.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1276,CLINTON,"This is not an ordinary time, and this is not an ordinary election.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1277,CLINTON,"We are going to be choosing a president who will set policy for not just four or eight years, but because of some of the important decisions we have to make here at home and around the world, from the Supreme Court to energy and so much else, and so there is a lot at stake.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1278,CLINTON,It's one of the most consequential elections that we've had.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1279,CLINTON,"And that's why I've tried to put forth specific policies and plans, trying to get it off of the personal and put it on to what it is I want to do as president.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1280,CLINTON,"And that's why I hope people will check on that for themselves so that they can see that, yes, I've spent 30 years, actually maybe a little more, working to help kids and families.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1281,CLINTON,And I want to take all that experience to the White House and do that every single day.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1282,RADDATZ,Mr. Trump?,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1284,TRUMP,"I don't know if it was meant to be a compliment, but it is a great -- I'm very proud of my children.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1285,TRUMP,"And they've done a wonderful job, and they've been wonderful, wonderful kids.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1286,TRUMP,So I consider that a compliment.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1287,TRUMP,I will say this about Hillary.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1288,TRUMP,She doesn't quit.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1289,TRUMP,She doesn't give up.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1290,TRUMP,I respect that.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1291,TRUMP,I tell it like it is.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1293,TRUMP,I disagree with much of what she's fighting for.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1294,TRUMP,I do disagree with her judgment in many cases.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1295,TRUMP,"But she does fight hard, and she doesn't quit, and she doesn't give up.",0,20161010_2pres.tsv
1296,TRUMP,And I consider that to be a very good trait.,0,20161010_2pres.tsv

1,WALLACE,"Good evening from the Thomas and Mack Center at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

2,WALLACE,"I'm Chris Wallace of Fox News, and I welcome you to the third and final of the 2016 presidential debates between Secretary of State Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
3,WALLACE,This debate is sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv

4,WALLACE,"The commission has designed the format: Six roughly 15-minute segments with two-minute answers to the first question, then open discussion for the rest of each segment.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
5,WALLACE,Both campaigns have agreed to those rules.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
6,WALLACE,"For the record, I decided the topics and the questions in each topic.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
7,WALLACE,None of those questions has been shared with the commission or the two candidates.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
8,WALLACE,The audience here in the hall has promised to remain silent.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
9,WALLACE,"No cheers, boos, or other interruptions so we and you can focus on what the candidates have to say.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
10,WALLACE,"No noise, except right now, as we welcome the Democratic nominee for president, Secretary Clinton, and the Republican nominee for president, Mr. Trump.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
11,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20161019_3pres.tsv
12,WALLACE,"Secretary Clinton, Mr. Trump, welcome.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
13,WALLACE,Let's get right to it.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
14,WALLACE,The first topic is the Supreme Court.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv

15,WALLACE,"You both talked briefly about the court in the last debate, but I want to drill down on this, because the next president will almost certainly have at least one appointment and likely or possibly two or three appointments.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
16,WALLACE,"Which means that you will, in effect, determine the balance of the court for what could be the next quarter century.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
17,WALLACE,"First of all, where do you want to see the court take the country?",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
18,WALLACE,"And secondly, what's your view on how the Constitution should be interpreted?",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
19,WALLACE,Do the founders' words mean what they say or is it a living document to be applied flexibly according to changing circumstances?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
20,WALLACE,"In this segment, Secretary Clinton, you go first.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
21,WALLACE,You have two minutes.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
22,CLINTON,"Thank you very much, Chris.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
23,CLINTON,And thanks to UNLV for hosting us.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
24,CLINTON,"You know, I think when we talk about the Supreme Court, it really raises the central issue in this election, namely, what kind of country are we going to be?",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
25,CLINTON,What kind of opportunities will we provide for our citizens?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
26,CLINTON,What kind of rights will Americans have?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
27,CLINTON,"And I feel strongly that the Supreme Court needs to stand on the side of the American people, not on the side of the powerful corporations and the wealthy.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

28,CLINTON,"For me, that means that we need a Supreme Court that will stand up on behalf of women's rights, on behalf of the rights of the LGBT community, that will stand up and say no to Citizens United, a decision that has undermined the election system in our country because of the way it permits dark, unaccountable money to come into our electoral system.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
29,CLINTON,I have major disagreements with my opponent about these issues and others that will be before the Supreme Court.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv

30,CLINTON,"But I feel that at this point in our country's history, it is important that we not reverse marriage equality, that we not reverse Roe v. Wade, that we stand up against Citizens United, we stand up for the rights of people in the workplace, that we stand up and basically say: The Supreme Court should represent all of us.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

31,CLINTON,"That's how I see the court, and the kind of people that I would be looking to nominate to the court would be in the great tradition of standing up to the powerful, standing up on behalf of our rights as Americans.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
32,CLINTON,And I look forward to having that opportunity.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
33,CLINTON,I would hope that the Senate would do its job and confirm the nominee that President Obama has sent to them.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
34,CLINTON,That's the way the Constitution fundamentally should operate.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
35,CLINTON,"The president nominates, and then the Senate advises and consents, or not, but they go forward with the process.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
36,WALLACE,"Secretary Clinton, thank you.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
37,WALLACE,"Mr. Trump, same question.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
38,WALLACE,Where do you want to see the court take the country?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
39,WALLACE,And how do you believe the Constitution should be interpreted?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
40,TRUMP,"Well, first of all, it's great to be with you, and thank you, everybody.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
41,TRUMP,The Supreme Court: It's what it's all about.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
42,TRUMP,"Our country is so, so -- it's just so imperative that we have the right justices.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

43,TRUMP,"Something happened recently where Justice Ginsburg made some very, very inappropriate statements toward me and toward a tremendous number of people, many, many millions of people that I represent.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
44,TRUMP,And she was forced to apologize.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
45,TRUMP,And apologize she did.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
46,TRUMP,"But these were statements that should never, ever have been made.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
47,TRUMP,"We need a Supreme Court that in my opinion is going to uphold the Second Amendment, and all amendments, but the Second Amendment, which is under absolute siege.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

48,TRUMP,"I believe if my opponent should win this race, which I truly don't think will happen, we will have a Second Amendment which will be a very, very small replica of what it is right now.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
49,TRUMP,"But I feel that it's absolutely important that we uphold, because of the fact that it is under such trauma.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
50,TRUMP,I feel that the justices that I am going to appoint -- and I've named 20 of them -- the justices that I'm going to appoint will be pro-life.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
51,TRUMP,They will have a conservative bent.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
52,TRUMP,They will be protecting the Second Amendment.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
53,TRUMP,"They are great scholars in all cases, and they're people of tremendous respect.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
54,TRUMP,They will interpret the Constitution the way the founders wanted it interpreted.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
55,TRUMP,"And I believe that's very, very important.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
56,TRUMP,I don't think we should have justices appointed that decide what they want to hear.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
57,TRUMP,"It's all about the Constitution of -- of -- and so important, the Constitution the way it was meant to be.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
58,TRUMP,And those are the people that I will appoint.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
59,WALLACE,"Mr. Trump, thank you.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
60,WALLACE,We now have about 10 minutes for an open discussion.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
61,WALLACE,"I want to focus on two issues that, in fact, by the justices that you name could end up changing the existing law of the land.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
62,WALLACE,"First is one that you mentioned, Mr. Trump, and that is guns.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
63,WALLACE,"Secretary Clinton, you said last year, let me quote, ""The Supreme Court is wrong on the Second Amendment.""",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
64,WALLACE,"And now, in fact, in the 2008 Heller case, the court ruled that there is a constitutional right to bear arms, but a right that is reasonably limited.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

66,WALLACE,What's wrong with that?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
67,CLINTON,"Well, first of all, I support the Second Amendment.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
68,CLINTON,I lived in Arkansas for 18 wonderful years.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
69,CLINTON,I represented upstate New York.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
70,CLINTON,I understand and respect the tradition of gun ownership.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
71,CLINTON,It goes back to the founding of our country.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
72,CLINTON,But I also believe that there can be and must be reasonable regulation.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
73,CLINTON,"Because I support the Second Amendment doesn't mean that I want people who shouldn't have guns to be able to threaten you, kill you or members of your family.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
74,CLINTON,"And so when I think about what we need to do, we have 33,000 people a year who die from guns.",1,20161019_3pres.tsv
75,CLINTON,"I think we need comprehensive background checks, need to close the online loophole, close the gun show loophole.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

76,CLINTON,There's other matters that I think are sensible that are the kind of reforms that would make a difference that are not in any way conflicting with the Second Amendment.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
77,CLINTON,You mentioned the Heller decision.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv

78,CLINTON,"And what I was saying that you referenced, Chris, was that I disagreed with the way the court applied the Second Amendment in that case, because what the District of Columbia was trying to do was to protect toddlers from guns and so they wanted people with guns to safely store them.",1,20161019_3pres.tsv
79,CLINTON,"And the court didn't accept that reasonable regulation, but they've accepted many others.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
80,CLINTON,So I see no conflict between saving people's lives and defending the Second Amendment.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
81,WALLACE,Let me bring Mr. Trump in here.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
82,WALLACE,"The bipartisan Open Debate Coalition got millions of votes on questions to ask here, and this was, in fact, one of the top questions that they got.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
83,WALLACE,How will you ensure the Second Amendment is protected?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
84,WALLACE,You just heard Secretary Clinton's answer.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
85,WALLACE,"Does she persuade you that, while you may disagree on regulation, that, in fact, she supports a Second Amendment right to bear arms?",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
86,TRUMP,"Well, the D.C. vs. Heller decision was very strongly -- and she was extremely angry about it.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
87,TRUMP,I watched.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
88,TRUMP,"I mean, she was very, very angry when upheld.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
89,TRUMP,And Justice Scalia was so involved.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
90,TRUMP,And it was a well-crafted decision.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
91,TRUMP,"But Hillary was extremely upset, extremely angry.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
92,TRUMP,And people that believe in the Second Amendment and believe in it very strongly were very upset with what she had to say.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
93,WALLACE,"Well, let me bring in Secretary Clinton.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
94,WALLACE,Were you extremely upset?,0,20161019_3pres.tsv

95,CLINTON,"Well, I was upset because, unfortunately, dozens of toddlers injure themselves, even kill people with guns, because, unfortunately, not everyone who has loaded guns in their homes takes appropriate precautions.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
96,CLINTON,"But there's no doubt that I respect the Second Amendment, that I also believe there's an individual right to bear arms.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
97,CLINTON,"That is not in conflict with sensible, commonsense regulation.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
98,CLINTON,"And, you know, look, I understand that Donald's been strongly supported by the NRA.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
99,CLINTON,The gun lobby's on his side.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
100,CLINTON,They're running millions of dollars of ads against me.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
101,CLINTON,"And I regret that, because what I would like to see is for people to come together and say: Of course we're going to protect and defend the Second Amendment.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
102,CLINTON,"But we're going to do it in a way that tries to save some of these 33,000 lives that we lose every year.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
103,WALLACE,"Let me bring Mr. Trump back into this, because, in fact, you oppose any limits on assault weapons, any limits on high- capacity magazines.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
104,WALLACE,You support a national right to carry law.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
105,WALLACE,"Why, sir?",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
106,TRUMP,"Well, let me just tell you before we go any further.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
107,TRUMP,"In Chicago, which has the toughest gun laws in the United States, probably you could say by far, they have more gun violence than any other city.",1,20161019_3pres.tsv
108,TRUMP,"So we have the toughest laws, and you have tremendous gun violence.",1,20161019_3pres.tsv
109,TRUMP,I am a very strong supporter of the Second Amendment.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
110,TRUMP,"And I am -- I don't know if Hillary was saying it in a sarcastic manner, but I'm very proud to have the endorsement of the NRA.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv
111,TRUMP,And it's the earliest endorsement they've ever given to anybody who ran for president.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
112,TRUMP,So I'm very honored by all of that.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv
113,TRUMP,We are going to appoint justices -- this is the best way to help the Second Amendment.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv

115,WALLACE,"Well, let's pick up on another issue which divides you and the justices that whoever ends up winning this election appoints could have a dramatic effect there, and that's the issue of abortion.",0,20161019_3pres.tsv

1276,TRUMP,But Obamacare has to go.,0,20161019_3pres.tsv

1189,TRUMP,Because I do want to solve the problem.,0,20170216_trump_press.tsv

1239,TRUMP,We’re going to try and stop crime.,0,20170216_trump_press.tsv
1240,TRUMP,"We’re not going to try and stop, we’re going to stop crime.",0,20170216_trump_press.tsv

1244,TRUMP,We lived in a divided nation.,0,20170216_trump_press.tsv

1,TRUMP,Thank you very much.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
2,TRUMP,"Mr. Speaker, Mr. Vice President, members of Congress, the First Lady of the United States —",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
3,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

4,TRUMP," — and citizens of America: Tonight, as we mark the conclusion of our celebration of Black History Month, we are reminded of our nation’s path towards civil rights and the work that still remains to be done.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
5,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

6,TRUMP,"Recent threats targeting Jewish community centers and vandalism of Jewish cemeteries, as well as last week’s shooting in Kansas City, remind us that while we may be a nation divided on policies, we are a country that stands united in condemning hate and evil in all of its very ugly forms.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
7,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
8,TRUMP,"Each American generation passes the torch of truth, liberty and justice in an unbroken chain all the way down to the present.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
9,TRUMP,That torch is now in our hands.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
10,TRUMP,And we will use it to light up the world.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
11,TRUMP,"I am here tonight to deliver a message of unity and strength, and it is a message deeply delivered from my heart.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
12,TRUMP,A new chapter —,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
13,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
14,TRUMP,— of American Greatness is now beginning.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
15,TRUMP,A new national pride is sweeping across our nation.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
16,TRUMP,And a new surge of optimism is placing impossible dreams firmly within our grasp.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
17,TRUMP,What we are witnessing today is the renewal of the American spirit.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
18,TRUMP,Our allies will find that America is once again ready to lead.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
19,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
20,TRUMP,"All the nations of the world — friend or foe — will find that America is strong, America is proud, and America is free.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
21,TRUMP,"In nine years, the United States will celebrate the 250th anniversary of our founding — 250 years since the day we declared our independence.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
22,TRUMP,It will be one of the great milestones in the history of the world.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
23,TRUMP,But what will America look like as we reach our 250th year?,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
24,TRUMP,What kind of country will we leave for our children?,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
25,TRUMP,I will not allow the mistakes of recent decades past to define the course of our future.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
26,TRUMP,"For too long, we’ve watched our middle class shrink as we’ve exported our jobs and wealth to foreign countries.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

27,TRUMP,"We’ve financed and built one global project after another, but ignored the fates of our children in the inner cities of Chicago, Baltimore, Detroit, and so many other places throughout our land.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
28,TRUMP,We’ve defended the borders of other nations while leaving our own borders wide open for anyone to cross and for drugs to pour in at a now unprecedented rate.,1,20170228_trump_address.tsv
29,TRUMP,"And we’ve spent trillions and trillions of dollars overseas, while our infrastructure at home has so badly crumbled.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
30,TRUMP,"Then, in 2016, the Earth shifted beneath our feet.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

31,TRUMP,"The rebellion started as a quiet protest, spoken by families of all colors and creeds — families who just wanted a fair shot for their children and a fair hearing for their concerns.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
32,TRUMP,"But then the quiet voices became a loud chorus as thousands of citizens now spoke out together, from cities small and large, all across our country.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

33,TRUMP,"Finally, the chorus became an earthquake, and the people turned out by the tens of millions, and they were all united by one very simple, but crucial demand: that America must put its own citizens first.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
34,TRUMP,Because only then can we truly make America great again.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
35,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
36,TRUMP,Dying industries will come roaring back to life.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
37,TRUMP,Heroic veterans will get the care they so desperately need.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
38,TRUMP,Our military will be given the resources its brave warriors so richly deserve.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
39,TRUMP,"Crumbling infrastructure will be replaced with new roads, bridges, tunnels, airports and railways gleaming across our very, very beautiful land.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
40,TRUMP,"Our terrible drug epidemic will slow down and, ultimately, stop.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
41,TRUMP,"And our neglected inner cities will see a rebirth of hope, safety and opportunity.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
42,TRUMP,"Above all else, we will keep our promises to the American people.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
43,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
44,TRUMP,"It’s been a little over a month since my inauguration, and I want to take this moment to update the nation on the progress I’ve made in keeping those promises.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

45,TRUMP,"Since my election, Ford, Fiat-Chrysler, General Motors, Sprint, Softbank, Lockheed, Intel, Walmart, and many others, have announced that they will invest billions of dollars in the United States and will create tens of thousands of new American jobs.",1,20170228_trump_address.tsv
46,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
47,TRUMP,"The stock market has gained almost $3 trillion in value since the election on November 8th, a record.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

48,TRUMP,"We’ve saved taxpayers hundreds of millions of dollars by bringing down the price of a fantastic — and it is a fantastic — new F-35 jet fighter, and we’ll be saving billions more on contracts all across our government.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
49,TRUMP,We have placed a hiring freeze on non-military and non-essential federal workers.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
50,TRUMP,We have begun to drain the swamp of government corruption by imposing a five-year ban on lobbying by executive branch officials and a lifetime ban —,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
51,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
52,TRUMP,— thank you — and a lifetime ban on becoming lobbyists for a foreign government.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
53,TRUMP,"We have undertaken a historic effort to massively reduce job-crushing regulations, creating a deregulation task force inside of every government agency.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
54,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
55,TRUMP,"And we’re imposing a new rule which mandates that for every one new regulation, two old regulations must be eliminated.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
56,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
57,TRUMP,We’re going to stop the regulations that threaten the future and livelihood of our great coal miners.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
58,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
59,TRUMP,We have cleared the way for the construction of the Keystone and Dakota Access Pipelines —,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
60,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
61,TRUMP,— thereby creating tens of thousands of jobs.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
62,TRUMP,And I’ve issued a new directive that new American pipelines be made with American steel.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
63,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
64,TRUMP,We have withdrawn the United States from the job-killing Trans-Pacific Partnership.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
65,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

66,TRUMP,"And with the help of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, we have formed a council with our neighbors in Canada to help ensure that women entrepreneurs have access to the networks, markets and capital they need to start a business and live out their financial dreams.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
67,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
68,TRUMP,"To protect our citizens, I have directed the Department of Justice to form a Task Force on Reducing Violent Crime.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

69,TRUMP,"I have further ordered the Departments of Homeland Security and Justice, along with the Department of State and the Director of National Intelligence, to coordinate an aggressive strategy to dismantle the criminal cartels that have spread all across our nation.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
70,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
71,TRUMP,"We will stop the drugs from pouring into our country and poisoning our youth, and we will expand treatment for those who have become so badly addicted.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
72,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
73,TRUMP,"At the same time, my administration has answered the pleas of the American people for immigration enforcement and border security.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
74,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

75,TRUMP,"By finally enforcing our immigration laws, we will raise wages, help the unemployed, save billions and billions of dollars, and make our communities safer for everyone.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
76,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
77,TRUMP,"We want all Americans to succeed, but that can’t happen in an environment of lawless chaos.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
78,TRUMP,We must restore integrity and the rule of law at our borders.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
79,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
80,TRUMP,"For that reason, we will soon begin the construction of a great, great wall along our southern border.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
81,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
82,TRUMP,"As we speak tonight, we are removing gang members, drug dealers, and criminals that threaten our communities and prey on our very innocent citizens.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
83,TRUMP,"Bad ones are going out as I speak, and as I promised throughout the campaign.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

84,TRUMP,"To any in Congress who do not believe we should enforce our laws, I would ask you this one question:  What would you say to the American family that loses their jobs, their income, or their loved one because America refused to uphold its laws and defend its borders?",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
85,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
86,TRUMP,"Our obligation is to serve, protect, and defend the citizens of the United States.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
87,TRUMP,We are also taking strong measures to protect our nation from radical Islamic terrorism.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
88,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

89,TRUMP,"According to data provided by the Department of Justice, the vast majority of individuals convicted of terrorism and terrorism-related offenses since 9/11 came here from outside of our country.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
90,TRUMP,"We have seen the attacks at home — from Boston to San Bernardino to the Pentagon, and, yes, even the World Trade Center.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
91,TRUMP,"We have seen the attacks in France, in Belgium, in Germany, and all over the world.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
92,TRUMP,"It is not compassionate, but reckless, to allow uncontrolled entry from places where proper vetting cannot occur.",1,20170228_trump_address.tsv
93,TRUMP,Those given the high honor of admission to the United States should support this country and love its people and its values.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
94,TRUMP,"It is not compassionate, but reckless to allow uncontrolled entry from places where proper vetting cannot occur.",1,20170228_trump_address.tsv
95,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
96,TRUMP,Those given the high honor of admission to the United States should support this country and love its people and its values.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
97,TRUMP,We cannot allow a beachhead of terrorism to form inside America.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
98,TRUMP,We cannot allow our nation to become a sanctuary for extremists.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
99,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

100,TRUMP,"That is why my administration has been working on improved vetting procedures, and we will shortly take new steps to keep our nation safe and to keep out those out who will do us harm.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
101,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

102,TRUMP,"As promised, I directed the Department of Defense to develop a plan to demolish and destroy ISIS — a network of lawless savages that have slaughtered Muslims and Christians, and men, and women, and children of all faiths and all beliefs.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
103,TRUMP,"We will work with our allies, including our friends and allies in the Muslim world, to extinguish this vile enemy from our planet.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
104,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

105,TRUMP,"I have also imposed new sanctions on entities and individuals who support Iran’s ballistic missile program, and reaffirmed our unbreakable alliance with the State of Israel.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
106,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
107,TRUMP,"Finally, I have kept my promise to appoint a justice to the United States Supreme Court, from my list of 20 judges, who will defend our Constitution.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
108,SYSTEM,(APPLAUSE),0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
109,TRUMP,I am greatly honored to have Maureen Scalia with us in the gallery tonight.,0,20170228_trump_address.tsv

111,TRUMP,"Thank you, Maureen.",0,20170228_trump_address.tsv
